loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en: Chreb, 42 years old and living in Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, is a married mother of five dependent children, two of whom are in school. She has been earning an income via rice farming and working for others for a fee to earn additional income for 22 years. Because her crop has been destroyed by insects, it has not grown well and she is able to earn a very low income. Now, she is leading a group of three to get a loan via VisionFund. With the loan, she will spend her portion to buy fertilizer to increase the crop’s productivity. She hopes to get a high yield to earn more income so that she can improve her lifestyle and keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase the crop’s productivity so that she can earn more income to keep sending her children to school.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is in his early 20s and is married with one small kid. He has been running a motorcycle business for three years now. He works from 12am to 9pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Simon’s fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy spares that were out of use and has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to take care of his family, repay the loan, reinvest in his business and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to improve his business by servicing his boda boda. He dreams of owning motorcycle garages.

Simon will make sure he pays back his loan within the loan schedule.

loans.use: to improve his business  by servicing his boda boda.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: This is 46-year-old Zainab. She is widowed and has one child aged seven years old. In 2006, Zainab established her palm oil and soft drinks business. She began her business because when her husband died she had nobody to help her so she decided to do business. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Zainab requires a loan in order to buy 2 drums of palm oil and soft drinks to improve her business.  She was unable to meet her target of opening another outlet but she improved on the livelihood of her family with the profit she saved. In the future, Zainab plans to open another outlet.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and soft drinks to improve her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cabbage, tomatoes, peppers, bananas, potatoes, onions, cucumbers, etc.

loans.name: Loeub's Group

texts.en:
Loeub, aged 36, is married and has three dependent children who need her support. Two of her children are being educated in school and the other one is too young to attend school. Living in Siem Reap province, Loeub is a rice farmer and she has owned a rice farming business for 18 years. Moreover, she is raising a pig to earn additional income. These two businesses earn her about 27,800 KHR per day and she can save approximately 11,100 KHR. The challenges to her business are that the rice fields are flooded and covered by weeds, which cause the rice crop to produce lower outputs.

Now, she has formed a group of two members to apply for a loan from VisionFund. The previous loan helped her to buy household supplies to use and support her children’s studying better. As the group leader, she will use her entire loan to buy organic fertilizer to help boost the crop productivity, hoping that she can improve their living conditions and continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to help boost the crop productivity to gain more profit to support her children's studying.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Mwari

texts.en:
Mwari is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past eight years, she has operated a mat weaving business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase paint and sewing materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase paints and sewing materials.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Kuña Guapa, es de la ciudad de Itá  está en su ciclo número 9 del programa de comité de mujeres, también dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Indalecia quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo viene mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Ella se dedica a la costura, tiene muy buena clientela que siempre le hace muchos pedidos, y con lo que obtiene por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia, dándoles una vida digna y sin privaciones como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas, botones y otros, para poder seguir con su trabajo, y confeccionando todo tipo de productos para poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is called Kuña Guapa. It is from the city of Itá and in its ninth loan cycle of the Women's Committee Program, which is also included in the poverty elimination program. One of the members is Indalecia, who, through sacrifice and hard work, has continued to better her living conditions.

She works in sewing and has very good clients who always order a lot from her. With what she earns from her job, she helps her family, giving them a decent life without the deprivation she had to go through.

She asks for this loan to be able to buy fabrics, threads, elastics, buttons, etc., in order to continue to work and make all types of products to be able to fulfill her clients orders.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, elastics, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Surayo

texts.en: Surayo is a careful mother. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1973. She is married and lives in a remote district with her family. She is working at a beauty salon “Sitora” which means a star. She has more than ten years' experience in this field. For some period of time she felt bad. She analyzed herself at a medical clinic and they found that she has some problems with her health. She has no money to be treated at a medical clinic. She appealed to IMON and Kiva asking for a loan to pay for her treatment at a hospital. She awaits your kindness and support. The loan will help her to be healed and continue her activity.

loans.use: to pay for her treatment at a hospital.

loans.name: Sreang's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Prey Veng province, Sreang is 40 years old and married. She has three dependent children: the older one is in school, while the remaining two are too young to attend school.

She grows rice as the main business of her family while her husband is working as a construction worker to earn additional income. Together, they earn about 12 USD per day to support the family’s needs. Sreang has been involved in the farming business for 21 years already.

Anyway, this business is in a hardship for there is not enough rainfall and the crop produces lower outputs. From the previous loan that she obtained, she has used it to support her family in a timely manner and buy school supplies for children.

For this time, Sreang, who is the leader of a group of four members, will use some of her loan to buy organic fertilizer to boost the crops’ growth and the remaining loan will be used to pay plowing fees and to buy fuel for the pumping machine and construction materials for her husband’s business.

She hopes that her living conditions will be improved and all of her children can go to school until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to boost the crops' productivity in order to raise up her income to keep supporting her child's studying.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He operates a retail shop of general merchandise which he supplements with income from growing crops. This helps him look after his family. He would love to expand his business but he faces a threat of inadequate capital to buy material inputs and that make profits low. His products are also affected by a high rate of perishability. He is requesting a loan to buy more tomatoes, ripe bananas and bread to sell.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, ripe bananas and bread to sell.

loans.name: Rose.

texts.en:
Rose, a mother of two, is her family's sole provider. Hardworking and strategic, she operates a retail shop selling mobile phone accessories and phones. This has raised her income level. 

Rose has requested this loan to buy more mobile phones to sell. If granted, nothing will stop her from repaying it.

loans.use: buy more mobile phones to sell

loans.name: Ural

texts.ru: Урал молодой, спокойный мужчина в возрасте 37 лет, женат имеет четверо детей. Он родился в семье дехканов и продолжает заниматься этим. Ему в этом деле также помогает его жена. Они вместе сеют разные овощи и потом когда они созревают продают их на базаре, а зимой берут овощи из теплице и продают. Они мало зарабатывают но благодарны этим. Их семья большая и очень дружная. Вместе они почти не отдыхают, целыми днями у них есть работа. Сейчас в такое жаркое время года у них сломался холодильник а продукты ставить некуда. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд за кредитом и заранее благодарен за поддержку!!!
texts.en: Ural is a quiet young man, aged 37. He is married and has four children. He was born in a family of farmers and continues to be a farmer himself. His wife helps him with his work. Together they plant various vegetables and then sell them at the bazaar when they ripen. In the winter they bring vegetables from their greenhouse to sell. They earn little, but are thankful for what they have. Their family is large and very close-knit. They almost never rest because they have work to do all day. Now, in the hottest time of the year, their refrigerator broke and they have nowhere to store their groceries. This is why he applied for a loan with Arvand. He is grateful for the support!

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Sohiba

texts.ru:
Сохиба  молодая женщина  33 лет.  Она замужем  и имеет троих детей.  Она работает кредитным экспертом. Её муж уехал на заработки в Россию. Она решила получить второе высшее образование. Поэтому она решила поступить в университет. Но для оплаты договора обучения ей не хватает собственных средств. 
Она обратилась в Арванд за кредитом. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Sohiba is a young woman, aged 33. She is married and has three children. She is a loan officer and her husband left to work in Russia. She decided to get a second degree and applied to university. However, she does not have enough money to pay for the tuition. She applied for a loan with Arvand and thanks them in advance for the support.

loans.use: to pay for her education

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a hard working married farmer living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He also practices the rearing of cattle to earn extra income. It was not easy for him to start up the business but he was inspired by the need to educate his children and developing himself to become a modern farmer. Just like most farmers in Uganda, he faces a challenge of inadequate capital. He is requesting a loan to buy manure and seedlings for planting this season.

loans.use: to buy manure and seedlings for planting this season.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman; she has three children, all of whom attend school. Mwanasiti owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanasiti has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business. In addition she also operates a cloth selling business that earns her another source of income.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Dayyabu

texts.en:
Dayyabu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kada Kada village. Dayyabu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Dayyabu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market, such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Dayyabu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to purchase a motorbike and do business with it.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields.

loans.name: Kok Can Ikwer Group

texts.en:
Agnes is a resident of Akalo, near Lira. She is 27 years of age, a single mother with 2 children who are going to school.

She is a businesswoman who deals in bricklaying. She faces difficulty in paying school fees for her two children and works hard to put food on the table.

She has applied for a loan of UGX 700,000 through the group from Ugafode Microfinance Ltd. and she is grateful to Uafode and Kiva funders for their support.

The group appreciates the support rendered to them.

loans.use: to buy stock of daily household use items for trade.

loans.name: Sobirjon

texts.ru:
Собирчон   трудолюбивый   мужчина  40 лет. Он очень трудолюбивый, милосердный, и весёлый    человек  по  характеру. Его уважают все соседи и родственники. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Собирчон по профессии плотник. Его жена портниха.  
Собирчон обратился в Арванд за кредитом. Так как внезапно его племянник заболел и ему требуется лечение. Его племянник не в состоянии оплатить свое лечение. Собирчон решил помочь племяннику. Он надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en:
Sobirjon is a hardworking man, aged 40. He is very hardworking, compassionate, and cheerful by nature. His is respected by all his neighbors and relatives. He is married and has three children. Sobirjon is a carpenter by profession and his wife is a seamstress. 

Sobirjon applied for a loan with Arvand because his nephew suddenly got sick and needs treatment. His nephew is unable to pay for the treatment, so Sobirjon decided to help. He hopes for a positive outcome.

loans.use: to pay for his nephew's medical treatment

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en:
Thaer is a 41-year-old married father of four children, a Palestinian refugee who started nine years ago working as a taxi driver to cover his family's increasing needs and expenses.
Thaer is the sole earner of the family, and due to the poor social and living conditions of Palestinian refugees in Lebanon, he is trying hard to improve the living conditions of his family.
Today, Thaer is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car which he will invest in starting a small car trading business. 
This business will help him  make sure that his family will live in a very good condition and with a better income. 
He hopes that one day in the future he can buy his own taxi registered license, and save what he is paying for renting to buy a new car of his own.

loans.use: to buy a car which he will invest in starting a small car trading business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more milking cows.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mila is 49 years old and has two children are presently in school.

Mila has a buy and sell used clothes business in the Philippines. Mila requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more boxes of used clothes like t-shirt, pants, blouse, etc to sell on her stall.

Mila has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of used clothes like t-shirt, pants, blouse, etc to sell to her stall

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Myrna works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Myrna is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle transportation business.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for the maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Karago Tweheyo Tukole Group

texts.en:
Sentiriyo is a member of Karago Tweheyo Tukole Group where members guarantee each other in order to obtain a loan facility. He is involved in selling fresh foods like yellow bananas, oranges, passion fruits and cabbages and is also a farmer growing food crops that add him more income for his family of nine members, that is 7 children and his wife. He has been running this business for a period of ten years now operating it in a busy market located in Fort Portal Uganda, western region.

He is faced with challenges of stock perishability and fluctuating market prices that reduces his overall profit. In future, he is looking forward to building a residential house for his family and educate all his children to higher levels of learning and grow various crops like coffee and poultry farming too.He has asked for a loan to buy yellow bananas, oranges, passion-fruit and cabbages to sell.

loans.use: to buy yellow bananas, oranges, passion fruits and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is involved in farming and running a retail shop selling items like sugar, salt, match boxes, cooking oil, soap and biscuits as his major economic activity. He is faced with challenges of low capital and defaulters that hinder progress of his business. However, he has a vision of increasing his family income. He has asked for a loan to add stock of general merchandise like sugar, salt, match boxes, cooking oil, soap and biscuits in his retail shop to sell. His shop is located on a busy street in town and with increased capital, James dreams of becoming a prominent businessman in his home town.

loans.use: to add stock of general merchandise like sugar, salt, match boxes, cooking oil, soap and biscuits in his retail shop to sell.

loans.name: Deisy Lorena

texts.es: Deisy es una joven residente en el municipio de Chocontá una población del Departamento de Cundinamarca, en donde inició su vida comercial por intermedio de catálogos especializados para ofertar productos de uso personal.  Su idea de negocio inició al considerar que su madre tenía muchas amistades y que podrían ser futuros compradores, así poco a poco fue siniestrándoles el catálogo y empezó a realizar ventas.  Ella ofrece una línea amplia de cosméticos, perfumes, cremas, prendas de vestir y demás productos de la oferta, sin embargo como su capital le es insuficiente para cancelar las facturas, ella aplicó a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar prendas de vestir de encargos de sus clientes y cancelar una factura.  Con esta inversión se capitalizará para responder a la demanda de sus clientes.  Su meta a futuro es abrir un local comercial y seguir estudiando para ser una profesional.
texts.en: Deisy is a young woman who lives in the town of Chocontá, a town in the department of Cundinamarca. She started her commercial life there through specialized catalogs that offer personal use products. Her business idea started when she considered that her mother had a lot of friends and that these could be future buyers. LIttle by little, she showed them the catalog and started to make sales. She offers a wide array of cosmetics, perfumes, creams, items of clothing and other products that are on sale. Nonetheless, since she has insufficient capital to pay of the invoices, she applied for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy items of clothing to fill her customers' orders and pay off an invoice. With this investment, she will be capitalized so she can respond to her customers' demands. Her goals for the future are to open a commercial locale and continue her education so she can graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy items of clothing ordered by her customers and to pay off a bill.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is a married lady with children. She is a repeat client of Ugafode Microfinance who has acquired loans several times. She is a hardworking and self-driven lady with high prospects of development.

She deals in home plastics materials, and she is grateful to Ugafode Microfinance and Kiva funders, as her business has progressively increased in size and the number of her clients has increased tremendously.

Her future dream is to set up other nearby branches in towns to increase her source of income and support her family.

loans.use: to add more stock to her business.

loans.name: Tarika

texts.en: Tarika is requesting another loan to buy inventory for the little restaurant she runs.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her little restaurant.

loans.name: Sali

texts.en:
Sali is 55 years old and comes from an Ashakali minority community.

In order to earn a living, he collects bottles that he then sells for recycling. He uses a tractor to help him transport his collection and he works very hard all day long. Although his wife has a small income from her employment, they make very little money and are very poor, living in terrible conditions. His family includes five children and he is not even able to adequately provide for their basic living needs.

During the winter, rain and snow are able to enter the home through the damaged walls, creating mold. Often, his children get very ill from their unhealthy living conditions and they are often cold and uncomfortable.

For the first time, Sali is requesting a loan to renovate the house and facade the walls. He really appreciates the lenders' support and the chance to improve the lives of his children.

loans.use: to renovate the house and facade the walls

loans.name: Manushaqe

texts.en: Manushaqe, or 'Violet' in English, is 34 and a married mother of three; 16, 10 and 10 who live in the rural northern part of the country. She has been doing agriculture for a living and she needs your financial help to buy a dairy cow and expand the existing animal stable. Currently, Violet has a dairy cow and six sheep yet she doesn't sell milk because it's not enough except a calf/year and she also owns 4 dynym of agricultural land where she plants mostly corn and some veggies for the family. In addition to what she does to earn a living, her husband makes $200/month and her father-in-law a monthly retirement pension of $100.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow and expand the animal stable

loans.name: Nhyira Traders Group

texts.en:
Agnes is a 50 year old woman. She is from Assin Fosu in the Assin North District of Central Region of Ghana. Agnes is the leader and group representative of Nhyira Traders. She is a married woman with 5 children. All the 5 children are currently in school. Agnes’s husband is a commercial driver who has been very supportive to the wife. Agnes is a small scale trader who sells cosmetic products like, pomades, powder, perfumes, and hair relaxers in the local market. She has been in the kind of business for 11 years. Agnes started selling on a table and with the timely intervention of the field partner with microfinance support, she now has her own shop.

She has a palm plantation which serves as her additional source of income. Agnes has been with the field partner for 5 years and this is her 9th loan cycle. She has a good repayment record. Agnes has a challenge of additional working capital finance to keep adequate stock of cosmetics to meet the demand of her customers. She wants to see massive improvement in her business and also become a wholesaler in the next 5 years. Agnes will use the loan to buy more cosmetics on large scale for resale. She intends to use part of her business income to support her husband to cater for the education of their children. Agnes thanks all her Kiva micro lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics wholesale for resale.

loans.name: 15 De Julio Group

texts.es:
El grupo 15 de Julio; está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo, donde todas están luchando por mejorar sus vidas a través del trabajo unido.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rosa, quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de su despensa está luchando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que está sacrificándose por una mejor calidad de vida.
La Sra. Rosa  solicita el préstamo para la compra de productos como leche, aceite, fideos, azúcar, harina entre otros; lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The "15 de Julio" communal bank is in its first season of the women's committee program. It is a new group where they are all struggling to improve their lives by working together.

One of the members is Rosa, who through her effort and endless work and by means of her grocery store, she is fighting to improve the living conditions for her and her loved ones. She is a very hard-working woman who is making sacrifices for a better quality of life.

Rosa is requesting the loan to buy products such as milk, oil, noodles, sugar, flour and other items. These items will help her to achieve her business plan, which will allow her to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy products such as milk, oil, noodles, sugar, flour and other items.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 49 years old, married with three children.

Ninfa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, snacks foods and etc.

Ninfa has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Ninfa aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, snacks foods and etc

loans.name: Zira

texts.en:
Zira wants to buy a dairy cow; so far she has had none.

"I have grandchildren and they need some dairy. We have been buying a bit of milk from our neighbors and made yogurt; not only was it expensive, but was not enough either," said Zira during her disbursement interview.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Martë

texts.en:
Marte is a 57-year-old widowed mother of five who needs your compassion to help her financially so that her son goes ahead with a scheduled organ surgery. About four years ago her husband passed away from some organ failure and so did one of her sons almost a year later. When the other son was diagnosed with the same illness, she was clearly devastated. "So far, all of my children have been diagnosed with the same illness. I have been let known that all of my kids need the same surgery. I am heart broken and am falling apart. I don't know how to hold myself together. I already lost two and God forbid, i pray that nothing else will happen to my children". This was her conversation with the loan officer who disbursed Marte.

Marte earns a living by renting out two premises; a shop to a phone company and another place to a boutique and a disability income of approximately $100/month for each child.

loans.use: to pay for her son's scheduled organ surgery.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 33-year-old woman who lives with her boyfriend and their five-year-old daughter. In her familly, everybody plays a different role, her daughter goes to the kindergarten, her boyfriend works at a food stand in the street market, and she has a clothes stand in the same market.

Elizabeth and her boyfriend are hard-working people who daily make an effort to make sure that their daughter will have a bright future.

Elizabeth started her stand with no more than an iron fence that she used to hang the clothes, but today she owns a big stand, with a considerable size. But, she wants to make it even bigger.

In order to make this possible she wants to take a MXN 10,000 (ten thousand pesos) loan, to buy more shirts, pants, jeans, and all kinds of clothes that she will sell later.

At Kubo financiero, we are confident that she will succeed with project because of her tenacity and the bonds she shares with her family. Elizabeth said, "we may be a small family, but we are very close and we have got short-term goals."

She said that her boyfriend will help to cover the loan. He understands that she wants to make this dream come true, so he is willing to support her as much as possible.

loans.use: to buy clothes and fill her stock.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is a first-year student at Kepler. He grew up in a household that struggled with meeting basic needs and because of that, strives to be an entrepreneur to lift up his family and his community. Due to his exceptional academic record and test scores, he was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year.

Jean Baptiste chose to attend Kepler because he felt it would best provide the skills he needed for a career in business. He also believes Kepler is one of the few institutions that provide the financial support that students like him need. He plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. 

As he begins life at university, he hopes to improve his communication skills by working in groups. He will be the first in his family to attend college.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a 26-year old college graduate who lives in La Carlota City. She belongs to a family of 9. Her father works as a farm laborer and her mother is a housewife. Rosemarie is the 5th child in the family with 4 older and 2 younger siblings. Her older brothers and sister are already married, while her 2 other brothers work as a company driver and in a local fast food. Her younger brother is still studying in high school. The family’s total monthly income of Php16000 ($347) is not enough to provide even for the family’s basic needs.

Rosemarie needs to earn income that’s why she applied in Bagosphere’s 2-month training program. Rosemarie wants to improve her communication skills, have a stable job and a high salary. Your generosity in funding her loan will help Rosemarie have a better life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Jati Indah Group

texts.en:
One month earlier, Ni Wayan, head of the Jati Indah group already informed the members to prepare for repayment, with 30.000.000 IDR loan amount and number of member 10. Ni Wayan succeed to sell all of her piglets. With the profit of 2.500.000 IDR, she is very grateful to the acquisition and will use the profits for her children education and also their daily needs.
With 10 members, the Jati Indah group continue their loan of 30.000.000 IDR and each receive 3.000.000 IDR. They decided to continue the loan until they have enough saving.
Ni Wayan use her loan to purchase feed and renovate her pigpens. Now she has a new local sow. She hopes her plan will come true and she can improve her business by sells piglets to other breeder.
2 members not pictured because of illness.

loans.use: to purchase feed and renovate the pigpens

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Altantsetseg, 47 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has hearing disability and currently helps her husband who repairs and decorates interior of accommodations. Their two children both go to high school. Her husband began building house on their land several years ago. But due to shortage of cash, her husband couldn't complete the house.

So she is requesting a loan of 1500 USD to buy necessary building materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam in order to complete their house before the extreme Mongolian winter. By doing so her family will live in comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollutant into air.

loans.use: to complete her house before winter

loans.name: Allin Kausay Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ALLIN KAUSAY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria ella es casada y tiene 62 años y tiene 7 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de hotel, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong the communal bank “Allin Kausay.” This bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the Cusco province and the department of Cusco.

Sixty-two-year-old member Maria is married and has 7 children. She works in her restaurant business, making different dishes like baked chicken, and meat soups and stir-fries.

She works from 8:00a.m. until 6:00p.m. She has been working in this business for 8 years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a restaurant.

This member is asking for a loan to buy products to cook, like rice, vegetables, and chicken.

The other members work in other businesses, including the hotel business, selling clothes, grocery store business, and restaurant business.

This member thanks those who have formed part of this dream through this medium, and she promises to fulfill her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: Guilly

texts.en: Guilly is a member of Paglaum MPC for five years already. He maintains his membership with the cooperative by paying his obligations on time without defaults. He is grateful to the cooperative because he can still avail its services despite of his age. This time, he avails a loan to pay for medical check up & purchase of maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to pay for medical check up & purchase of maintenance medicines

loans.name: Gumersinda

texts.en: Gumersinda has been into selling vegetables into their local public market for 30 years. She learns this business activity from her mother way back many years ago where she spends her vacant time at the market. Now that she has her own family, she works hard to gain for her family. This time, she avails a loan of PHP 10,000.00 to purchase vegetables & root crops to sell.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables & root crops to sell

loans.name: Tirso

texts.en: In the year 2012, Tirso learned Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, he tried his luck and borrowed a loan to jump start his corn production. After several months, he was able to return his borrowed capital. To this day, Tirso feels he owes his good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used for his business. Recently, he availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Tirso wishes to sustain his business and be able to supply corn in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en: Agripina is a member of Paglaum MPC since 2002. She had enjoyed all the services the cooperative have offered including insurance services. She successfully repaid her loans without records of default. This time, she loans an amount to redeem a pawned parcel of land.

loans.use: to redeem a pawned parcel of land.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a pensioner member of Paglaum MPC who had availed loans services since 2008. She is 85 years old, widow with 6 adult age children. Maria is glad that she is supported by the cooperative from the tuition fee of her grand children up to her personal needs. Recently, she avails a loan of PHP 8,000.00 to pay for medical check up & purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to pay for medical check up & purchase maintenance medicines

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy was able to buy sacks of rice, cases of soft drinks and other grocery items as Center for Community Transformation (CCT) was able to approve her previous loan that she applied. She wants to thank CCT and lenders for their generosity in helping people financially to run a business. Without their help she’ll not be able to buy bulk quantity of products to add for the business. Most of all, She wants to thank God for providing CCT and lenders as a medium of blessing to her. 

She’s determined to succeed in the business as she has three children to support and other expenses that needs to be paid. She spends her whole day managing the variety store and praying that God will send more customers and bigger profit. Nancy is applying for another loan of P30, 000 to buy stocks of grocery items, bottled drinks and sacks of rice.

Nancy is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy stocks of grocery items, bottled drinks and sacks of rice for her variety store business.

loans.name: Sambou's Group

texts.en:
Sambou’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province, in Cambodia.

Sambou makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water to her family.

loans.name: Shinoun's Group

texts.en:
Shinoun’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Shinoun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer and teacher to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yeyson Dorian

texts.es: Yeyson es un joven visionario que direccionó sus deseos de ser un empresario independiente al incorporarse en el sector de los alimentos en el año 2005, idea que fortaleció al hallar oportunidad de negocio entre los habitantes que salían en las mañanas a realizar ejercicios o a practicar algún deporte;  ofreciendo jugos naturales una bebida que satisfacía sanamente los deseos de nutrir el cuerpo, fue el inicio de sus sueño de prosperidad. Poco a poco y de acuerdo a las necesidades de sus clientes fue incorporando comidas rápidas, asados y almuerzos.  Sus clientes diariamente llegan hasta su local a partir de las 2 p.m. hasta las 12 a.m. y nunca le faltan clientes, pues sostiene que un gran número de habitantes de la ciudad laboran en estos horarios y prefieren las comidas rápidas, no sólo les resultan tentadoras, sino también económicas y prácticas.  Yeison planea adquirir un carro de perros calientes y aumentar su surtido de materias primas, proyecto que financiará con los recursos del primer credikiva que está tramitando con la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y aspira a largo plazo adecuar su negocio con la mejor infraestructura que le permita ser reconocido en el sector. Su visión para el futuro es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Yeyson is a young visionary who focused his attention on his desire to become an independent businessman getting involved in the food business in 2005. This idea was reinforced discovering a business opportunity in the inhabitants who got out in the morning to exercise or play a sport. He offered natural juices, a drink that satisfied their desire to nourish the body in a healthy manner. This was the beginning of his dreams of prosperity.

Replying to the needs of his clients little by little he started to add fast foods, barbecued foods and lunches. His clients arrive daily at his business starting from 2 pm until 12 midnight and he is never without customers. He maintains that a lot of inhabitants work during these hours and prefer fast food, not only as it is tempting, but also economical and practical.

Yeyson plans to acquire a hot-dog cart and increase his supply of raw materials.He will finance this project with the resources from his first loan from Kiva processed by the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He hopes in the long term to outfit his business with better infrastructure which will allow him to be recognized in the sector. His future dream is to have his own house.

loans.use: to acquire a hot-dog cart.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en: Allan has signed up her membership with PMPC and availed the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. He is thankful for the capital it extends to a small time loaner like him. Allan is able to turn the tide in his favor and has made good sales these days. He wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, he availed a loan to restock store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce. In the future, he hopes to mount a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce

loans.name: Yat's Group

texts.en:
Yat’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Yat works as a farmer and she also does extra work as a teacher and soldier to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Kimhorn's Group

texts.en:
Kimhorn’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Kimhorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en:
Nary’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Nary makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farm laborer and factory laborer to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sokly's Group

texts.en:
Sokly’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokly makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Visal's Group

texts.en:
Visal’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Visal makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sophorn's Group

texts.en:
Sophorn’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sophorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Las Mañanitas Group

texts.es: Grupo ¨Las Mañanitas¨, esta coordinado por Maria Elena, de 45 años, soltera, y trabajando 16 ciclos con ADIM, esta nuevamente para solicitar un crédito para poder seguir manteniendo la producción de su negocio. Dedicada a la venta de tortilla, nacatamal y comida desde hace 19 años, negocio que obtuve del apoyo recibido de ADIM. Con la ayuda de su hija y un ayudante, seguirá saliendo adelante. Ahora requiere para la compra de tortillas, maíz, leña, arroz, café, guineo, pollo, carne, reposterías, azúcar, jabon y gaseosas. Las otras integrantes son Paubla de 49 años quien posee una pulpería en su hogar. Jorge de 57 años a la venta de granos básicos.
texts.en:
Las Mañanitas Group is coordinated by María Elena. She's 45 years old and single, and has worked with ADIM for 16 loan cycles.

María Elena is requesting a new loan so she can keep up production in her business. She has sold tortillas, nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales], and food for 19 years. She started the business with support she received from ADIM. With the help of her daughter and an assistant, she will continue to get ahead. Now she needs to buy tortillas, corn, firewood, rice, coffee, bananas, chicken, meat, pastries, sugar, soap, and soda.

The other members are Paubla, 49, who has a grocery store in her home, and Jorge, 57, who sells basic grains.

loans.use: to buy tortillas, corn, firewood, rice, coffee, bananas, chicken, meat, pastries, sugar, soap, and soda

loans.name: Clair

texts.en:
Clair is 34 years old and a new member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She’s a mother of two children both are in the elementary level. She and her husband are working to earn a living. Her husband, Oliver works in a warehouse while Clair is selling toys and ready-to-wear clothes for 5 years now, and earning for about P15, 000 every month in doing the business. 

Clair is thankful that God gave them sources of income to support their day-to-day living. She dreams of having her own variety store and boutique to sell her items since currently her customers are just her neighbors and friends. She wants her business to be patronized by many. To earn more profit, Clair decided to apply for a P10, 000 loan to add grocery items for variety store business and shirt, pants and such for her buy and sell business.

Clair has been consistent attending CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners, this made her to become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: To add grocery items for her variety store and shirt, pants and such for her buy and sell business.

loans.name: Liberato

texts.en: Liberato is 72 years old, married with 1 child of adult age from Dipolog City. He is a retired national police who had rendered his dedicated service for almost 35 years. He learns about Paglaum MPC and sign up for membership and becomes regular depositor. Liberato believes that he is in the right track when he decided to put his pension in the cooperative. Recently, due to his ailments, availed a loan of PHP 25,000.00 to pay for medical check up & purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to pay for medical check up & purchase maintenance medicines

loans.name: Hmaw Eing Village Group

texts.en:
Featured borrower, Han lives in Hmaw Eing Village and is a farmer. He has also grown ducks;a secondary business and pigs; for savings. Han's wife sorts out the house chores and also takes care of the livestock. The couple work very hard, not to be harsh on the ducks as it affects their production rates. Ducks need to get nutritious and high quality feeds that Han is planning to purchase with Proximity's loan. This loan is very important for Han's family since they primarily only do livestock farming business. He is an expert and have confidence at certain business, as he is experienced of 15 years at duck farming.

Proximity's loan will support 29 duck raisers whom have aimed to purchase ducks and also the quality feeds. Above picture, are some of the members from Hmaw Eing Village, named; Han, Mya, Khin and Yu.

The village is based at near Myanmar Delta landforms, and since it's near river, the main business is crop farming. For savings, they also raise livestock.

loans.use: to purchase high quality feeds for their ducks, which supports 29 duck farmers in the village

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 49 years old and has three children. Perlita is married and has two children who are in school.

Perlita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Perlita requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins for her pigs and other supplies to raise livestock.

Perlita has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Perlita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins for her pigs and other supplies to raise livestock

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick used his previous loan to buy fertilizers for his farm. He is a married man and lives in Kamwenge, Uganda.

To support his family he has continued to grow bananas, but also sells other produce such as coffee on the side to supplement his income. With the loan Patrick was able to increase his harvests, having put fertilizers on his banana plantation. His challenges as a farmer are those of soil exhaustion, unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuations of the products he deals in. He hopes to become a more modernized farmer.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farm

loans.name: Nency

texts.en:
Nency is 45 years old and married with three children, two of them are still in school, Nency works very hard to provide for them.

Nency runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, breads, eggs, peanuts and etc.

Nency has been in this business for 6 years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, breads, eggs, peanuts and etc

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is married with five children. He operates a retail shop and also farms to supplement his income. Through, this, Jacob is able to meet his family needs, like paying school fees for his children and carry on with his businesses without touching capital. However he faces a challenge of competition.

Jacob wants to fight that challenge by buying a deep freezer and adding soft drinks in his shop, basing on him being in a busy place, and the weather being so hot .Now the challenge is the money he has saved not being enough to do that. He now requests for money to top up his savings to buy a buy a deep freezer for his shop.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer for his shop.

loans.name: Asaad

texts.en:
Asaad is a 50-year-old married Palestinian refugee, the father of four children. Asaad has worked in the transportation business for thirty years now. He transports students and employees, in addition to picking up passengers. His business is requested in his region since most of the residents can't afford to buy their own car.

To develop his business, Mohamad is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to make necessary maintenance to his car before the coming winter season to keep his business in a good condition. He hopes to stay capable of developing his family's living in a well managed way.

loans.use: To make necessary maintenance to his car before the coming winter season to keep his business in a good condition.

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.en: Dilovar is a capable guy. He was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1996 and he is single and lives with his parents. He has a big family, they are 8. His brother and father are working, but the rest of their family is not. This year he graduated his high school and entered university. He is interested in Finance and Credit.  He tries to be active and communicable with teachers and students. He appealed to IMON asking financial support to pay his higher education costs. He awaits Kiva lenders kindness and support. He wishes to get special knowledge and graduate with excellence.

loans.use: to pay his higher education costs in Finance and Credit.

loans.name: El Futuro Group

texts.es:
Por 23 ciclos se encuentra el grupo ¨El Fututo¨, quienes solicitan financiamiento para poder emerger sus negocios, y así brindarle una mejor calidad a todos sus seres queridos como lo es su familia. 
Coordinado por Marta Elena, de 56 años, casada y con dos hijos de 17 y 20, quien el mayor de ellos esta cursando la universidad. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada, cosméticos y estilistas. Desea del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de pantalones para dama y varones, cosméticos como lápiz labiales, cremas y más. 
Las otras socias son Celia, dedicada al destace de cerdo y a la preparación de nacatamales. Martha dedicada a la elaboración de comida fritanguera, sopas y refrescos para obtener ganancias que le permitan mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
El Futuro has been a group for 23 loan cycles. They request loans to be able to build their businesses and give all their loved ones, such as their families, greater quality.

Marta Elena, 56, is the coordinator. She's married and has two children, 17 and 20, the older of whom is in college. She earns a living selling new and used clothing, cosmetics, and beauty supplies.

She wants the loan to buy women's and men's pants as well as lipstick, creams, and other cosmetics.

The other members are Celia, who butchers pigs and makes nacatamales [Nicaraguan tamales], and Martha, who makes fried food, soups, and soft drinks to earn money to support her family.

loans.use: to buy women's and men's pants as well as lipstick, creams, and other cosmetics

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet extends thanks to Kiva through Hofokam to the loan which has enabled her improve on her monthly income and able to raise school fees for her children. She is hopeful that this business will see her live a healthy life with her family and also improve on her general standards of living. Due to increased demand from her customers, Violet is again requesting for a loan to buy more cosmetics and clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothes to sell

loans.name: Mesaid

texts.en:
Mesaid is a married woman and has been blessed with five kids  three whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 
Mesaid has  operated a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over 4 years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business.Mesaid dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Magdalena Estela

texts.es:
Magdalena es una joven de 20 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus hermanos y padres en una comunidad del Caserío las Palmas. Para Magdalena su familia es lo más importante y para poder obtener sus ingresos se dedica desde hace cinco años a la costura de trajes típicos, ella eligió esta actividad porque lo realiza desde la comunidad de su hogar y le permite realizar otras actividades de su casa. Magdalena con el afán de mejorar las condiciones de su casa desde hace algún tiempo han empezado con este cambio, por lo que ahora solo hace falta darle el toque a la pared, es el motivo por la cual solicita un préstamo para la compra de arena, cemento, y cal para el respectivo repello de la pared. 
El gran anhelo de Magdalena es ampliar su negocio de costura para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Magdalena is a 20 year old young woman. She is single and lives with her siblings and parents in a community of Caserío las Palmas. Family is the most important thing for Magdalena and in order to obtain income, she has made a living for five years in the dressmaking of traditional clothing. She chose this work because she completes it from the comfort of her home and it allows her to carry out other house work.

With the desire to improve the conditions of the house since long ago, Magdalena has started with this change and now all that is left is to touch up the wall. This is the reason for which she is requesting a loan to buy sand, cement, and lime for the respective plastering of the wall.

Magdalena's greatest desire is to expand her dressmaking business in order to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy sand, lime, and cement.

loans.name: Maria Eloisa Amparo

texts.en:
Maria is a 64-year-old woman. She has been married to a loving husband for a long time, long enough to see their children go their own way... This means they have no economic dependents - they only need to support each other.

In Kubo we look up to Maria because of her selling/trading skills. We found her business to be really amazing. Long ago she decided to sell "stuff" in her garage. By "stuff" we mean "everything” - she mostly sells clothes (used or new) but also sells shoes, home electronics, furniture and pretty much everything she can - that’s why we are impressed by her trading skills, with them she manages to make a good income.

Now she is asking for a $10,000.00 MXN (Ten thousand pesos) loan. She wishes to buy clothes to resell and is also looking to stock up on "new merchandise" to eventually resell. She has had previous loans and pays them on time, so in Kubo we are confident that she will succeed and her business will grow with her loan.

loans.use: to buy and resell merchandise in order to grow her business.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is a 59-year-old mother of nine children. 

Visitacion is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Visitacion requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Visitacion has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Visitacion would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
This is 28 year-old Serah. She is single and has no children. In 2014, Serah established her Vitafoam mattress business. She began her business to be self-employed and help her parent and younger brothers and sisters. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are the general community. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,900,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Serah requires a loan in order to buy more Vitafoam mattresses and the balance will be used for transportation. She hopes that this loan will support her to cater for more customers and as a result the business will expand. In the future, Serah wants to become a key distributor for Vitafoam Company and open another Vitafoam outlet in the provinces. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more Vitafoam mattresses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy kangkung, spinach, carrots, mustard greens, tomatoes, pumpkin, chilies, limes, oranges and scallions.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is a 25-year-old mother of four children, two in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Michelle has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Michelle requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Michelle has been in this business for five years. In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Neyson's Group

texts.en: Neyson’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Neyson makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Maa Saraswati Shg -B Group

texts.en:
Manima, 34, is a lady who hails from the Koraput district of Odisha, India. She is the one who is standing on the left in the photograph. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farm, which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around 10 years. She has one son in her care and her husband is a fisherman by profession. She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. It will also mean that she no longer needs to walk long distances, especially when she is sick.

Therefore, Manima along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 50,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a toilet and install a commode so that she can improve her health and hygiene as well as safeguard her family's health by promoting cleanliness.

loans.use: to build a toilet and install a commode

loans.name: Yule

texts.en:
Yule is 35 years old and has three children. She is married and all of her children are in school.

Yule is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Yule has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Yule would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en: Sophal’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sophal makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Cheav's Group

texts.en: Cheav’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Cheav makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Maa Saraswati Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Bhagabati, 26, is a humble, hardworking and enterprising lady. She is the one standing to the left with her two-year-old son. She is a vegetable vendor by profession and hails from Koraput district, Odisha, India. Her family is one of the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. These unsanitary practices make them vulnerable to infections, and the lack of privacy exposes them to molestation or worse.

Therefore, Bhagabati along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 50,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a latrine in her house so that she can prevent unnecessary medical expenses and safeguard her family's health.

She is eagerly awaiting for your kind help.

loans.use: to build a latrine in her house

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She is currently selling mineral water and knows how to do hair treatments and manicures. (It is a cosmetic treatment of the fingernails). She has two children, one in elementary and the other one in college. She and her husband Jimmy, a driver, are working together to sustain their day-to-day expenses and support their children’s education since they want their children to finish college.

Rosalina has many plans for her family. She wants to save money for the future and dreams of investing for their own house someday. That’s why she is determined to make her sources of income grow and succeed. She’s praying that God will send more customers so that’s she’ll have a bigger profit. With this, Rosalina applied for a loan of PHP 10,000 since she wants to buy new equipment and hair treatments for her cosmetic business and to have enough supply of mineral water for her clients.

Rosalina believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending a weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gains spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and hair treatments for her cosmetic business and to have enough supply of mineral water for her clients.

loans.name: Renelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Renelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Renelyn is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to buy more boxes of dried fish to sell at her stall.

Renelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of dried fish to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Kyekumburwa Development Network Group

texts.en:
Rose is a group member of Kyekumburwa Development Network where members are involved in various agriculture activities that enable them raise income to look after their families, hers being of five members that is 4 children and herself. She owns a market stall from where she sells fresh vegetables like cabbages, cornflowers, eggplants and onions, which she opened in 2014 with an aim of supporting her household development being a single parent.

Rose is experiencing a hardship of market price fluctuation and this makes her remain stagnant in her profits. Her greatest desire is having all her children educated such that they can get good jobs to support her. Rose has asked for a loan in this group to buy vegetables like cabbages, cornflowers, eggplants and onions for sell.

loans.use: to buy vegetables like cabbages, cornflowers,eggplants and onions for sell

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is married with children who attend school. He practices farming as the only source of income. Vincent has a challenge of pests, and diseases which eat up his crops living him with poor yields, thus limiting his market for the crops.

He wants to buy farm inputs specifically pesticides, and fertilizers, but he does not have enough money to do so. He requests money to buy farm inputs and in the end improve his yields and get more income than what he is getting.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs specifically pesticides, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a married woman, 49 years old with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rosie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rosie requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell.

Rosie has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell

loans.name: Sonie

texts.en:
Sonie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Sonie is 53 years old and has one child still in school.

Sonie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Sonie requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell.

Sonie has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday is married with 4 children. He operates a bar and he has also been able to start off a coffee business using interests got from the bar. Sunday is able to look after his family very well and at the same time do his business without any default there.

Because of his excellent bar services, Sunday's number of customers has gradually increased, that the present capital cannot handle them. He is requesting for money to buy more sodas, and beers for selling to satisfy his target customers.

loans.use: to buy more sodas, and beers for selling

loans.name: Maa Saraswati Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Subhadra, 41, hails from a village in the Koraput district, Odisha, India. She has a family size of three. Her family does not have the means to build a toilet at home. With no access to a toilet, they have to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private, in dense bushes or isolated fields. She has no toilet in the immediate vicinity either. Therfore, she has to face a lot of problems for defecation and urination.

Subhadra, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 50,000 INR in order to build a toilet and install a commode, shower and water pipes in it so that she will maintain health and hygiene in her family and protect them from harmful contagious diseases.

Subhadra is in dire need of your help.

loans.use: to build a toilet and install a commode, shower and water pipes in it.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion is 60 years old, married and lives in Sibula, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is a farmer growing various root crops that she supplies to the local market. With the desire to augment her production volume, she asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a single woman, 28 years old, with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Liezel has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline and pay for maintenance of her business.

Liezel has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline and pay for maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Juan Elvis Fernando

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 26 años de edad, es soltero con una linda familia que vive en una comunidad de la aldea Xejuyup. Juan para darle a su familia lo necesario se dedica al cultivo y venta de maxan, a Dios gracias le fue muy bien con el préstamo, porque pudo realizar la inversión en su negocio y cultivo, este préstamo le dio  a Juan la oportunidad de seguir prosperando con su cultivo y venta de maxan. Juan con el afán de seguir incrementando su cultivo desde hace algún tiempo había considerado la posibilidad de comprar más terrenos para incrementar su cultivo, pero no le ha sido posible, es la razón por la cual ahora solicita un préstamo de Q 2,000.00 para la compra de una cuerda de terreno.
Su  gran anhelo es la construcción de una casa más grande para que su amada familia viva mejor.
texts.en:
Juan is a single 26 year old man with a beautiful family that lives in Xejuyup village. To provide for his family Juan grows and sells maxan (maxan leaves are used to wrap tamales and other foods). Thanks to God it went well with the loan as he as able to make the investment in his business and crops. For this loan Juan has the opportunity to continue prospering with his growing and selling of maxan. Juan greatly desires to continue increasing his crops and for some time he has considered the possibility of buying more land to increase his crops, but it hasn't been possible. Therefore now he is seeking a loan of Q 2,000.00 to buy a plot of land.

His primary goal is to build a bigger house so that his beloved family can live better.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to farm.

loans.name: Ikromjon

texts.ru:
Икромчон мужчина 44 лет, счастливый отец пятерых детей, жена на прошлой неделе родила сына, по этому в данный момент она в декретном отпуске. Икромчон очень рад что наконец-то после четверых девочек родился наследник. Икромчон председатель дехканского хозяйства.Он имеет 5 га земли.  Также у него есть коровы и бараны. Икромчон очень трудолюбивий порядочный человек. Он с 2009 года сотрудничает с МДО Арванд.. 
Он хочет расширить свой количество скота. Но у него не хватает собственных денежных средств. Икромчон обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Он заранее благодарит за поддержку и помощь.
texts.en:
Ikromjon is a 44-year-old man and the happy father of five children.  His wife just gave birth to a son last week, so she is now on maternity leave.  Since they already had four girls, Ikromjon is now thrilled to have a male heir.

Ikromjon is president of a dekhan farm (a privately owned commercial farm).  He owns five hectares of land as well as some cows and sheep.  He is a very hardworking and honest man.  He has been a client of MDO Arvand since 2009.

Ikromjon wants to increase his livestock headcount.  However, he doesn't have enough personal resources to do so.  He has turned to MDO Arvand for financial support.  He thanks you in advance for your help and support.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Sophal’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sophal makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Los Bailarines Group

texts.es: El grupo “Los Bailarines” integrados por 3 miembros, quienes para seguir adelante han tomado la opción de solicitar crédito para poder invertir en su negocio y poder agrandarlos. La líder del grupo es Maria, 31 años, casada y con un hijo de 6 años y el próximo que viene en camino, ya que se encuentra embarazada, se dedica a la comercialización de cosméticos desde hace 2 años con la ayuda de su esposo. Ahora requiere del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de perfumes, sandalias de niñas y adultos, ropa, bluasas, ropa interior y pantalones. Así le asegura a su familia una mejor situación económica con los ingresos recibidos. Los demás integrantes son Jenny, 33 años, dueña de una tienda de ropa calzado, electrodomésticos y cosméticos. Alex de 33 años quien ofrecer servicio de acarreo y transporte en su comunidad.
texts.en:
The “Los Bailarines” group consists of 3 members, who in order to continue moving forward have made the decision to seek a loan to invest in their businesses and expand them. The leader of the group is 31 year old Maria. She is married and has a 6 year old son and another child on the way as she is pregnant. She has been selling cosmetics for 2 years with the help of her husband. Now she needs a loan to buy perfumes, sandals for children and adults, clothing, blouses, underwear, and pants. In this way she can ensures her family better economic stability with the income she receives.

The other members of the group are 33 year old Jenny who own a store selling shoes, small household appliances, and cosmetics; and 33 year old Alex who offers chauffeur and transportation in his community.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, sandals for children and adults, clothing, blouses, underwear, and pants.

loans.name: Martha Dayssy

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer, de cuarenta y cinco años de edad, muy esforzada y paciente, ella tiene veinte y ocho años de ser maestra de la escuela primaria. Madre de tres hijos, a los cuales ha preparado con los mejores valores y ahora son profesionales. Ya había sido beneficiada con un financiamiento de Kiva y MiCrédito, con el cual instalo en su casa un servicio higiénico, dejando atrás el uso de la letrina.
Esta inteligente mujer, cree que es el momento adecuado para volver a recurrir a un crédito de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, el cual invertirá para terminar la construcción de su baño, es decir comprar azulejos, cemento, un lavamanos y equipar una ducha.
