Ella está dedicada a mejorar la salud de su familia, por eso está realizando estos cambios, que además contribuyen a que el suelo no se siga contaminando.
texts.en:
Martha is a 45-year-old woman who is very hardworking and patient. She has been an elementary school teacher for 28 years. She taught her three children the best values and now they have professional careers.

She has already benefited from Kiva and MiCrédito financing, which she used to install a toilet in her home so that she would no longer have to use a latrine.

This intelligent woman believes that it is the right time to get another Kiva loan with MiCrédito. She will invest it in finishing construction on her bathroom: buy tile, cement, and a sink, and install a shower. She is dedicated to improving the health of her family, and that is why she is making these changes, which also help to stop ground contamination.

loans.use: to finish construction of her bathroom: buy tile, cement, and a sink, and install a shower.

loans.name: Riboberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto es un caficultor de 39 años, el lleva 20 años en el cultivo de café y cada día pone en práctica nuevas técnica para mejorar la producción, Rigoberto vive con su madre y dos de sus hermanas, Rigoberto es el responsable de llevar a su casa todo lo necesario para su familia. 
Rigoberto produce café bajo distintos sellos de certificación como ser: Comercio Justo y Rainforest ahora Rigoberto quiere producir café orgánico lo que es una novedad en la región que permite obtener mejores precios por el café, la certificación de las fincas aparte de dar mejores ganancias en precio ayuda a tener producciones más abundantes y a proteger el medioambiente por medio de buenas prácticas agrícolas. Aprovechando que las plagas tienen casi acabadas sus fincas Rigoberto aprovechara para replantarlas e iniciar la certificación con la plantación desde el inicio.
Rigoberto solicita un crédito para convertir sus fincas a producción orgánica lo que le permitirá tener mejores ganancias por el café y darle mejores oportunidades a su familia.
Un crédito ayudara a Rigoberto certificar su cafetal lo que le permitirá tener mejores cosechas, mejores precios por el café y por ende una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is a 39 year old coffee grower. He has grown coffee for 20 years and every day he puts into practice new techniques to improve production. Rigoberto lives with his mother and two of his sisters. He is responsible to provide everything his family needs. Rigoberto grows coffee under various labels such as Comercio Justo and Rainforest. Now he wants to product organic coffee which is a new idea in the region, and it will enable him to get better prices for the coffee. The certification of the farm will provide better a better price which helps him have a more abundant harvest and protect the environment through good agricultural practices.Taking advantage of the plagues that have almost wiped out his crops, Rigoberto will use this opportunity to replant and start the certification process from the beginning.

Rigoberto seeks a loan to convert his farm to an organic producing farm which will enable him to have greater income from the coffee and provide greater opportunities to his family. The loan will help Rigoberto certify his farm, resulting in better harvests, better prices, and in the end a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy the materials needed to convert his coffee farm to an organic farm such as organic manure, organic coffee plants, and other items.

loans.name: Izabela

texts.es:
Izabela es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad, es soltera con un hijo de 11 años, está linda familia vive en una comunidad del caserío la palmas. Izabela todos los días se esmera para darle a su familia lo mejor, ella desde hace dos años tomo la iniciativa de realizar alguna actividad que le genere ingreso y mantener a su familia, fue cuando surgió la idea para dedicarse a la compra y venta de leñas y tejido típico, y para obtener mejores ingresos se dedica a la cosecha de café.
Izabela es una gran mujer porque no se detiene ante las dificultades y a considerado aprovechar la oportunidad que hoy se le presenta, que es la compra de dos cuerdas de terrenos por lo que su mayor dificultad es no contar con el dinero suficiente es la razón por la que solicita un préstamo de Q 7,000.00.
Ella tiene el anhelo de comprar este terreno para aumentar su cultivo de café y sus ingresos para que su familia viva mejor, pero también construir una casa más grande.
texts.en:
Izabela is a mother and is 37 years old. She is single and has a son who is 11 years old. This lovely family lives in a community in the small village of Las Palmas. Izabela strives everyday to give her family the best. Two years ago, she took the initiative to do something that would generate income to support her family. This is when the idea came up to work buying and selling firewood and traditional knits. To have a better income, she works harvesting coffee.

Izabela is a great woman because she doesn't stop when confronted with obstacles. She has considered taking advantage of an opportunity presented to her which is to buy land. Her biggest obstacle is not having enough money which is why she is requesting loan of 7,000 (GTQ). She longs to buy this land to increase her coffee cultivation and her income so that her family can have a better life but also so that she can build a larger house.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is married and has four children. For the past three years she has operated a small general store which she opened with her own working capital of 200 USD. She enjoys this thriving business not only for its income but her interaction with the customers as well.

Helena has applied for a 1,500 USD loan through Kiva's field partner Tuba Rai Metin to bolster her business. She will use the loan to restock her shop with noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, coffee, slippers, biscuits, body lotion and fish.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her general store.

loans.name: Bartolomeu

texts.en:
Bartolomeu is a hardworking 33-year-old doctor whose sister is at university in another country. He and his family are paying for her education, but doing so is difficult for them.

Bartolomeu has applied for a 1,000 USD loan through Kiva's field partner Tuba Rai Metin to pay for his sister’s university costs including administration fees, textbooks, school supplies and other things. He loves his sister very much and hopes that her further education will help them all to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for his sister’s university costs including administration fees, textbooks, school supplies and other things.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en: Saturnina is a hog raiser in Lao Proper, Misamis Occidental. She is 64 years old with adult age children who also have a family of their own. Despite of her age and having only her and her husband to feed, Saturnina wants to engage in business for future keeps. She asks her 1st loan at Paglaum MPC and started up her hog raising business. Now that she found out her passion in her business, she wants to expand it. She asks for another loan from the cooperative to purchase bags of animal feeds.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Ceneza

texts.en: Ceneza is 55 years old and lives in Kauswagan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with school age children. Ceneza owns and operates a business providing transport to local community members for a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase a slightly used motorcycle. Ceneza is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Ceneza hopes to save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase a slightly used motorcycle

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy is 33 years old and a new memeber of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) from Intramuros branch and married to Rolly. For 5 years now, they are managing a variety store business. This is also known as “Sari-sari” store in the Philippines where you can buy cheap items. Basically, most sari-sari stores can be found in every Barangays, Municipalities even in Cities. Products here are cheap, since for only P1.00 you can buy a piece of candy or any sweets, compared to supermarkets where most products are being sold in wholesale, in a sari-sari store on the other hand, you can buy a sachet of shampoo, powder drink and so much more.  They’re earning for approximately P12, 000 each month.

Analy has children to raise one in the high school level and the other one in grade school. She wants to take advantage of the support CCT offers not just on monetary but also in seminars and lectures for aspiring entrepreneurs. She decided to apply for a loan of P12, 000 to add grocery items for her variety store business like grocery items, bottled drinks and sacks of rice.

Analy regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her variety store business like grocery items, bottled drinks and sacks of rice.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 43 years old. He is married and has 5 children. His business is farming. He has been in this business for 10 years. He earns a monthly income of thirty thousand Kenya shillings.

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya.He will use the loan to buy seedlings, water pipes and fertilizer. He will use the profits from expanded business to educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to have a financially stable family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, water pipes and fertilizer.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is a married woman with twelve children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Charito is 36 years old and has four children who are in school.

Charito has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines. Charito requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed like nail polish, brushes, etc..

Charito has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Charito would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like nail polish, brushes, etc.

loans.name: Mwari

texts.en:
Mwari is married with four children one of whom attend school. They live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is food .

She has operated a khanga ( women wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.
With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khanga’s for resale.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees.

Mariamu operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future.



With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a stock of tomatoes,onions,mangoes and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of tomatoes,onions,mangoes and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude is a 65 year old married lady with 4 children aged 8, 12, 14 and 20 with only 3 attending school. She has a retail shop selling items like sugar, salt, soap, fresh food, beers,sodas,and waragi. In addition to that,she owns rentals that adds her more income. Her shop is located in a village setting and most of her clients look at her as an honest and hardworking lady.

She is facing problems of high transport cost, high purchase price and tenants who delay to pay her and others disappear minus clearing their rent bill. Even though all that is happening, she is looking forward to become a wholesaler in her area and educate all her children to higher levels of learning. She has asked for a loan to buy sugar, sodas and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, sodas and soap to sell.

loans.name: Jati Sari Group

texts.en:
Jati Sari group was able to repay their loan on time. Ni Putu, one member of the Jati Sari group, tells of her success in raising pigs. From the first loan she got from MUK, Ni Putu had one sow. But now she has three sows and each sow gave birth to 12 piglets. Ni Putu sells her piglets after she maintains them for two months. All the profits she saves and will be used for working capital so that she can be independent in terms of capital. Ni Putu is very grateful for the help she had received so far. Ni Putu still expects assistance from MUK, both in terms of capital or training, so that she and all members of the group can be successful pig farmers. Two members earned a satisfactory profit and decided to continue the pig business with their own saving. They were replaced by new members.

After obtaining satisfactory results in the previous loan period, the Jati Sari group continues borrowing. The current loan will be used to purchase piglets and feed and repair cages.
Ni Putu will use the loan to buy feed and repair her cages. Ni Putu has six piglets to fatten and they are scheduled to be sold five months later. Ni Putu and her husband also have a plan to raise cattle. With the profits she earned last period, she bought a calf. She hopes the welfare of her family will be better, and if all goes well, she will increase the number of cows.

loans.use: to buy feed and repair cages

loans.name: Las Praderas Group

texts.es:
Grupo las Praderas están conformado por 3 socios, quienes se juntaron con el motivo de realizar una fianza solidaria, demostrando que pueden ser capaces y responsables de tener un buena administración de su dinero y ser puntuales en las cuotas de su crédito.
Para el crecimiento de su negocio, Jose, de 64 años, casado y con 2 hijos a su cargo de edad 25 y 10 años, quienes le ayudan a elaborar artesanías plásticas, donde elaboran cometas, para recibir ingresos que cubran los gastos hogareños. Con el dinero invertirá en la compra de plásticos, varillas, pegas y mesas. Los otros integrantes son Carlos, 41 años, se dedica a la elaboración de sandalias desde hace 5 años, y Arlen de 36 años vende ropa interior de forma ambulante desde hace 2 años.
texts.en:
The group Las Praderas is made up of three members who came together in order to form a solidarity bond, showing that they are capable of and responsible in managing their money and being on time with their payments.

Jose is 64 years old, is married and has two children who are 25 and 10 years old. His children help him make plastic crafts such as rockets in order to make income to cover the household expenses. With the money from the loan he will invest in buying plastic, rods, glue and tables. The other members of the group are Carlos who is 41 years old and has been making sandals for five years and Arlen who is 36 years old and has been selling underwear for two years door-to-door.

loans.use: to buy plastic, rods, glue and tables.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Every entrepreneur’s goal is to see their business succeed or grow. Vivian One of the CCT partner, who was granted a loan amount of P8, 000 and was able to use the amount for her Sari-sari store business. She’s grateful since CCT helped her a lot in the business since they conduct business mentoring and granted her previous loan request. She also wants to thank lenders who are also helping new entrepreneurs on their business. 

The previous loan was used to buy additional stocks like bottled drinks, Grocery items and other products. Sari-sari store is a Filipino term which means ‘variety’ it  is usually found in every barrios, cities, neighborhood or barangays where items or products are being sold by volume, kilo or by piece. 

Vivian aims to have a one stop shop where she’ll have all of the items needed by the consumers. She is aware that competitors on this line of business are rampant. That’s why; still she is contemplating of ways on how to attract buyers/consumers. Turning her Sari-sari store to a Grocery store is one of her goal. Since it is her bread and butter, Vivian exerts her effort and hard work for the business since this really helped her sustain her family’s needs and support her children’s education. Added capital will help her business flourish. That’s why Vivian decided to apply for another loan of P 20, 000 to buy additional stocks of grocery items and other products. 

On a weekly basis, Vivian regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell like grocery items and other similar products.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar is a pensioner member of Paglaum MPC for almost 12 years. He is 66 years old, single and lives in Eastern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. He had availed various loan products and successfully repaid his previous loan. Currently, he avails a loan of PHP 9,000.00 to purchase maintenance medicines & vitamins.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance medicines & vitamins

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman and she has four children, all of whom attend school. Mejumaa owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mejumaa has operated a firewood selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.
With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resale

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
Ramón tiene 41 años de edad, se dedica a la producción de café desde hace más de 20 años, está casado con Esmeralda, Ramón y Esmeralda tienen 1 hijos bajo su cargo, Ramón produce café certificado de alta calidad bajo los sellos de certificación como ser: Comercio Justo y Rainforest.
Ramón actualmente está interesado en una práctica de producción que se ha hecho muy popular en la zona y es la producción de café orgánico, esta práctica permite producir café de mayor calidad, hacer los cultivos amigables con el ambiente, vender a mejores precios, hace las fincas más sostenibles, cuida de los suelos y no contamina las fuentes de agua.
Ramón solicita un crédito para iniciar el proceso de conversión a producción orgánica de su cafetal para lo que ha decidido replantar e iniciar el proceso con las plantaciones totalmente nuevas, con las ganancias obtenidas por el café orgánico vendido Ramón tendrá los suficientes ingresos para que a su familia no le falte nada.
Un préstamo ayudara a Ramón  a certificar su producción de café como orgánica esto permitirá a Ramón cuidar el medio ambiente y darles sus hijos oportunidades para su futuro.
texts.en:
Ramón is 41 years old and has earned his living as a coffee producer for more than 20 years. Ramón is married to Esmeralda, and he and Esmeralda have one child in their care. Ramón certified high-quality coffee with certifications from Fairtrade and Rainforest.

Ramón is currently interested in a production practice that has become very popular in the area, and that is the production of organic coffee. This practice allows production of higher-quality coffee, makes the crops environmentally friendly, sells at better prices, makes farms more sustainable, takes care of the soil, and does not contaminate water sources.

Ramón is requesting a loan to begin the process of converting his coffee crop to organic production. He has decided to replant and start the process with totally new plantings. With the profits he obtains from selling organic coffee, Ramón will have enough income that his family will have everything they need.

A loan will help Ramón to certify his coffee production as organic. This will allow him to take care of the environment and give his children opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials to convert to organic coffee production—like organic soil amendments and coffee plants—and to pay for manual labor.

loans.name: La Llama Del Amor Group

texts.es: Conformado por 3 mujeres, emprendedoras, luchadoras, y con muchas ganas de seguir adelantes, esta el grupo Llama del amor, coordinado por Marlene, de 44 años, acompañada y con 3 hijos de edades 20, 17 y 7 años donde el mayor trabaja y los otros dos estudian en secundaria y primaria. Con el fin de seguirles brindando lo mejor a sus hijos, ella se dedica ala venta de leche y con el crédito comprara mayor  litros de leche, para así abastecer a sus clientelas. Las otras socias son Elisa, de 36 años dedicada a la venta de verdura desde hace 1 año, y Juana de 48 años quien vende gaseosa, pan, cloro, ace desde hace 5 años.
texts.en:
Comprised of three enterprising and hardworking women with a great will to get ahead, the group Llama del amor (flame of love) is lead by Marlene. Marlene is 44 years old, is in a relationship and has three children who are 20, 17, and 7 years old. The oldest works and the other two are in primary and secondary school. With the goal of giving her children the best, Marlene sells milk.

With this loan Marlene will buy more liters of milk so that she can supply her customers. The other members of the group are Elisa who is 36 years old and has been selling vegetables for a year and Juana who is 48 years old and has been selling soft drinks, bread and bleach for five years.

loans.use: to buy liters of milk.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is an active member of Paglaum MPC who enjoys all the perks of a member. She is 76 years old and married with adult age children. Anecita is busy running her fishing operations and tilling her land, both of which business ventures were supported by the Co-op. She said she's secure financially knowing she can always turn to the cooperative, but she wants to be prepared also for unprecedented life events so she also avails life insurance from the Co-op. Now that her one-year life insurance is expiring, she borrowed an amount to pay the life insurance premium for the family. Anecita believes that it is better to be prepared than to be held on the neck for unexpected circumstances.

loans.use: to pay for the life insurance premium for the family.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina wants to thank lenders for Kiva’s generous support of people who don’t have enough capital to run a small business like hers. Her previous loan approved by Kiva's field partner Center for Community Transformation (CCT) was used to buy daily newspapers to sell.

Catalina also has a small food stand where she sells burgers. She has applied for a 15,000 PHP loan through CCT to buy stocks of buns, patties and condiments.

Catalina dreams of opening her own variety store someday, and so she works hard to earn more toward this end. She emphasizes that CCT has made a great impact on her life and business and wants again to thank lenders for participating in Kiva.

All CCT community clients like Catalina are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy stocks of buns, patties and condiments for her burger stand

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is 28 years old and the father of three children. Together with his family, he lives in a minority community in very bad conditions. His wife stays home to care for the children and the house. As with all of the people that live in the Ashklai communities, they are living in very terrible conditions and their home is very old. Adnan is fortunate to have an income, and is satisfied with his business selling used shoes in the market. However, since Adnan is the main source of income and he doesn't have a good salary, they have never had the opportunity to improve their home or make any renovations.

He is requesting a loan to renovate and fix the facade of the house before the upcoming cold and wet winter season. This will help him to be able to provide a suitable and healthy environment for his family. He looks forward to the day that he can have a shop and sell new shoes and hopes that one day he will reach his goal. He is grateful for the opportunity from the lenders and wants to thank all.

loans.use: to renovate and fix the facade of the house before the upcoming cold and wet winter season.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a Center for Community Transformation (CCT) member from the Batasan, Philippines branch. She is 58 years old and currently involved in a food vending business. She’s selling street foods like fried squid balls, fish balls and deep fried battered quail eggs (or as it is also known as “kwek-kwek” in Tagalog). She’s also selling viands for lunch and dinner. Maria earns about PHP 11,500 each month. And she has had the business for eight years now.

Maria is doing the business along the sidewalk. There are days that she’s lacking capital to support the business. Maria is determined to earn more profit since she has children in school and bills that needs to be paid. Supporting capital is what she needs. That’s why she applied for a PHP 12,000 loan for her to have stock of processed foods. She’s hoping that lenders will consider her story as she prays that God will also provide blessings back to people with considerate hearts.

Maria regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience in the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy stocks of processed foods for the business.

loans.name: Agim

texts.en: Agrim is a young, 22-year-old, single male who is hardworking so that he can have a brighter future. Agrim is the main source of income for his family since his father has passed away. He is currently working in construction and is opening his own food market in his home. He will be able to serve his entire village with the products he sells in his market because his village has a lack of these stores. For the first time he is requesting a loan in order to purchase food and beverages for his market. His goal is that he will be able to expand his business in the future and he can start to add clothing to sell in his market. He promises to pay on time and is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase food and beverages for his market

loans.name: Maa Shakti Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Hemanjali, 34, standing on the left hand side in the photograph, hails from a village in the Koraput district, Odisha, India. She is a divorced lady living with her one son and two daughters, who are in school. After her separation from her husband, she started her food vending business four years ago to manage her family's expenses. Her strong determination and will power made her strong enough that she is able to earn for her family. She is the only breadwinner of her family and she never leaves any stone unturned in order to fulfill the needs of her children.

Hemanjali, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase an adequate amount of raw materials for her food vending business like batter, dough, custard powder, vanilla essense, oil, chocolate syrup, curry powder and many more.

Hemanjali aspires to provide the best education to her children, fulfill all their desires and never make them feel the absence of their father.

loans.use: to purchase an adequate amount of raw materials for her food vending business like batter, dough, custard powder, vanilla essense, oil, chocolate syrup, curry powder and many more.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander raises and sells hogs. For almost six years now, he has been engaged in a hog-raising business. He is a 28-year-old married man with four children. His oldest child is five while the youngest is eight months old. Together with his family, he lives in the town of Pilar, Bohol.

With the presence of resources, he could expand his livelihood and be able to improve his income. He could raise and sell quality hogs. He is asking for a loan to buy piglets and feed. Thus, he could continue to provide his family with nutritious meals and better shelter.

Alexander hopes that he will be able to manage his hog-raising livelihood to support the welfare of his young children, especially sending them for a quality education.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Maa Shakti Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Hindu, 34, is the lady standing on the left in a green saree in the photograph. For five years, Hindu worked alongside her husband running a medium-sized restaurant, or as the locals say, a “hotel business,” in their town in Odisha, a state in Eastern India. Together, they were well-known and respected members of the community. Last December, however, her husband got ill with a serious disease and passed away, leaving her with the business to manage and two children to support on her own. She was devastated. Hindu is a strong woman, but it is a lot of pressure to run a business with six employees and support her children, especially in a community where most of the businesses are run by men. Nevertheless, she is determined to fulfill the dream of her husband to renovate and improve the hotel. They used to envision turning it into a full-service air-conditioned establishment. Through hard work, she has saved 70,000 INR for this project and is taking out this loan. With this, she will have enough to build new counters and buy an air conditioner.

Hindu, along with her group member has requested this loan amount of 30,000 INR and she will use her portion pay for an air conditioner and to build new counters for her restaurant. She is so grateful for Kiva and People’s Forum for reaching out to them and helping them improve their livelihoods.

loans.use: to pay for an air conditioner and to build new counters for her restaurant

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita is 69 years old, widow and lives in Baybay, Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. As a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC, she is given priority in financial services to alleviate her present financial conditions with the necessary financial literacy and other trainings which she actively participated. Juanita had seen the changes in her general living condition from the moment she sign up for membership with the cooperative. This time, she ask a loan of PHP 20,000.00 to purchase materials for boat making such as lumber, plywood, bronze nails, sealant, paint, bamboo, boat engine and fishing nets.

loans.use: to purchase materials for boat making such as lumber, plywood, bronze nails, sealant, paint, bamboo, boat engine and fishing nets

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is 61 years old, married from Katipa, Lopez Jaena. She is known of her farming activities together with her husband who personally tills their land. She is a member of good standing of Paglaum MPC and had maintained her records without defaults in payments. Recently, she avails her 15th loan in the amount of PHP 19,500.00 to purchase bags of fertilizes and bottles of insecticides.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizes and bottles of insecticides

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is known in Puntod, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental of her convenience store. She is 59 years old, married with children who are in college. She's making good sales recently that she wants to restock her store that she asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC. The amount that she loan shall be used to restock store with consumable goods like canned goods, noodles, soy sauce, vinegar and cooking oil.

loans.use: to restock store with consumable goods like canned goods, noodles, soy sauce, vinegar and cooking oil

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a woman who is very interested in business; she is not overly dependent on her husband to be responsible in the household.

So, now she is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her capital to buy more goods such as sugar, salt, cooking oils, tea, biscuits, cigarettes, eggs, candles, soaps, soy sauce, ketchup, toothpaste, lighters, soft drinks, and other things to sell.

She plans to open a bigger business in the future. She opened her business in 2013 with a capital base of $100.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, cooking oils, tea, biscuits, cigarettes, eggs, candles, soaps, soy sauce, ketchup, toothpaste, lighters, soft drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco is a farmer who earns through his farming activities. He is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance. Recently, he applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. He is on his way to renovating his house. He wishes to live comfortably with his family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: Magdalena has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring and harvesting and earning income as well. Magdalena has supported her husband doing this type of work.  Like a farmer, Magdalena has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knew she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied a loan to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.  Someday, Magdalena hopes to purchase another rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds which will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Jelma

texts.en:
Jelma is 43 years old and has nine children. She is married and seven of her children are in school.

Jelma is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Jelma requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jelma has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jelma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Gigi

texts.en:
Gigi is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gigi is 29 years old and has two children who are presently in school.

Gigi has a weaving business in the Philippines. Gigi requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials and maintain her business.

Gigi has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials and pay for maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leonila is 61 years old and has children who are in school.

Leonila has a dental business in the Philippines. Leonila requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional dental equipment for her business.

Leonila has been in this business for two years. In the future, Leonila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional dental equipment for her business

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with six children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mwanamisi has operated a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Felismina

texts.en:
Felismina is a farmer and she is planting vegetables and after the vegetables are ready, she will bring to the market for sale. She started planting vegetables in 2011 with her own working capital of $45.00.

Now she is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants used to improve her business. Everyday her life is planting vegetables because she is earning a good income from it. She is taking the loan from Tuba Rai Metin to increase her business and she will buy, vegetable seeds, fertilizer, insecticides and other things when she needs them.

loans.use: to buy, vegetable seeds, fertilizer, insecticides and other things he need.

loans.name: Antoninha

texts.en:
Antoninha started her business a year ago with her own working capital of $150. She had a lot of difficulties because she did not have enough working capital to buy cigarettes, candy, shampoo, tea, snacks, and other things to sell and according to what people need.

After a year, she got the information about Tuba Rai Metin. She came to get the information, and she is very interested in it. She is requesting a loan of $600 to buy more needed items to keep in her store.

She has been busy with her business, and she is happy to do that. Her husband is very helpful in doing business because he is also a businessman. She lives in her simple house made of brick with rope for a roof. She wants to make her kiosk to be like a mini-market in the future.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, candy, shampoo, tea, snacks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Regina Lisbeth

texts.es: Regina con 31 años de edad se dedica a atender de su negocio de venta de productos básicos, golosinas, bebidas frías, bisutería entre otros productos, en un pequeño chalet, el cual se encuentra ubicado en una terminal de autobuses, por lo que cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes. Regina habita junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 3 años en casa de su propiedad, por lo que se siente feliz de contar con este beneficio. Regina ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI el cual invertirá en: granos básicos, lácteos, bebidas frías, golosinas, bisutería entre otros productos para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en: Regina is 31 years old and makes a living tending to her business selling basic products, sweets, cold drinks, imitation jewelry and other products.  She runs her business in a small detached house, which is located in a bus terminal, which has a lot of customers.  Regina lives with her life partner and her 3 year old daughter in their own home, so she is happy to have this blessing.  Regina has decided to apply for a loan through FUSAI, which she will use to invest in basic grains, dairy products, cold drinks, candy, imitation jewelry and other products to improve her business.

loans.use: to invest in: basic grains, dairy products, cold drinks, candy, jewelry and other products to improve her business.

loans.name: Zeqirja

texts.en:
Zeqirja is 44 years old and has three children. He is a dedicated father who works a lot in order to improve the daily living conditions of his family. Based on family tradition, he is involved in agriculture, as most people from his village are. He earns a living by working his land and the land of others and has a farm where he keeps cows. He really loves his work and will never change what he does for a living. Currently he has three cows, but he is requesting a loan for the first time in order to purchase another milk cow to sell dairy products from.

His current cows are producing very little milk and he would like to be able to to sell more milk and dairy products in his neighborhood. He hopes in the future to continue to expand his farm and is very grateful to the lenders for the help and opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase another milk cow to sell dairy products from.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 56 years old and married with four children, one who is still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Jenelyn has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more assorted fish to sell to her customers.

Jenelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more assorted fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is aged 34 years old, married and supports four children .

She has been practicing small scale farming for the last seven years, earning an income of KES 17,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy certified fertilizers for top dressing her nappier grass in order to meet her client demands, which have increased in the market, and use the surplus to buy a dairy cow.

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and expand her business.

Her hopes and dreams are to eradicate poverty and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers for top dressing her nappier grass in order to meet her client demands, which have increased in the market, and use the surplus to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en:
Nzara is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past five years, selling goat meat. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat to resell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lilia is 46 years old and has two children who are in school.

Lilia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Lilia has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Fredaliza

texts.en:
Fredaliza is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Fredaliza is 64 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Fredaliza has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Fredaliza requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more ready-to-wear products like pants, shirt, blouse, underwear, etc.

Fredaliza has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear products like pants, shirt, blouse, underwear, etc

loans.name: Salvador Humberto

texts.es: Salvador de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su compañera de vida, el se dedica desde hace 5 años a la elaboración de estructuras metálicas: puertas, balcones, portones, techos, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelente, el solicita nuevamente un crédito para la compra de más materiales como hierro, laminas, metal, electrodos, etc. ya que tiene mucha demanda porque hace un buen trabajo y asi poder seguir teniendo buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Salvador, 56 years old, lives in his own home with his two sons and his partner in life. For the past five years he has earned a living building metal structures: doors, balconies, gates, and roofs. With what he earns, he can get ahead.

Salvador is again seeking a loan to buy more materials such as iron, galvanized sheets, metal, and electrodes, since there is a lot of demand because he does good work. In this way he will be able to continue to earn a good income.

loans.use: to buy materials such as iron, galvanized sheets, metal, and electrodes.

loans.name: Indira Yolanda

texts.es: Indira de 30 años es una comerciante residente en un barrio al sur del municipio de Barranquilla que inició su negocio de venta de mercancías varias en el año 2010, promoviendo una oportunidad de ingresos adicionales a los que su cónyuge aportaba para el beneficio de su grupo familiar. Inicialmente solo comercializaba prendas de vestir sin embargo amplió su oferta de productos al considerar que en su clientela existían potenciales compradores de productos de tocador y aseo personal, de este modo se incorporó a las ventas por catálogos que manejan una amplia gama de artículos que cuentan con un reconocimiento y  garantiza la efectividad de las ventas.  Lo que más le agrada a Indira de su labor es que puede compartir más tiempo con su hija de 12 años y encargarse de las labores del hogar sin afectar su proyección de ventas, puesto que no cuenta con horario laboral rígido y simplemente busca momentos propicios para compartir con sus amistades, vecinos y familiares e inmediatamente oferta sus productos. Como su capital es insuficiente para responder a las solicitudes de sus clientes está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá productos del catálogo entre ellos cosméticos, shampoo, cremas corporales y fragancias.  Esta inversión mejorará su capital de trabajo y los tiempos de respuesta a sus solicitudes de pedido.  Su meta a futuro es adquirir unas vitrinas para exhibir productos desde su vivienda.
texts.en: Indira is a 30-year-old businesswoman living in a neighborhood south of the town of Barranquilla who started her business selling various merchandise in 2010, bring an opportunity for income in addition to her husband's contributions for the benefit of her family. Initially she only sold clothing however she expanded her product offerings upon considering that in her clientele there could exist potential buyers of toiletries and personal hygiene products, in this way she incorporated the catalog sales that allow an increased spectrum of items that are recognized and guarantee the effectiveness of her sales. What Indira likes most about her work is that she can spend more time with her 12-year-old daughter and do her work from home without affecting her sales, she doesn't count on a rigid work schedule and simply looks for good moments to share and offer her products with her friends, neighbors, and family. Since her resources are insufficient to respond to the requests from her clients she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will invest in catalog products including cosmetics, shampoo, body lotions, and perfumes. This investment will improve her work resources and her response time for requests. Her future goal is to acquire some windows to display products in her home.

loans.use: to invest in catalogue products including cosmetics, shampoo, body lotion, and fragrances.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es: Desde hace 5 años Marcelo se gana la vida con su negocio, en el cual presta sus servicios de mecánico de obra de banco elaborando estructuras metálicas, como: puertas, ventanas, balcones, portones, entre otros. Marcelo cuenta con 28 años de edad y vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su padre al que apoya en su vejez. Marcelo desea invertir en herramientas para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: herramientas, hierro, electrodos, etc., para mejorar su servicio y tener más clientes.
texts.en:
For five years Marcelo has earned a living with his business, in which he offers his services as a work bench mechanic, making metallic structures like doors, windows, balconies, and entrances, among other things. Marcelo is 28 years old and lives in his own house along with his father whom he supports in his old age.

Marcelo wishes to invest in tools in order offer better service to his customers. For this he requests a loan from FUSAI in order to buy in tools, steel, electrodes, etc., in order to improve service and get more customers.

loans.use: to buy tools, steel, electrodes, etc., in order to improve service and get more clients.

loans.name: Rio

texts.en: Rio is 34 years old and married and she lives in Lao Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is in the mango plantation business. She has earned good income from this business, which enables her to sufficiently support the needs of her family. She is a member of Paglaum MPC and accesses its financial services to purchase insecticides for mango plantations. Rio is looking forward to having a good yield this harvesting season.

loans.use: to purchase insecticides for mango plantations

loans.name: Tuychi

texts.ru:
Туйчи семейный мужчина. Ему 29 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Он живёт вместе с родителями.  Он с раннего возраста был приучен к труду.  Туйчи работает председателем дехканского хозяйства.  
Чтобы иметь дополнительный доход  Туйчи занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. От данного бизнеса он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Туйчи в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота. Сейчас Туйчи хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Туйчи очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Tuychi is a family man. He is 29 and married with two children. He lives with his parents. From an early age he has become accustomed to hard work. He works as the head of a midsize farm, and runs his own business for additional income, fattening and selling cattle, from which he earns a good income. His wife also helps him with this work by selling the milk they get from their cows.

Tuychi wants to increase his quantity of livestock in order to expand his business. Therefore he has approached Arvand and wants to take out a loan to purchase cattle. He hopes very much for a successful result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma landed at the right place for the capital she needed when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet after her first business went bad. PMPC loaned Vilma money when she needed it most. Now she has taken another loan for the next crop season. She borrowed to buy bags of fertilizer and to pay for the labor cost of land preparation. Vilma perseveres and always hopes to reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer and to pay for the labor cost of land preparation.

loans.name: Grenly

texts.en:
Grenly is 45 years old, residing at Southern Poblacion, Plaridel, Mis.Occ. She is married and blessed with children who are of school age.

She joined PMPC in order to access the programs and services of the said coop. Recently, she's accessing her eighth loan in the amount of PHP 20,000 for additional working capital for her existing business to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups.

Jessie tried her luck in doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels that she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital.

She borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help her farming income a big boost. Jessie looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Mwamauka

texts.en:
Mwamauka is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana started her small time business and became a boss with her sari-sari store (convenience store).

She has managed to have enough inventory and she rolls up her capital to gain more profit. Every day she has made good sales since she is the only store in their barangay.

Recently she approached Paglaum and availed a loan for her much needed capital to restock the store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to mount a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Entering into a particular business is a very challenging one especially when there are difficulties that narrow the way. That is why, many entrepreneurs tend to stop and close their businesses because they weren’t able to manage them well or perhaps, they try to go for another business. And these circumstances are what Elena is trying to escape, most especially now that life is much tougher for her as a widow. Thus, to be able to this, she is making sure that she’s organizing well her current trade.

As of now, the nature of her business deals with sako or plastic bags. Most of her hours every day are spent in the market place in Batasan, Quezon City, where she offers her items to customers. Despite her perseverance, it still becomes hard for her because she doesn’t have her own store. That’s why she’s only settling for renting a place. For almost eight years in this inventory she has desired to do so and now she comes to Kiva to realize this.

She would like to borrow a loan of PHP 10,000. Through this amount, she can finally improve her business. She hopes that you help her gain this amount because this will help her family most especially.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of plastic bags to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a strong willed woman who will do anything for her family. She is 47 years old, married, and lives in Looc Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

She operates a hog raising business which is primarily financed by Paglaum MPC that gives her quarterly income of approximately PHP 20,000 that sufficiently provides the needs of her family.

Recently, she avails another loan to buy heads of piglets & purchase bags of animal feeds.

loans.use: to buy heads of piglets & purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna has always had enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Sibula, Lopez Jaena, and has had yielded good earnings doing this type of work.

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Myrna knew that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida has been raised by a carpenter father. Inspired by the carpentry skills of her father, she decided to venture into furniture making business.

Unable to sustain her business due to financial constraints, she signed up with Paglaum MPC for additional capital. Now that she has successfully repaid all her loans without records of defaults, she applies for an amount to expand her furniture production. The amount of PHP 20,000.00 to purchase lumber, varnish, paints, and carving tools for furniture making business.

loans.use: to purchase lumber, varnish, paints, and carving tools for her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is driven by passion for selling. At the age of 59, married, and living in Sibula, Lopez Jaena, Mismais Occidental, she runs a store that primarily supports their family. Every day she never gets tired of tending her store.

Bonifacia is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without record of default. Now, she took another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell.

Having enough inventories would mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Floramie

texts.en:
Floramie is eager to wake up everyday to attend to her little sari-sari store (convenience store) that she ventures into with the financial aid of Paglaum MPC.

Floramie decided to venture into this type of business, knowing there are few stores located on their place. This time, she wants to restock her store with consumable goods such as canned goods, noodles, soy sauce, vinegar and cooking oil.

loans.use: to restock her store with consumable goods such as canned goods, noodles, soy sauce, vinegar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda has owned and operated a convenience store for 30 years. With good sales from her business, she was able to send all her children to school until they finished college.

Linda has been a member of Paglaum MPC for almost 20 years and availed various loan products. She manages her accounts by paying on time and has no records of default. Currently, she would like a loan to restock her store with canned goods, vinegar, soy sauce, cooking oil, noodles and drinking soda.

loans.use: to restock her store with canned goods, vinegar, soy sauce, cooking oil, noodles and drinking soda.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is a married woman with four children. She is 49 years old and three of her children are presently in school.

Emelita is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Emelita has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Desiree

texts.en:
Desiree is a loving mother and a hardworking businesswoman and public servant. She owns and operates a convenience store that sells basic commodities from her place.

Desiree is a member of Paglaum MPC, which primarily provides various assistance, including financial assistance, to members like her. Desiree is grateful that she landed on the right financial partner. Recently, she requested a loan to restock her store with basic commodities such as rice, canned goods, condiments and confectioneries.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities such as rice, canned goods, condiments and confectioneries.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is a farmer in Puntod, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She has been farming and grows various vegetables like bitter gourds, peppers, eggplants, pumpkins and others that supply the local market.

Arlyn made a good return on investments and was able to buy another parcel of land to cultivate. She is grateful for the financial assistance of Paglaum MPC that supported her from land preparations to post harvest operations. Currently, she is asking for a loan to purchase bags of fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 34 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are currently in school.

Cheryl is in the agricultural business, and fattens pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Cheryl has been in this business for nine years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lucila is 54 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Lucila has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines. Lucila requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed like cuticle items, nail polish, brushes, etc.

Lucila has been in this business for two years. In the future, Lucila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like cuticle items, nail polish, brushes, etc.

loans.name: Ina

texts.en:
Ina is 27 years old, and she works hard to support her family. She is a hospital administrator and although her family works very hard, it can be difficult for them to afford the cost of her brother's education.

This loan of $ 1,000 will allow Ina to send her brother to university. She will use the loan to pay for his tuition, textbooks, and school supplies. Ina loves her brother very much and hopes that further education will help them to have a brighter future. Now her brother lives far from her family's place.

loans.use: to pay for her brother's tuition, textbooks, school supplies and other things when he needs them.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena opened her business in 2012 with a capital base of $1,000. Now she requests a loan of $1,000 from the Tuba Rai Metin to add to her capital and buy more goods such as cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, Coca Cola, Sprite, beer, rice, slippers, books and fish.

Filomena plans to open a bigger business in the future. She is the kind of woman who is very interested in business, and she is not overly dependent on her husband to be responsible in the household. When there is a market day, she always carries her belongings and wares to sell there. Filomena also keeps animals at her place such as pigs, chickens and dogs.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, Coca Cola, Sprite, beer, rice, slippers, books and fish.

loans.name: Maa Shakti Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Rupadei, 33, is a simple, sober and entrepreneurial lady standing to the right-hand side in the photograph. She has two daughters in her care.

She has been running her own general store since March 2012. She has five years of experience in this domain, since she used to work in the same domain in a big grocery store in Koraput market before she started this business.

Rupadei is working hard to make sure that she can support her children and raise them properly, taking the role of both the caring mother and the hardworking father at the same time, as she has been separated from her husband for the last three years.

Today, she, along with her fellow group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. Her acquired loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with cold drinks, cosmetic products and a fridge, since currently she can't afford doing so because of the increased living needs of her children.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with cold drinks, cosmetic products and a fridge

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 21-year-old, single man from Deir Al-balah, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house.

Hassan has a workshop for selling marble and granite in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but Gaza Strip is a difficult place to live due to the Israeli economic blockade, in place since 2007.

Hassan took a loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy new tools for use in cutting marble and granite in his workshop. He hopes that this new tools will enable him to increase his sales and customers, and eventually, save enough income to get married.

loans.use: to buy new tools for use in cutting marble and granite in his workshop.

loans.name: Maybel

texts.en:
Maybel is 29 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are presently in school.

Maybel is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies.

Maybel has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anabell

texts.en:
Anabell is 38 years old, and married with four children.

Anabell works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products.

Anabell has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from E-loading. She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en:
Diosa is 64 years old, married and has one child.

Diosa is in the agricultural business of farming bananas in the Philippines. Diosa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Diosa has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marcelita

texts.en:
Marcelita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marcelita is 50 years old, and four of her children are in school.

Marcelita has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Marcelita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business such as sugar, oil, vinegar, cereals, etc.

Marcelita has been in this business for two years. In the future, Marcelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business such as sugar, oil, vinegar, cereals, etc.

loans.name: Felisiano

texts.en:
Felisiano is a man who is very interested in business and is also a carpenter. He is not overly dependent on his wife to be responsible in the household.

Felisiano requests a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to his capital to buy more goods such as sugar, salts, cooking oils, tea, biscuits, cigarettes, eggs, candles, soaps, soy sauce, ketchup, toothpaste, lighters, soft drinks, slippers and other things to sell.

Felisiano plans to open a bigger business in the future. He opened his business in 2013 with a capital base of $250.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salts, cooking oils, tea, biscuits, cigarettes, eggs, candles, soaps, soy sauce, ketchup, toothpaste, lighters, soft drinks, slippers and other things to sell.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Romana to improve her business. She is married and she has three children.

Romana has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as noodles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt, milks, water, body lotion, fish, slippers, Coca-Cola, beer, Fanta, Sprite and eggs.

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Romana independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt, milks, water, body lotion, fish, slippers, Coca-Cola, beer, Fanta, Sprite and eggs.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past three years, selling goat meat to the neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats to slaughter and get meat for resale.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats to slaughter and get meat for resale.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 57 years old and married with four children. Maribel works very hard to provide for them.

Maribel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Maribel has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, condiments, candies, biscuits and other groceries.

In the future, Maribel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie is 37 years old and married with four children; two of them are presently in school. Girlie works very hard to provide for them.

Girlie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, soap and other personal care products.

Girlie has been in this business for 25 years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, soap and other personal care products.

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en:
Cristine is 28 years old and married with two children. Cristine works very hard to provide for them.

Cristine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, soap and other personal care products.

Cristine has been in this business for four years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, soap and other personal care products.

loans.name: Maricela Eulogia

texts.es: Maricela de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros desde hace 15 años su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Maricela is 49 years of age and lives in her own home with her life partner and her son. She has worked selling clothing for men and women for the last 15 years. She runs her business from home and has many customers. With her sales she is able to cover some of the household bills.

Maricela is applying for a loan to buy more clothing in bulk and have a higher income.

loans.use: to buy more clothing in bulk

loans.name: Nayalgue Group

texts.fr:
Zinabou est une femme âgée de 39 ans mariée mère de 2 enfants.

Elle exerce son activité de vendeuse de pagne, de chaussures, de bijoux depuis 7 ans.

Ce qui fait marcher son activité ce sont : son dynamisme, l’emplacement de son lieu de commerce, son accueil, son respect du client et son amour de son travail. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter des pagnes à 495 000 f.

L’utilité du prêt d’approvisionner sa boutique en quantité suffisante afin de renforcer son activité. 

Elle a déjà reçu le prêt  plusieurs fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues à ACFIME.
texts.en:
Zinabou is thirty-nine years old, married and mother to two children. She has been selling pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing), shoes and jewellery for seven years. Her business success is due to her dynamism, the good situation of her shop, her warm welcome, her respect for her customers and the love of her work.

Zinabou has requested this loan of 495,000 francs CFA to increase her stock levels of pagnes and build up her business.

Zinabou has had several loans before and has always respected the repayment dates set by the field partner, ACFIME.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing).

loans.name: Wendinso Group

texts.fr:
Fatimata, est une femme âgée de 33 ans mariée mère de 3 enfants dont 2 scolarisés.
 
Elle exerce son activité  de vendeuses de pagnes depuis 11 ans.
 
Ce qui fait marcher son activité c’est le respect et son accueil qui lui ont permis de maintenir ses clients. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter des pagnes à 300 000 f et pour acheter les tenues d’enfants. 

L’utilité du prêt c’est de réapprovisionner sa boutique afin de renforcer son activité.
 
Elle a déjà reçu le prêt plusieurs fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues à ACFIME.
texts.en:
Fatimata is thirty-three years old, married and mother to three children, two of whom attend school. She has been selling pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for eleven years. Her business is successful due to the respect she has for her customers and the warm welcome she offers them.

Fatimata has requested this loan to buy pagnes for 300,000 francs CFA and children's clothing. This will help build up her stock levels and strengthen her business.

Fatimata has already had several loans from the field partner, ACFIME, and has always respected the repayment dates set.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) and children's clothing.

loans.name: Ntavumba Group

texts.fr:
Ernest fait partie du groupe  Ntavumva et  habite à  Bubanza. Il a 29 ans et est marié à Françoise, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants âgés de 3 à 7 ans. 

Il  fait le commerce de la bière depuis 3 ans.  

Il est son troisième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de caisses  de bière  et de limonade à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  pratiquer l'élevage de vaches, et voir ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ernest is a member of the Ntavumva Group and lives in Bubanza. He is twenty-nine years old and married to Françoise who is a retailer. Together they have two children aged three and seven years. He has been selling beer for three years.

This will be Ernest's third loan with the field partner, Turame. He plans to use it to increase his working capital and buy many crates of beer and lemonade to increase his earnings.

In the coming years, Ernest would like to start raising cattle and see his children study.

loans.use: to increase his working capital and buy many crates of beer and lemonade for resale.

loans.name: Silvia Yesenia

texts.es: Silvia tiene 32 años de edad y se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de comida y productos básicos desde hace 5 años, por lo que gracias a su amabilidad y experiencia cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos. Silvia habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos una niña de 11 años y un varón de 7 años de edad. Silvia desea ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor servicio y una mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes, y de esta manera mejorar sus ganancias y su cartera de clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: verduras, legumbres, granos básicos, carnes, entre otros para ofrecer mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: Silvia is 32 years old and has worked selling food and basic items for five years. Thanks to her kindness and experience she has a lot of customers who request her products. Silvia lives in a house of her own with her life partner and their two children: a girl aged 11 and a boy aged 7. Silvia wants to offer her customers a better service and more products to increase her earnings and her customer base, so she has applied for a loan from FUSAI to buy vegetables, legumes, staple grains and meat, amongst other items.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, legumes, staple grains and meat, amongst other items, to offer a better service to her customers

loans.name: Adham

texts.en:
Adham is 24 years old and single with no kids. He runs a barber shop in Al-Khader in Bethlehem city. He has been running this business for 2 years. Adham took some training courses to open his shop and then started buying the needed equipment to open it. This store is the only source of income for Adham.

Adham says that the main challenges of his business are the business marketing limitations, and the seasonality of the business.

Adham has requested the loan to buy new equipment for the salon. The extra income from this loan will allow him to redecorate the salon. In the future he plans to employ a new barber to expand his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy new salon equipment.

loans.name: Monalisa

texts.en:
Monalisa is a 47-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Monalisa has a business making delicacies in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, oil, etc. She has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future, Monalisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
