Rose Marie is a 50-year-old married woman with seven children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rose Marie has a business making hollow blocks in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy cement, sand and other materials for her business. She has been in this business for 15 years.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and other materials for her business

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 41 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Nilda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as junk foods, biscuits, straw, coffee, and other groceries.

In the future, Nilda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Wend Loiim Taore 2 Group

texts.fr:
Fatimata  est âgée de 36 ans mariée mère de 4 enfants. 
 
Elle exerce son activité depuis 10 ans dans la vente de pagnes et de savons. 

Ce qui fait marcher son activité c’est  qu’elle est une femme battante, dynamique, rigoureuse dans son commerce et aussi  respect bien ses clients. 

Elle veut le prêt pour acheter des pagnes à 175 000 f et acheter du savon à 50 000 f.
 
L’utilité du prêt c’est de renforcer son activité. 

Elle a déjà reçu le prêt  plusieurs fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Fatimata is thirty-six years old, married and mother to four children. She has been selling pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) and soap for ten years. Her business is successful due to her dynamism, her fighting-spirit, her good working practices and her respect for her customers.

Fatimata has requested this loan to buy pagnes for 175,000 francs CFA and soap for 50,000 francs CFA. This will build up her business.

Fatimata has already had several loans from the field partner and has always repaid them on time.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) and soap for sale.

loans.name: Tubogorane Group

texts.fr:
Jérémie  fait partie du groupe  Tubogorane et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 45 ans et est marié à Habonimana ,une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés de 4 à 15 ans, dont  5 étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de  fruit et fromage depuis  20 ans. 

Il est à son  troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de  fruits et de fromage à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il aimerait pratiquer l'agriculture et  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Jérémie is a member of the Tubogorane Group and lives in Bujumbura. He is forty-five years old and married to Habonimana who is a farmer. Together they have six children aged from four to fifteen years old. Five of their children currently attend school.

Jérémie has been selling fruit and cheese for twenty years. This will be his third loan with the field partner, Turame. It will increase his working capital and allow him to buy a large quantity of fruit and cheese to improve his earnings.

In the coming years, Jérémie would like to become a farmer and see his children study

loans.use: to increase his working capital and buy a large quantity of fruit and cheese for sale.

loans.name: Molyn

texts.en:
Molyn is a 40-year-old single woman with one child who is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Molyn has a food production / vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like banana, flour, cooking oil and other materials for her food production business. She has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like banana, flour, cooking oil and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Mwanamiraji

texts.en:
Mwanamiraji is a married woman with five kids, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

Mwanamiraji operates a vegetable and grocery selling stall, and she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase a stock of tomatoes, onions, mangoes and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of tomatoes, onions, mangoes and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Myrnalyn

texts.en:
Myrnalyn is a 22-year-old single woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Myrnalyn has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed in her business. She has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future, Myrnalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids, all who attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Judith operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over 4 years. She mentioned losses caused by disease as a challenge in the business. Judith dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Raquel works hard to support her family.

She has a vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and sell rice. Raquel is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy equipment like clamps and shop interiors for her vulcanizing shop business.

Raquel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy equipment like clamps and shop interiors for her vulcanizing shop business.

loans.name: Magu Group

texts.en:
Jamadin is in his mid 50s, is married with two children who are grown up. He has been selling second hand clothes for five years now. He works from 09am to 05pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be his 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to keep on increasing the second hand clothes and selecting the fast moving items. He has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He is grateful with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. He used the profit to take care of his family, reinvest in business, to repay loan, bought a land, started building his house and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy fast moving second hand clothes to meet her customer requirements. He dreams of owning a car.

Jamadin will share this loan with his loan group Magu which consists of two members whop will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fast moving second hand clothes to meet her customer requirement.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is 25 years old and has three children. Aiza is married and has two children are still in school.

Aiza is in the agricultural business, farming banana in the Philippines. Aiza requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Aiza has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosemarie is 49 years old and has three children who are in school.

Rosemarie has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, sugar, banana, oil, etc..

Rosemarie has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, sugar, banana, oil, etc.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 50 years old and married with five children.

Sylvia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like delicacies, beverages, and other groceries.

Sylvia has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Sylvia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like delecacies, beverages, and other groceries

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is 33 and the mother of four children living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She is a tailor by profession. She engages in a clothing sewing center to earn an income. She started her sewing center 12 years ago, because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses. She has as her source of work the creation of all types of articles of clothing.

Now she wants to increase her business. Tahira is requesting a loan amount 40000 PKR from KIVA's partner BRAC Pakistan. The loan will be used to buy a sewing machine, which she needs to be able to fulfill the requests of her customers.
Tahira will be thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine for her clothes sewing center.

loans.name: Sareoun's Group

texts.en: Sareoun’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sareoun makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un padre de familia de 27 años de edad, es soltero con una linda familia de un hijo de 6 meses, ella vive en una comunidad de la aldea guiniales.
Manuel  para ofrecerle a su familia lo mejor y que no les falte nada se dedica desde hace 6 años a la venta de almácigos de café injertadas con esta labor a su familia ha logrado sacar adelante. Manuel eligió esta actividad porque es una labor que le permite cuidar de la naturaleza y sobre todo porque en su región mucha gente se dedica al cultivo de café y esto es bastante rentable para él. 
Manuel para que sus ingresos mejoren a considerado necesario realizar otra actividad a parte de la venta de almácigos, es por ello que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para la compra de dos cuerdas de terreno con  cultivo de café y banano. Su esperanza es  construir una casa grande para que su familia viva mejor.
texts.en:
Manuel is 27 years old and a family father. He is single with a beautiful family of a 6-month old child, and they are living in a community in Aldea Guineales.

Manuel has been earning a living for the past six years selling coffee seedlings for transplanting to offer his family the best and so they won't lack anything. With this work he has managed to finacially get ahead with his family. Manuel chose this work because it allows him to care for nature, and, on top of that, a lot of people in his region grow coffee so this is very profitable for him.

To increase his income, Manuel is viewing it as necessary to start another activity beside selling seedlings. This is why he decided to request a loan to buy two acres of land for growing coffee and bananas. His goal is to build a big house so his family can have a better life.

loans.use: to buy two acres of land.

loans.name: La Manzanita Group

texts.es:
Por primera vez se encuentran los socios del grupo ¨La Manzanita¨, comprometiéndose a una fianza solidaria para solicitar crédito e invertirlo en el mejoramiento y engrandecimientos de sus negocios. Coordinado por Reina, de 39, soltera y con 4 hijos a su cargo de edades 21, gemelos de 20 y su hijo menor de 9 años, los cuales son su motor de vida y fuente inspiración. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas, y con el crédito invertirá para la compra por mayor de mamón y nancite frutas demandas en la temporada actual. Con las ganancias ahorradas podrá cumplir con las cuotas del crédito e igual podrá realizar mejoras a su casa.
Las otras integrantes son Ana, de 26 años, quien tiene pulpería y venta de nacatamales. Y Carlos de 22 años dedicado a la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
The first time the members of the La Manzanita [engl. the bearberry] group met, they committed themselves to this join together to request a loan and invest in the improvement and growth of their businesses.

They are coordinated by Reina, who is single, 39 years old, and has 4 children to take care of: a 21-year-old, 20-year-old twins, and a minor of 9 years. They are the motor of her life and a her source of inspiration.

She is earning a living by selling fruits, and will invest this loan in buying papayas and nancite berries, that are in demand this season.

With the profit gained she will be able to make the loan repayments, as well as improvements to her house.

The other members are Ana, 26 year old, who owns a general store and sells nacatamales [a kind of tamales], and Carlos, 22 years old, who sells clothing.

loans.use: to invest in buying papayas and nance berries in bulk.

loans.name: Lucia Ingrid

texts.es: Lucia de 25 años de edad se gana la vida con la venta de platos típicos, actividad que realiza en su vivienda desde hace 1 año, y es gracias a este negocio  que logra sacar adelante a su familia, además su esposo le apoya con los gastos de su hogar. Lucia habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 3 años de edad al que cuidan mucho. Lucia desea terminar la instalación de energía eléctrica en su vivienda, pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: alambre eléctrico, caja térmica, toma corriente y mano de obra para instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda y de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Lucia is 25 years old and earns a living by selling typical dishes. She has been doing this for a year, selling from her house. Thanks to this business she has managed to improve her family's situation. Her husband has also supported her by covering the household expenses.

Lucia lives in a house on her property, together with her spouse and her 3-year-old son, about whom they care a lot.

Lucia wants to finish the installation of electricity in her home, but does not have the needed liquid funds. This is why she is requesting a loan with FUSAI to invest in: electric wires, a fuse box, sockets, and labor to install electricity in her home, and thus improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in: electric wires, a fuse box, sockets, and labor to install electricity in her home.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman with three children, one of whom is still in school. She is 45 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Imelda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials such as bamboo, gasoline for her boat, fish net and other materials for her business.

She has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, gasoline for her boat, fishing net and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Sokean's Group

texts.en: Sokean’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokean makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, as well as saving time needed for collecting fuel and boiling the water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Naziha

texts.en: Naziha is a 61-year-old married mother of eight children. In order to support her family, 35 years ago, Naziha started a business of selling vegetables and fruits in a shop that she owns. Naziha is a hard-working and efficient woman who cares so much for her business and is always looking for ways to improve her shop. She would like to expand her shop and stock it. In order to do that, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise and diversify the products in her shop. Naziha hopes to stay in good health and remain capable of developing her businesses and supporting her beloved family.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise and diversify the products in her shop.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells maize. She has been involved in this business for 3 years and her primary customers are locals. She will use this loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more stocks of maize. Her business goal is to have a big store within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of maize.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 49 years old and has three children. She is married and one child is still in school.

Gloria is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Gloria has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María es una mujer esforzada, de cincuenta y un años de edad, ella posee un negocio de pulpería, al cual se ha dedicado en cuerpo y alma. Tiene cuatro hijos, quienes son su mayor soporte. Su espíritu emprendedor y varios créditos, la han llevado hacer de su negocio prospero. Está muy agradecida con Kiva y MiCrédito por la oportunidad que brindan. 
Ha vuelto a recurrir a Kiva junto a MiCrédito, para que se le otorgue un financiamiento que le permita comprar en arroz, pollo, embutidos, maíz, frijoles y azúcar, dado que estos productos son lo principales que su clientela busca. En un futuro se ve siendo dueña de una gran distribuidora de granos básicos.
texts.en:
Maria is a strong woman of 51 years of age. She owns a general store, to which she has devoted her body and soul. She has four children, who are her biggest support.

Her enterprising spirit and several loans have made her business thrive. She is very thankful for Kiva and MiCrédito for the opportunity they offer.

She turned to Kiva and MiCrédito to be granted a loan which allows her to buy rice, chicken, dried sausages, corn, beans and sugar, since these are the main products her customers are looking for.

In the future she wants to keep on being a big distributor of basic grains.

loans.use: to buy rice, chicken, sausages, corn, beans, and sugar.

loans.name: El Deportivo Group

texts.es:
Grupo ¨El Deportivo¨, esta por 5ta vez, solicitando crédito para poder mejorar sus actividades económicas, así procuran mejor la calidad de vida de su familia. 
La líder es María Isabel, de 54 años, quien se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva ambulante en la comarca, desde hace 4 años tiene este negocio con la ayuda económica de su conyuge. Dedicada a su negocio, desea del crédito para la compra de pantalones, camisetas, blusas y ropa intima para sus clientes que son variados tanto como adultos y niños.
Las demás socias, son Reyna de 55 años quien prepara y vende tortilla, y vende leña desde hace 6 años. Yahaira, de 31 años, dedicada a la preparación de comida y gaseosas desde hace 8 años.
texts.en:
The "El Deportivo (The Sports)" group is in its 5th loan cycle, and is looking for a loan to be able to improve their work and seek a better quality of life for their families.

The leader is María Isabel. She is 54 years old and makes a living selling new clothing on the street in the region. She has had the business for 4 years, with the economic help from her partner. Dedicated to her business, she wants the loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and underwear for her customers who vary from adults to children.

The other members are Reyna, who is 55 years old and has made and sold tortillas and firewood for 6 years, and Yahaira, who is 31 years old and has worked making food and soft drinks for 8 years.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and underwear for her customers.

loans.name: Nidia Yesenia

texts.es: Nidia, tiene 38 años de edad,  es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y reside en un sector del municipio de la Ceiba, Atlántida. Nidia laboró para una maquila por varios años. Hace un año quedó sin empleo y  decidió poner su propio negocio  de venta de productos alimenticios  como: golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, verduras, lácteos, azúcar, manteca, pastas, productos de aseo y otros abarrotes. Además Nidia también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Ha solicitado un segundo prestamo a ODEF,  por un monto de 21,000 Lempiras para surtir su negocio y aumentar el inventario, comprara granos básicos, manteca, verduras, pan, refrescos, golosinas, azucar, harina, pastas, productos de limpieza, lacteos y otros para surtir y vender. Su meta es ampliar pagar el estudio a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nidia is 38 years old. She is a single mother with 3 children and she lives in a sector of the town of La Ceiba, Atlántida. Nidia worked for an assembly factory for several years. A year ago she was left unemployed and she decided to set up her own business selling food products, such as: candy, soft drinks, basic grains, vegetables, dairy products, sugar, butter, pasta, toiletries and other grocery items. Nidia also sells cosmetics.

She is asking for a second loan through ODEF, for a sum of 21,000 Lemprias, to supply her business and increase inventory. She will buy basic grains, butter, vegetables, bread, soft drinks, candy, sugar, flour, pasta, cleaning products, dairy products, and others to supply and sell. Her goal is to pay for her children's education and to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, butter, vegetables, bread, soft drinks, candy, sugar, flour, pasta, cleaning products, dairy products, and others to sell.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su mama y su sobrino, el se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas y granos básicos, también se dedica a la crianza de ganado, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, el esta solicitanso nuevamente un crédito para la compra de insumos para el cultivo como herbicidas, abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, controles de plagas, etc. y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is 31 years old and lives in his own house with his mom and nephew. He makes a living growing vegetables and basic grains. He also breeds cattle. He sells his products around the area.

He is asking for a new loan to buy supplies for the crops such as herbicides, manure, fertilizers, seeds, pest controls, etc. He wants to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the crops such as herbicides, manure, fertilizers, seeds, pest controls, etc.

loans.name: Ana Raquel

texts.es: Ana es una microempresaria de 55 años que reside en un barrio del municipio de Soledad y en medio de su separación,una difícil situación sentimental, tuvo que implementar un nuevo estilo de vida y ello conllevaba a generar ingresos para su autosustento.  Recibió el consejo de una amiga que la adentro al comercio y de inmediato empezó a promover ventas por intermedio de un catálogo de productos que ofrece una variada gama de artículos entre ellos productos de tocador, aseo persona, línea hogar y prendas de vestir.  No obstante sus dotes culinarios se hicieron notar en los postres que elabora por encargos de sus clientes y que proporcionan una buena parte de su ingreso.  Sin duda, Ana es una emprendedora mujer que entrega lo mejor de sí y ha logrado obtener su beneficio con las actividades que realiza, así mismo está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en artículos del catálogo e insumos y materias primas para sus postres; harina, crema de leche, leche condensada, pulpa de frutas, mermeladas entre otros.  Esta inversión es muy importante para dinamizar sus ventas y apoyar en su meta de tener su propia tienda de postres con la que su calidad de vida será mucho mejor.
texts.en:
Ana is a 55 year old, small businesswoman who lives in a neighborhood in the town of Soledad. In the midst of her divorce, a difficult emotional situation, she had to implement a new lifestyle which included getting an income to support herself. She received advice from a friend to delve into business and immediately she began to boost sales through a catalog of products that offers a variety of articles. Among them are toiletries, personal care, home goods and clothing.

All the same, her culinary skills are noted in the desserts that she makes from customer orders, which provide a good portion of her income. Without a doubt, Ana is an entrepreneurial woman who gives her all and has managed to get benefit from the jobs that she does.

She is applying for her first CrediKiva through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to buy catalog items, and supplies and raw materials for her desserts: flour, cream, condensed milk, fruit pulp, marmalades, and others. This investment is very important for boosting her sales and supporting her goal of having her own dessert shop, which will make her quality of life much better.

loans.use: to buy catalog items, and supplies and raw materials for her desserts: flour, cream, condensed milk, fruit pulp, marmalades, and others.

loans.name: Carlos Alfonso

texts.es: Carlos de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee una panadería ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 3 años, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que elabora el pan, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con las gastos del hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, jaleas de sabores, moldes, etc. Para poder seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Carlos is 65 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife. He has owned a bread bakery, located in his home, for three years. He has a lot of customers because of the quality he uses to make the bread. With the profits he obtains, he is able to get ahead with the household expenses. He is asking for a loan to buy flour, sugar, flavored jellies, molds, etc., to be able to continue with his work and have more income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, flavored jellies, molds, etc.

loans.name: Reina Marlene

texts.es: Reina de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Reina is 36 years old and lives in her own home with her two children. She has made a living for several years making and selling tortillas. Her business is located in her home and she has lots of customers. With what she gets from her sales, she manages to resolve some household expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy pounds of corn, and lime, to be able to continue making tortillas and thus have a better income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pounds of corn, and lime.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José, tiene 51 años de edad, está casado, tiene 3 hijos y reside con su familia en un sector del Municipio de San Pedro Sula, Cortes. Jose anteriormente trabajaba en la agricultura pero no obtenía ingresos suficientes para manutención de la familia y decidió vender mercadería, lleva dos años de tenerlo y vende ropa interior, camisas, sandalias, blusas, jeans y otros. Vende en su casa y también de manera ambulante. José ha solicitado un prestamo por 5,000 Lempiras para comprar nueva  ropa y sandalias para vender y poder mejorar su situación económica. Su sueño es que el negocio sea administrado por su familia y crecer profesionalmente.
texts.en: José is 51 years old. He is married and has 3 children. He lives with his family in an area of the municipality of San Pedro Sula, Cortes. Jose used to work in agriculture, but he didn't get enough income to support his family and he decided to sell merchandise. He has been doing it for two years and he sells underwear, shirts, sandals, blouses, jeans and more. He sells from his house and also as a street vendor. José has asked for a loan of 5,000 Lempiras to buy new clothes and sandals to sell and be able to improve his financial situation. His dream is for his business to be run by his family and to grow professionally.

loans.use: to buy new clothes and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Yanira Haydee

texts.es: Yanira de 35 años de edad es madre soltera y  habita en casa de su propiedad junto a sus dos hijos una niña de 6 años y un varón de 2 meses de edad, a los que está sacando adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Yanira se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos, de forma domiciliar, actividad que le permite sostener la economía de su hogar. Yanira desea mejorar el techo de su vivienda, ya que en época de lluvia, las fuertes lluvias, deterioran más sus pocas pertenencias y causan enfermedades de respiratorias a sus hijos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: madera, láminas y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda y proteger a sus hijos.
texts.en: Yanira is 35 years old. She is a single mother and she lives in her own home with her two children, a 6 year old girl and a 2 month old boy, whom she is getting ahead with much effort.  Yanira works offering domestic services in people's homes. This activity allows her to support the family financially. Yanira wants to improve the roof on her home, since in the rainy season the strong rains deteriorate her few possessions and cause respiratory illnesses in her children. That is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy wood, sheeting and nails to change the roof on her house and protect her children.

loans.use: to buy wood, sheeting and nails to change the roof on her home and protect her children.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efraín es un hombre de 42 años de edad que vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposa y su hija de 5 años de edad que es la alegría de su hogar. Efraín se gana la vida prestando sus servicios de cobrador de transporte colectivo, actividad que le permite sostener a su familia y cubrir los gastos económicos de su familia. Efraín desea construir una galera en su vivienda, la cual le permita contar con un lugar más adecuado para la cocina de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para construir una galera en su vivienda, que le permita brindar mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en: Efraín is 42-years old and lives in a house on his property with his wife and his 5-year old daughter, who is the joy of his home. Efraín makes a living providing services of public transport collector. This job allows him to support his family and cover the family's economic expenses. Efraín wants to build a shed in his home, which will allow him to have a better place for the kitchen. He is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy metal sheets, wood, nails and wire to build a shed in his house, which allows him to give his family more comfort.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, wood, nails and wire to build a shed in his house, which allows him to give his family more comfort.

loans.name: Dionisio Antonio

texts.es: Dionisio de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelante con su familia, el quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo pero como no posee suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de laminas, polines y pago de mano de obra para poder vivir seguros y comodos.
texts.en: Dionisio is 41 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and son. He works as an employee of a private business. With what he gets from his job, he manages to get ahead with his family. He wants to improve his house by changing the roof, but he does not have enough money. He is asking for a loan to buy sheets, poles and to pay labor, to be able to live safely and comfortably.

loans.use: to buy sheets, poles and to pay labor.

loans.name: Barrio La Alameda Group

texts.es:
Zoila es una gran mujer de 54 años de edad es soltera con una linda familia y viven en una comunidad de Santo Tomas La Unión.
Zoila (la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía) con el afán de darle a su familia lo mejor desde hace varios años se dedica a la compra y venta de maíz, y con el préstamo anterior le fue muy bien afortunadamente porque pudo comprar sus fertilizantes por lo que obtuvo una muy buena cosecha. Para Zoila seguir prosperando con su negocio de maíz y cultivo es muy importante, por esa razón solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y semillas de maíz  para esta nueva temporada.
Zoila sueña con tener una distribuidora de maíz para mejor sus ingresos y construir una casa más grande.
texts.en:
Zoila is a great 54-year old woman. She is single and has a lovely family. They live in a community of Santo Tomas La Unión. Zoila, (the first to the right side in the picture) with the desire to give her family the best, has worked buying and selling corn for several years. With the previous loan, she fortunately did very well because she was able to buy her fertilizers and had a very good harvest.

For Zoila, continuing to prosper with her corn business and crops is very important. For that reason, she is asking for a new loan to buy fertilizers and corn seeds for this new season. Zoila dreams of having a corn distributor to improve her income and build a bigger house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and a crop of corn.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es una mujer de 35 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 14 y 16 años, esta querida familia vive en una comunidad de Guiniales.
Manuela para sacar adelante a su familia y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, desde hace cinco años eligió una actividad que le permitiera obtener sus ingresos y desde ese entonces se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, con esta labor a su familia ha sacado adelante. Manuela ha tomado la iniciativa de comprar un terreno para la futura construcción de un local donde ella pueda vender mejor sus productos, ya que hasta ahora solo es ambulante en su mercado regional.
Su mayor sueño es construir un local para ofrecerles  una mejor atención a sus clientes y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Manuela is a 35 year old woman. She is married with a beautiful family of two children, aged 14 and 16. This beloved family lives in the community of Guiniales.

In order to get her family ahead and help her husband with the household expenses, Manuela picked an activity five years ago to allow her to obtain her income and since then she has bought and sold traditional clothing. With this work, she has gotten her family ahead. Manuela has taken the initiative of buying some land for the future construction of a locale where she can sell her products in a better way, since up to now she has sold door to door in her regional market.

Her biggest dream is to build a locale to offer her customers a better service and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy land for construction.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María de 48 años de edad es madre soltera y vive con su grupo familiar en casa de su propiedad desde hace 13 años, por lo que es muy reconocida en su comunidad como una mujer trabajadora. María presta sus servicios domésticos desde hace 6 años, por lo que se siente feliz de contar con este ingreso económico. María desea instalar agua potable en su vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tuberías, grifos, codos, etc., para instalar agua potable en su vivienda, y de esta manera mejorar la sanidad de su hogar.
texts.en:
María is 48 years old. She is a single mother and has lived with her family in a house on their property for 13 years. She is very well-known in her community as a hard-working woman. María has done household chores for 6 years and feels happy to have this income.

María wants to install drinking water in her house, so she is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy pipes, valves, kinks, etc., to install drinking water in her house, and thus improve the health of the home.

loans.use: to buy pipes, valves, kinks, etc., to install drinking water in her house, and thus improve the health of the home.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa es una mujer de 63 años de edad, es soltera con una linda familia de un hijo de 33 años de edad, esta linda familia vive en una comunidad denominada Domingo Samayac.
Tomasa para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia, desde hace 10 años se ha dedicado a la tortillería, trabajo que desempeña desde la comodidad de su hogar y esto le permite a ella realizar otras actividades. Pero otra de sus actividades es la compra y venta de paños (rebosos utilizados en esa región).
Tomasa gracias a su entusiasmo y carisma con su negocio mucha gente la busca con frecuencia por lo que su negocio ya no se da abasto con los materiales con las que cuentan, por tal razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña, comal y una estufa industrial, para darle a sus clientes mejores servicios.
Su anhelo es contar con un local para la venta de tortillas y ropa típica para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Tomasa is a 63 year old woman. She is single and has a beautiful family of one son, who is 33 years old. This family lives in the community of Domingo Samayac.

In order to obtain income and get her family ahead, for 10 years, Tomasa has worked making tortillas. She does this work in the comfort of her own home and this allow her to do other activities. Another one of her activities is buying and selling paños (shawls used in the region).

Thanks to her enthusiasm and charisma with her business, a lot of people seek out Tomasa frequently and so her business no longer has enough inventory of materials. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy corn, firewood, a comal and an industrial stove, to give her customers better service.

Her wish is to have a locale to sell the tortillas and traditional clothing to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, a comal and an industrial stove.

loans.name: Maa Shakti Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Sula, standing on the right in the photo, leads the Maa Shakti SHG-D, a self-help group comprising two enterprising and industrious women from the Koraput district of Odisha.

She is a widow and is the only breadwinner for the family. She runs a tailoring business and shoulders the responsibility of providing for her large family of six, currently contributing nearly half of the household income and saving 2,000 INR every month.

She seeks to buy a sewing machine to further expand her tailoring business. With a new sewing machine, she expects an increase of over 40% in her monthly income, which would be double her monthly savings.

She and her group member seek a loan of 30,000 INR to buy the necessary materials to expand their micro-enterprises. Your timely loan will help both women reap sizable profits and fund the education of their children.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to further expand her tailoring business.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 50 years old, married and has three children.

Amelia is in the agricultural business, farming banana in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Amelia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto es un hombre de 49 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia que vive en una comunidad del Caserío Pasac.
Alberto es un hombre que todos los días se esmera para que su familia cuente con lo necesario, Alberto con el préstamo anterior logro comprar su terreno en donde actualmente cultiva y esto le ha dado a él mejores ingresos, por tal motivo está profundamente agradecido por su préstamo sin embargo él no está conforme con este avance es la razón por la cual solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de una cuerda de terreno donde también espera cultivar y seguir incrementado su cultivo.
Alberto espera seguir contando con su apoyo para hacer posible  sus sueños, que es mejorar sus condiciones de vida para darles a sus hijos una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Alberto is 49 years old, he is married with a beautiful family and lives in a community within Caserio Pasac. 

Alberto goes to a lot of effort every day so that his family have everything they need, with the previous loan he managed to buy land where he currently grows and this has allowed him to earn more income. For this he is profoundly grateful for the loan however he is not satisfied with this advance which is the reason why he is asking for a new loan to buy more land where he also hopes to increase his harvest.

Alberto hopes to continue receiving support to make his dreams come true, of improving their quality of life and to give his children a better education.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Chrep's Group

texts.en:
Chrep’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Thom province in Cambodia. Chrep makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Kheng's Group

texts.en:
Kheng’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia.

Kheng makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Maa Tara Tarini Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Kuni, 27, is a very energetic, entertaining, and smiling woman, who can make smile. She is the one standing to the left in the photograph. She is from Koraput district of Odisha.

Kuni works for a daily wage in the agricultural farms. In order to maximize her efforts, she is running a small scale animal husbandry business too. The family of four earns a monthly household income of 8,000 INR. Half of the income is used for expenses, and they end up saving 4,000 INR per month.

Kuni has bigger dreams. She wants to get rid of financial dependency and become secure. This will require a lot of savings and a lot of hard work. Kuni doesn't think twice to invest her best efforts. She wants to expand her animal husbandry business and increase her income.

Therefore, Kuni and her group member are seeking a loan of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy a buffalo, with which she expects to increase her monthly income by 2,000 INR.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo.

loans.name: Maa Shakti Shg-E Group

texts.en:
Uma, 39, is the lady standing to the right in the photograph. She hails from a remote village of Koraput district, Odisha, India. She is divorced and has two children.

She started her tailoring business at the age of 28 when she got separated from her husband. She is now in her 11th year of business. Her enterprise caters to part of the 800 population at a small village in Koraput district, Odisha.

The present loan request of 30,000 INR is to enable her to stock material and embroidery pieces since the main market is not very accessible. She will use this loan to purchase cloth and thread in bulk to make dresses. This will enable her to sustain her family of two children in their own 1,000 sq. ft. home. An expansion in the business will enable her to better provide for her children.

Uma is eagerly awaiting for your kind help.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and thread in bulk to make dresses.

loans.name: Shawqi

texts.en:
Shawqi is a 27-year-old single man from Dier Al-balah City, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house.

Shawqi is working in the field of interior decoration of homes. He also has a workshop for repair of car wheels. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but Gaza Strip is a difficult place to live due to the the Israeli economic blockade, in place since 2007.

Shawqi took a loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy new tools for his workshop. He hopes that this new tools will enable him to increase his customers and eventually save enough income to get married.

loans.use: buy new tools for his auto repair workshop.

loans.name: Adam Group

texts.en:
Amina is the featured borrower for Adam Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Amina is a 54-year-old widowed mother of three children. Twenty-one years ago, she started her grocery shop in an attempt to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. After her husband passed away, Amina is the breadwinner for her children and she is always trying desperately to develop her business.

Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new items and products. Amina is the first lady on the left of the photo. With respect to the other group members, Maha is the lady standing in the middle, and Nada is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with new items and products.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as honest.

She operates a retail business where she sells flour, sugar, bread and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items.

loans.name: Haggai

texts.en:
Haggai is a male Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be patient.

Haggai operates a farm where he grows maize, beans, bananas and other crops. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be crop diseases.

He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs (fertilizers, etc.). His business goal is to be able to do large scale farming within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a single woman, 46 years old, with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marilou has a buy and sell ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines.

Marilou requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks like slippers, pants, bags, shoes, etc.

Marilou has been in this business for eight years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like slippers, pants, bags, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Joelmi

texts.es:
Joelmi es un joven estudiante de Licenciatura en Administracion Turistica Hotelera, él solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia: 
Mi nombre es Joelmi, tengo 18 años de edad, nací en Santo Domingo, allí dure viviendo hasta los 16 años de edad. Tengo dos hermanos de los cuales yo soy el mayor. No estoy casado, ni tengo hijos. Mi madre es conserje de una iglesia y Mi padre es vendedor de pastelitos.
Quiero estudiar en la Universidad Apec, la carrera de administración hotelera y turística, porque desde pequeño me ha gustado cocinar, hacer montajes siempre he tenido un estilo diferente para las actividades de la escuela que me han llevado a dar con la carrera. También me gusta mucho la administración siempre he tenido esas cualidades de un administrador de empresas. Aún  no he podido ingresar a la universidad por carencias económicas  pero si he sido admitido a la misma.
Necesito el préstamo por qué atreves de él es que cubriré los gastos necesarios que conlleva la carrera y la universidad. De no recibir el préstamo no podría estudiar por el momento y tendría que ponerme a trabajar hasta poder ahorrar  el monto necesario para cubrir la universidad. Afectaría en que si tengo que dejar de estudiar para trabajar esto podría traer un atraso tanto en mis estudios como en mis deseos de ser una persona profesional, en lo que fueron mis estudios tantos básicos como de nivel medio he sido sobresaliente en mis estudios y he sido premiado con diferentes reconocimientos,  por ejemplo fui premiado por el ministerio de Educación de la Republica Dominicana como uno de los  estudiantes con mayor índice académico.
Dentro de mis metas académicas están la de ser unos de los estudiantes de la universidad con mayor índice universitario, poderme destacar como estudiante en el área y poder terminar mis estudios con las mejores competencia de la carrera a cursar. Dentro de las familiares esta dar todo mi apoyo necesario para contribuir con cualquier necesidad a mi alcance. Mi meta personales es crecer como persona dentro de los talentos a desarrollar en mi carrera y seguir destacándome como una persona aplicada como la cual me considero. 
Luego de terminar quiere trabajar en mi área y luego quiero realizar otra carrera. Me gustaría que al terminar mi carrera trabaje en una de las áreas que conlleva la misma y si me pusieran a mí a elegir mi tipo de trabajo seria de administrador del departamento de alimentos y bebidas de un gran hotel, y allí poder resaltar mis cualidades y destrezas.
texts.en:
Joelmi is a young student of a Hotel and Tourism Management. He is asking for a loan to be able to cover his education expenses. This is his story:

My name is Joelmi. I am 18 years old. I was born in Santo Domingo, I lived there until I Was 16 years old. I have two siblings and I am the oldest. I am not married and I have no children. My mother is the caretaker of a church and my father sells pastries.

I want to study Hotel and Tourism Management at the Universidad Apec, because since I was very young, I have liked to cook and put things together. I have always had a different style for school activities that have led to me choosing this major. I also really like administration. I have always had the qualities of a business manager. I still haven't been able to go to college due to a lack of finances but I have been accepted there.

I need the loan because through it, I will cover the necessary expenses for the major and for college. Without the loan, I couldn't go to school at this time and I would have to start working until I can save up the necessary amount to cover college. It would have an affect because if I have to stop going to school to work, this could delay my education and my desire to be a college graduate. My elementary and high school education were excellent and I was always awarded with different acknowledgements. For example, the Ministry of Education of the Dominican Republic rewarded me for being one of the students with the highest academic average.

Among my academic goals are being one if the students at the university with the highest average, being able to stand out as a student in the area and being able to finish my education with the highest competence of the major I will study. Among my family goals are to give all of the support necessary to contribute with any necessity within my reach. My personal goal is to grow as a person with the talents to be developed in my major and to continue standing out as a dedicated person, which I consider myself to be.

After finishing, I want to work in my field and then I want to study another major. I would like to work in one of the areas related to my major and if were allowed to pick what type of work, it would be as a manager of the food and beverage department of a big hotel, and there my qualities and skills would stand out.

loans.use: to cover higher education expenses.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is 54 years old and single.

Lily is in an agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Lily has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Pheap’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Pheap makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a married woman. She describes herself as patient. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be power outages. She will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy beauty products for salon use. Her business goal is to open more beauty salons within 5 years. She will use the anticipated profits to open another beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Maa Tara Tarini Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Chita, 51, hails from a village of Koraput district, Odisha, India. She is standing to the right in the photograph. She didn't continue her education due to the lack of economic resources. She got married and with her husband had four children, all of whom are adults and work for their own households. Later, her husband died due to an illness, and Chita was left a widow and lives with three grandchildren.

Chita has had a small snack stand for 15 years. She established this business in order to give her children everything necessary. Chita, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. She will use the loan to purchase juices, soft drinks, cookies, candies, sweets, ham, bleach, laundry soap, etc. In this way, she will manage to offer more product variety to her customers.

Chita's dream is to have a larger store and to be able to offer more products.

loans.use: to purchase juices, soft drinks, cookies, candies, sweets, ham, bleach, laundry soap, etc.

loans.name: Francis Onan

texts.es:
Onan es un pequeño productor de café certificado de alta calidad, Onan produce café certificado como Comercio Justo y Rainforest su producción de café es la única fuente de ingresos de su familia que está formada por él, su esposa Digna y 3 hijos, Onan tiene como principal meta hacer que su familia tenga un patrimonio estable para trabajar y vivir sin que le haga falta lo básico para tener una vida de calidad.
Onan ha visto una nueva oportunidad para hacer su finca más productiva y auto sostenible la oportunidad consiste en la producción de café 100% orgánico que sumado a los sellos de comercio justo le daría un valor de mercado muy importante a su café, unos de las principales ventajas del café orgánico es que ayuda a eliminar los de contaminantes que se suelen aplicar en los cafetales y por lo tanto a cuidar las fuentes de agua y tierras.
En este momento Onan solicita un crédito para iniciar las actividades de conversión a orgánico, con las ganancias obtenidas por el café orgánico vendido Onan espera poder hacer crecer su patrimonio.
Un préstamo ayudara a Onan a tener mejores oportunidades de mercado, a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y uno los temas más importantes es que su finca no usara sustancias que pongan en peligro la vida de los trabajadores o de sus familias.
texts.en:
Onan is a small coffee producer, certified of high quality. Onan produces coffee certified as Fair Trade and Rainforest. His coffee production is the only source of income for his family which is made of him, his wife Digna, and 3 children. Onan has as his primary goal to make it so his family has a stable legacy to work and live without lacking anything basic; to have a quality life.

Onan has seen a new opportunity to make his farm more productive and self-sustaining. This opportunity consists of 100% organic coffee production which, in addition to the certification of fair trade, will give his coffee a very significant value in the market. Some of the primary advantages of organic coffee is that it helps to eliminate the contaminants that are typically used in the coffee plantations and, so, to care for the water sources and land.

At this time, Onan is asking for a loan to begin the work of converting to organic. With the income gotten through selling organic coffee, Onan hopes to be able to grow his legacy.

A loan will help Onan to have better opportunities in the market, to improve his family's quality of life and one of the most important themes is that his farm will not use substances that put the lives of his workers or their families in danger.

loans.use: to purchase organic manure, organically-sourced coffee plants, and other materials necessary for converting his coffee production to organic.

loans.name: Rosenie

texts.en:
Rosenie is 54 years old and married with six children.

Rosenie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, soap and other personal care products.

Rosenie has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Rosenie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, soap and other personal care products.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a single woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Narcisa is 49 years old and has one child still in school.

Narcisa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy more assorted fish to sell to her customers. Narcisa has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more assorted fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more ropes and seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Joeylito

texts.en: Joeylito’s earliest business was making and selling of jewelry made from Swarovski. He only stopped it when he began running a restaurant business. He is now five years running the business and still wishing that someday he will simultaneously manage his restaurant business and make jewelry. At present, Joeylito is focusing on his restaurant business. He sells different dishes for lunch. Joeylito is requesting a loan of P40,000 to buy raw meat and ingredients in cooking foods to sell. He hopes to earn bigger income and will use it as revolving capital to expand the business and make his wish a reality.

loans.use: to buy raw meat, and ingredients in cooking foods to sell.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Maria es una joven mujer de treinta y siete años de edad, muy emprendedora y carismática, quien descubrió su verdadera vocación como comerciante. Su esposo, madre y hermanas confían en ella y la impulsan para que haga sus sueños realidad. Poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante. 
Esta vez ha recurrido a la ayuda de Kiva junto MiCrédito para que se le otorgue un préstamo que le permita surtir su tienda y comprar ropa, calzado y joyería de acero inoxidable. En un futuro desea mejorar la infraestructura de su tienda, además planea incursionar en la venta de productos de belleza y maquillaje.
texts.en:
Maria is a young woman, thirty-six years old, very enterprising and charismatic, who found her true vocation as a saleswoman. Her husband, mother and sisters trust her and push her so to make her dreams came true. Little by little she has managed to get ahead.

This time, she has come for the help of Kiva with MiCrédito so that they grant her a loan that allows her to stock her store and purchase clothing, shoes, and stainless steel jewelry. In the future, she wants to improve the store's infrastructure. In addition, she plans to enter into selling beauty and makeup products.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, and stainless steel jewelry.

loans.name: Junior Antonio

texts.es:
Junior Antonio es un joven estudiante de medicina, él solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Junior, tengo 25 años de edad, soy soltero sin hijos, vivo en la zona este de Santo Domingo. Tengo 3 hermanos y 3 hermanas. Mi madre es trabajadora doméstica y mi padre es negociante de Artículos. Estudio Medicina en la Universidad Autónoma de Santo Domingo (UASD). Estoy estudiando esta carrera porque me gusta tratar con personas, ayudar a otros en resolver las necesidades de salud me llena de satisfacción. Estoy a finales de mi carrera, solo me quedan 6 materias, el pre-internado y el internado, lo cual me llevara en terminar un tiempo de 2 años. Mis materias favoritas han sido las anatomías, las fisiologías, bioquímica, microbiología, infectología, cardiología, inmunología y las anatomías patologías.  
Este préstamo lo necesito para poder terminar mis estudios, ya que mi padre y madre han hecho lo posible para ayudarme hasta ahora, pero en estos momentos se han visto imposibilitados, por motivos de salud y trabajos de poco salario, carecen de recursos económicos para poder ayudarme en mi carrera, por lo que me veo en la necesidad de acudir a ayudas económicas y aprovechar este servicio que ofrece Fundapec. Sin una ayuda como esta que ofrece KIVA y Fundapec, mis estudios estarían arruinados y mis planes y objetivos para un futuro se verían chasqueados. Por esta razón le pido que me den la oportunidad y poder superarme al máximo. Estoy seguro que con la aprobación de este préstamo mis ideales y desarrollo como persona serán logrados.
Mi meta es primeramente ser profesional, alcanzar altos cargos de mi especialidad y de mi oficio, después que termine mi carrera empezare un trabajo en la misma área de mi carrera como médico general y participar para una especialidad en cirugía. También cursare un diplomado y maestría.
texts.en:
Junior Antonio is a young medical student. He asks for a loan to be able to cover his educational expenses. This is his story: My name is Junior, I am 25 years old, single with no children, and I live in the zone east of Santo Domingo. I have 3 brothers and 3 sisters. My mother is a domestic worker and my father is a businessman. I am studying medicine at the Universidad Autónoma de Santo Domingo (UASD). I am studying this major because I like to deal with people, and helping others to solve their health needs fills me with satisfaction. I am at the end of my degree program, I only have 6 subjects left, the pre-residency and the residency, which will bring me to finish in a period of 2 years. My favorite subjects have been anatomy, physiology, biochemistry, microbiology, infectology, cardiology, immunology, and pathological anatomy.

I need this loan to be able to finish my education since my father and mother have made it possible to help me up to this point, but at this time they have become unable, for reasons of health and low-paying jobs. They lack the economic resources to be able to help me with my degree, so I see the need to access loans and am taking advantage of this service that Fudapec offers. Without a loan such as that offered by Kiva and Fundapec, my education will be ruined and my plans and goals for the future will be broken. For this reason, I ask you to give me the opportunity and to be able to improve myself to the maximum. I am sure that with the approval of this loan, my ideals and development as a person will be achieved.

My goal is primarily to be a professional, achieve high positions in my specialty and my profession. After I finish my degree, I will begin a work in the same area as my degree as a general doctor and participate in a specialty of surgery. I also will do a certification program and a masters degree.

loans.use: to cover higher education expenses.

loans.name: Chum's Group

texts.en: Chum’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chum makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sokleng's Group

texts.en: Sokleng’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokleng makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a farm laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from three to twelve years old. She describes herself as ambitious.

Judith operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are women.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a hair dryer. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa runs and operates a store selling motorcycle spare parts like aluminum sprockets, bulbs, lamps, brake switches and various lubricants. She is a 45-year-old married woman with four grown children. She has been operating a motorcycle spare parts store for 10 years now. She hails from the town of Carmen, Bohol.

Narcisa has requested a loan to buy supplies like chargers, brakes, chain, switches and many others. These are very essential in maintaining the flow of her daily income. With these, she could be able to handle her finances and to expand her business. She is doing her best to ensure that her business will be prosperous in the coming year and hoping that it will improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy supplies like chargers, brakes, chain, switches and many others to sell in her store.

loans.name: Suipah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Suipah. Suipah is 51 years old and married. She lives with her husband and her children. She has one son and one daughter.

Suipah is a merchant and has been selling traditional snack foods for 5 years. Her husband is a craftsmen, and he has made caps for 10 years. They pull together for increasing her family income.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 7,000,000 IDR. This loan will be used to buy and build a water source at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family. Suipah wants to have access to safe sanitation and water sources for families. Her family income is still not enough to build toilets and water sources with cash, but they are able to repay loans received.

Suipah and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build a water sources at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Enkhbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhbayar, 48, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as an interior designer for more than 20 years. His wife helps him by finding customers, ordering materials and filling out forms. Their eldest son works as an electrician at the power plant and his other two children study at university.

The house his family lives in has deteriorated over the years and needs urgent repairs. For this, he is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cements, shingles and fiberglass.

By doing so, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is 45 years old and is a widow. She earns a profit through her small restaurant business. Imelda’s profit mostly went for her two children's needs, particularly on their studies. With her determination to finish her children's studies, Imelda works hard to have enough income to support her children's needs. Imelda is proud to share that through her effort, her eldest child already finished her study. Now, her priority is to successfully finish her youngest child's education. Hence, she needs to grow the business and earn bigger profit. Imelda is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy raw meat and ingredients for her restaurant business. She hopes to serve more customers, have bigger sales and income as well to sustain her.

loans.use: to buy raw meat and ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Al Zaitoun Group

texts.en:
Wajiha is the featured borrower for Al Zaitoun Group. She joined together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and live at the same time.

Wajiha is a 36-year-old married mother of five. She started, fifteen years ago, preparing and selling "Mouneh" from her house to help her husband in covering their needs and expenses. She is a hard worker who has a good reputation in her region.

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy foodstuff to increase her production as she wants to buy fuel/oil for the upcoming cold winter season.

Wajiha is the first lady on the right of the photo.
With respect to the other group members, Iman is the lady standing in the middle, and Wafaa is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy foodstuff to increase her production and to buy fuel for the upcoming cold winter.

loans.name: Turimurunani Group

texts.fr:
Jeanine  fait partie du groupe  Turimurunani et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 29 ans et est divorcée. Elle a 4 enfants âgés de 3 à 10 ans, dont  3 étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge 2 enfants membres  de sa famille élargie qui étudient. 

Elle a fait le commerce du riz, du haricot, de la farine, …dans sa boutique  depuis  10 ans. 

Elle est à son troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz et  de haricot  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Jeanine is part of the Turimurunani group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 29 years old and divorced. She has four children aged between 3 and 10 years old, three of whom are studying. She also takes care of two children, members of her extended family, who are studying.
Jeanine has been trading in rice, beans, flour, ... in her shop for ten years. She is on her third Turame loan. With the Kiva loan that she will receive, she will increase her capital and purchase a large quantity of rice and beans to resell and earn more.

loans.use: to increase her capital and purchase a large quantity of rice and peans to resell and earn more.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is married with six children, and works as a teacher. She works very hard for her children and all the members of her family.

Celestina took a loan of $ 1000. She is taking this loan to buy cement, sand, stone and wood to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, stone and wood.

loans.name: José Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo es un pequeño productor de café certificado con Comercio Justo y Rainforest, la producción de café es el único sustento de la familia conformada por él, por Deysi Marina su esposa y 3 hijos, a sus  56 años de edad Rodolfo lleva las riendas de sus cafetales cosa que no es algo difícil con sus más de 36 años de experiencia produciendo café.
A Rodolfo le gusta poner en práctica nuevas técnicas de producción con el objetivo de aumentar la calidad y cantidad de del café cosechado, el principal objetivo de Rodolfo es hacer de sus cafetales un lugar sano donde las personas puedan trabajar sin poner en riesgo su salud y siendo gratados de manera justa y equitativa. 
La producción de café orgánico es una de las oportunidades que Rodolfo ve para tener más oportunidades de mercado para su cosecha además de permitirle hacer sus parcelas amigables con el ambiente y más auto sostenibles.
Rodolfo solicita un crédito para iniciar las labores de conversión a orgánico sin dejar de lado sus prácticas de comercio justo y rainforest, Rodolfo ah decidido iniciar el proceso de conversión a producción orgánico con cafetales totalmente nuevo ya que las plantaciones que tiene actualmente están muy deterioradas así que las replantara e iniciara la conversión con plantaciones totalmente nuevas. 
Un crédito le ayudara a Rodolfo a comprar abonos orgánicos, plantas de café de origen orgánico, pago de mano de obra y otros materiales de origen orgánico necesarios para el proceso de conversión, con las ganancias obtenidas Rodolfo espera tener acceso a un medicinas y lo básico para tener una vida digna y que sus empleados tengan la oportunidad para trabajar en un ambiente más saludable donde no hayan agentes altamente tóxicos y que tengan un trato justo.
texts.en: Rodolfo is a small producer of certified coffee with Fair Trade and Rainforest. Coffee production is the only means of subsistence for his family, comprised by him, his wife Deysi Marina and their 3 children. At 56, Rodolfo is the leader of his coffee crops, which is not so difficult thanks to his more than 36 years of experience producing coffee. Rodolfo likes implementing new production techniques in order to increase the quality and quantity of the harvested coffee. Rodolfo's main objective is that his coffee plantations are a healthy place, where people can work without risking their health, and to be paid justly and equitably. Organic coffee production is one of the opportunities that Rodolfo sees to have more market opportunities for his harvest, besides allowing him to make his plots environmentally friendly and more self-sustaining. Rodolfo is requesting a loan to start the work of conversion to organic, without neglecting his Fair Trade and Rainforest commerce practices. Roberto has decided to start the process of conversion to organic production with totally new coffee crops, since the plantations he currently has are very damaged, so he will replant and start this conversion with totally new plants. A loan will help Rodolfo to buy organic fertilizers, coffee plants of organic origin, to pay for hand labor and other organic origin materials needed for the conversion process. With the earned income, Rodolfo hopes to have access to medicine and what is basic for a decent life, and that his employees have the opportunity to work in a more healthy environment without highly toxic agents, and that they have a just treatment.

loans.use: to buy materials to convert his coffee crops to organic, such as: organic fertilizers, coffee plants, and to pay for hand labor.

loans.name: Nyemamba Group

texts.fr:
Fulgence  fait partie du groupe Nyemamba et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 49 ans et est marié à Adelaïde, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 4 à 14 ans, dont  4 étudient.
Il fait le commerce de pièces de rechange pour vélo depuis 20 ans. 

Il est à son troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’ll obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de pièces de rechange  pour  vélo à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  voir ses enfants.
texts.en:
Fulgence is part of the Nyemamba group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 49 years old and married to Adelaïde, a farmer. Together they have five children aged 4 to 14 years, four of whom are studying.
