Fulgence has been in the bicycle spare parts trade for 20 years. He is on his third Turame loan. With the Kiva loan he will receive, he will increase his capital and purchase many bicycle spare parts to resell and earn more. In the upcoming years, he would like to see his children.

loans.use: to increase his capital and purchase many bicycle spare parts to resell and earn more.

loans.name: Zamzam

texts.en: Zamzam, 44 years old married mother of 3 children. Twelve years ago, she started working as a hairdresser from her house to help out her husband in raising their family. Zamzam receives customers from her neighbors and the women in her area where she cuts and styles their hair. Currently, Zamzam needs to buy a car for transportation, thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua. This support will allow her to develop her work. On the long run, Zamzam hopes to start her own hair styling salon for women in the future.

loans.use: to buy a car for transportation

loans.name: Sophannarith

texts.en: Sophannarith is a 29-year-old married factory worker with two children in her care who resides in the Kampong Chhnang Province in Cambodia. Two of her children attend school. She has been working in the factory since 2011, earning approximately $6 per day. Her husband is a 34-year-old motorcycle taxi driver, earning approximately $5 per day. Currently, her husband’s motorcycle is old, therefore she needs a loan to buy a motorcycle for her husband to run as a Tuk Tuk taxi service. With this loan, she will able to have enough money to buy a motorcycle and can get more income to support the family. In the future, Sophannarith is going to save money to build a new toilet, and support her children in earning higher education.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her husband to run as a Tuk Tuk taxi service

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a widow, 62 years old, with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Edna is and has children who are in school.

Edna has a buy and sell used clothes business in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of used clothes to sell to her stall.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Edna has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman and has been blessed with six kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.
Mwanaisha has operated a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over three years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business.Mwanaisha dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future
With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Margie is 44 years old and has four children are presently in school.

Margie has a fishing business in the Philippines. Margie requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like bamboo, gasoline for her boat, fish net and maintenance for her business.

Margie has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like bamboo, gasoline for her boat, fish net and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Vern's Group

texts.en:
Vern’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Vern makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and construction worker to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es: Gloria de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal y ropa, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado que está cerca de su casa, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas productos como cosméticos, esmaltes, ganchos para el cabello, shampoo, ti-ntes para el cabello, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Gloria is 53 years old. She lives in her own house with her family group. She works selling personal care products and clothing. Her business is located in the market near her home. She has a lot of customers, thanks to the variety of products she offers and her good prices. With the earnings she obtains, she has been able to get ahead. She is requesting a loan once again to buy more products such as cosmetics, nail polish, hair clips, shampoo, hair dyes, etc. In this way she will improve her income.

loans.use: to buy more products such as cosmetics, nail polish, hair clips, shampoo, hair dyes, etc.

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es: Jose de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la venta de perfumes desde hace 35 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas mercaderia por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi tene mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Jose is 53 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife, and has worked selling perfumes for the past 35 years. His business is located at his house and he has many clients. With the earnings obtained from his sales he is able to cover some expenses at home. He is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise wholesale, and be able to continue with his sales and obtain greater earnings.

loans.use: To buy more perfumes wholesale.

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es:
Rubén es un hombre de cincuenta y un años de edad, padre de seis hijos y muy comprometido con su trabajo en el campo, él tiene un servicio de molino de granos, gracias a varios préstamos de MiCrédito en conjunto con Kiva, ha ido logrando que su negocio crezca y captado nuevos clientes, por lo tanto el confía mucho en los financiamientos y agradece que por estos ha salido adelante.
Él ha vuelto a recurrir a un préstamo, que planea invertir en la compra de repuestos para su maquinaria de molino, dado que es necesario que cada cierto tiempo de reemplacen algunas piezas para el buen funcionamiento. En un futuro desea seguir trabajando con financiamientos, tiene entre sus metas mejorar la infraestructura de su local.
texts.en: Ruben is a 51 year old man.  He is the father of 6 children and he is very committed to his work in the field. He owns a grain mill service, and thanks to loans from MiCredito in partnership with Kiva, he has been able to make his business grow and captured new clients. Thus, he has a lot of confidence in these loans and is grateful to them because that is how he has been able to get ahead. He is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of spare parts for his mill equipment, because it is necessary to change some parts from time to time so that it works well. In the future, he would like to continue working with these loans, as one of his goals is to improve the infrastructure of his building.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his mill equipment.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a married woman with two children. She describes herself to be honest.

Ann operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean values the importance of good grooming and a pleasing personality. That is why she has been operating her own beauty salon for almost five years now. She believes in beauty with a conscience and she created a parlor or salon that offers quality hair services and other cosmetic treatment and yet is affordable to all types of customers.

She mainly offers hair cutting, coloring, straightening/relaxing and more. She also offers manicures, pedicures and face make up. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, who are usually women. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Mary Jean has observed that some customers really demand a convenient and relaxing environment while having their make-over. So she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan to improve her shop and likewise her services to attract a lot more customers. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more hair treatment products like Brazilian blowout and other items for the beauty salon. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Mary Jean dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education. She also aims to increase her profit from her business to cover their daily household expenses. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase hair treatment products like Brazilian blowout and other items she needs in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Sern's Group

texts.en:
Sern’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sern makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en:
Khawla is a married woman, living with her children in a simple house in Nablus city. She is a strong and independent woman.

Six years ago Khawla decided to open her own business. She manages and operates a small canteen in an elementary school. She is the only source of income for her family. Khawla took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan enables her to pay the annual subscription for the canteen. She hopes to increase her income, and eventually improve her family's living conditions.

Khawla appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the annual subscription for her canteen.

loans.name: Sara Elsa

texts.es: Sara de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 23 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un credito para la compra de sopas, detergentes, golosinas, huevos, refrescos, arroz, azucar, etc. para poder surtir aun mas la tienda y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Sara is 65 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. She owns a store located in her place of residence. She has operated this store for 23 years, and with the proceeds from her sales she is able to cover some of her household expenses. She is requesting a loan once again to buy soups, detergents, snacks, eggs, beverages, rice, sugar, etc. so that she can stock her store with more goods and thus improve her income.

loans.use: to buy soups, detergents, snacks, eggs, beverages, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Octabio Cruz

texts.es: Octavio de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 20 años, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos que comercializa, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Octavio is 54 years old. He lives in his own house with his family. He own a store located in his house for the past 20 years. He has many clients,  since he sells a large assortment of products. With his earnings he is able to to cover some expenses at home.  He is asking for a loan to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, beverages, candy, sweet bread, etc. and thus obtain greater earnings for a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy soups, eggs, basic grains, beverages, candy, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Jose Bernardo

texts.es:
José Bernardo es un caficultor de 44 años, casado con Irma Yolanda, Él se dedica a la producción de café bajo distintos sellos de certificación como ser: Comercio Justo y Rainforest que comercializa por medio de COCAFCAL, José Bernardo lleva ya más de 20 años en la producción de café y 5 años trabajando con sellos de certificación.
José Bernardo tiene 2 hijos bajo su responsabilidad y él tiene como principal meta formar a sus hijos para que aprovechen las oportunidades que se les presenten.
Actualmente en la región se ha vuelto muy popular producir café certificado, los sellos ayudan a mejorar la calidad del café lo que hace posible obtener mejores precios por el producto cosechado además hace las fincas más sostenibles y amigables con el ambiente, es por eso que José Bernardo quiere convertir sus fincas a producción orgánica.
José Bernardo Solicita un crédito para llevar a cabo las labores de certificación Orgánica, Comercio justo  y replantación de su cafetal, con las ganancias obtenidas por su café el espera obtener ingresos suficientes para darles a sus hijos una educación de calidad. 
Un crédito ayudara a José Bernardo a iniciar a cultivar su cafetal bajo prácticas amigables con el ambiente y además le proporcionara ingresos extras para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Jose Bernardo is a 44 year old coffee producer. He is married to Irma Yolanda. He works producing coffee under different certification stamps such as Fair Trade and Rainforest, which he sells through COCAFCAL. Jose Bernardo has worked for more than 20 years producing coffee and for 5 years working with certification stamps. Jose Bernardo has 2 children under his care, and his main objective is to prepare them to take advantage of all opportunities they get. Currently in the region, it has become very popular to produce certified coffee. These stamps help much to improve the quality of coffee which makes it possible to get better prices for the harvested product. Also, the farms become more sustainable and environmentally friendly. This is why Jose Bernardo wants to convert his farms to organic production. Jose Bernardo is requesting a loan to implement Organic Certification, Fair Trade, and to replant his coffee plots. With the earnings he obtains from his coffee, he hopes to get enough income to give his children a quality education. A loan will help Jose Bernardo to start cultivating his coffee plots under environmental friendly practices and will also give him extra income to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials such as: coffee plants and organic fertilizers in order to convert his coffee production to 100% organic.

loans.name: Maria Transito

texts.es: Maria de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace mas de 30 años su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal y posee muchos clientes con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con su familia, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Maria, age 59, lives in her own house with her family. She has been selling clothes for over 30 years. Her business is located at the municipal market. She has a lot of customers from whom she gets a lot of sales and manages to get her family ahead.

She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes wholesale. This way she will have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy more clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es: Israel de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el posee una taller de estructuras metalicas desde hace mas de 35 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza su trabajo y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de su tabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de hierro, metal, herramienta etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Israel, age 62, lives in his own house with his wife and their two children. He has had a metal workshop for 35 years. His business is located at his house. He has a lot of customers because of the quality of his work and the good prices. With what he gets from his work he manages to pay for some of the household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy iron, metal, and tools, etc. This way he will be able to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy iron, metal, and tools, etc.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows and also grows tea. He has been involved in this business for six years.

Peter's business is located in a strategic place. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

He will use the KES 35,000 loan to buy farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Consuelo María

texts.es: Consuelo es una confeccionista residente en un barrio del municipio de Soledad ubicado en el Departamento del Atlántico y en esta misma localidad se consolidan sus principales clientes a quienes ha logrado cautivar con su talento. Desde muy joven sintió una gran inclinación por esta profesión y aprendió empíricamente a elaborar sus primeras creaciones, sin embargo consideró que para ejercer debía capacitarse y lograr elaborar prendas con acabados de calidad, entonces tomó clases de costura en una academia y en cuanto estuvo completamente instruida en todas las técnicas existentes, aperturó su taller de confecciones en el que hoy en día cuenta con tres años de funcionamiento, ofreciendo todo tipo de prenda de vestir para damas y caballeros: camisas, pantalones, vestidos, uniformes de colegios, entre otros y realiza todas las operaciones de la confección, diseño, corte, preparación, ensamble y acabado de piezas. Consuelo desearía trabajar sin contratiempos y no depender de los anticipos que le den sus clientes, por lo que está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en insumos para su taller entre ellos telas, hilos, apliques, botones, cremalleras y demás.  Esta inversión permitirá acortar los tiempos de producción y poder tener márgenes más altos al escoger materiales con precios de oportunidad. Su meta a futuro es ampliar sus confecciones y comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Consuelo is a clothing maker who lives in a neighborhood of the municipality of Soledad, in the Department of Atlántico. Her main customers, whom she has been able to captivate with her talent, are concentrated in this same area.

Since she was very young, she felt a strong inclination toward this profession, and she learned in a hands-on way to make her first creations. However, she believed that in order to exercise this profession she needed to be trained and to be able to produce garments with high-quality details. Thus, she took tailoring classes at an academy, and when her instruction was complete in all of the current techniques, she opened her tailoring workshop. Her workshop has now been operating for three years, offering all types of clothing for ladies and gentlemen: shirts, pants, dresses and school uniforms, among others. She carries out all steps of the tailoring process: design, cutting, preparation, assembly and finishing of the final pieces.

Consuelo would like to work without delays and not depend on the deposits given to her by her customers. For this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will invest the funds in supplies for her workshop, such as fabric, thread, appliques, buttons, zippers and other items. This investment will allow her to shorten her production times and achieve higher margins, since she will be able to purchase materials on sale at better prices.

Her goals for the future are to expand her tailoring operation and buy a house.

loans.use: to invest in supplies for her workshop, such as fabric, thread, appliques, buttons, zippers, and other items.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa has been a fish vendor for 7 years now. She sells fresh fish to the market in her town. She is a married woman with five dependents. Her oldest child is 24 and the youngest is 13. Aside from fish vending she also raises hogs. She is 53 years old and a resident in the town of Bilar, Bohol.

She has decided to take a loan to buy stocks of fish, purchase piglets and feed. With the presence of these tools, it would improve her income and enable her to continue her day-to-day livelihood activity thus; she could pay her obligation and start to balance her finances. She dreams that she could send her children to school for brighter futures.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fish, purchase piglets and feed.

loans.name: Sum's Group

texts.en:
Sum’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sum makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.

In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, she lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a fish selling business for over 10 years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Maa Tara Tarini Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Hasamati, 50, is the one standing to the left-hand side in the photograph. She wishes to take her first loan of 30,000 INR along with her fellow group member to start a breakfast stall in Koraput district, Odisha, India. Hasamati plans to buy utensils and raw materials with the start-up capital.

As a homemaker and mother of two boys, she has experience in preparing the items that she now hopes to sell in her stall. She also hopes that this will enable her to contribute monetarily to the household's finances, which are presently solely dependent on her husband who earns about 48,000 INR annually as a laborer.

Hasamati, along with her fellow group member, has requested this loan of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion to buy utensils and raw materials to start a food stall. She hopes to do well in her business.

loans.use: to buy utensils and raw materials to start a food stall

loans.name: Rith's Group

texts.en: Rith’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Rith makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Maira Beatriz

texts.es: Maira de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas y la crianza de ganado lechero desde hace 5 años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logrs solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde desea realizar la siembra ya que es un terreno pedregoso y asi poder tener una buena cosecha.
texts.en: Maira is 30 years old. She lives in her own house with her life partner and her three children. For the past five years, she has worked growing vegetables and raising dairy cattle. She sells her products in the area surrounding the place where she lives. With the proceeds from her sales, she is able to cover some of her household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, etc. so she can improve the plot of land where she wants to plant her crops, since it has rocky soil. In this way she will be able to achieve a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, etc. to improve her plot of land.

loans.name: Maa Tara Tarini Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Hemalata, 51, is a widow who is standing to the left-hand side in the photograph. She is a fighting and an entrepreneurial woman. Since she was young, she supported her parents in agriculture, and it was for reasons of low income that she did not go to school.

She is now accompanied by her parents who make a living in wage labor and planting basic grains. She had two children: the oldest has to emigrate to another country for lack of work and her daughter is married.

Hemalata makes a living in the purchase and sale of clothing. The idea to dedicate herself to this business was to generate other income to cover their necessities. She has more than two years of experience working in this trade.

She, along with her fellow group member, has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR. Hemalata will use her portion of the loan amount to buy more clothing to sell and be able to purchase wholesale, and not travel as much to stock.

Her dream is to have more variety in her business and not have to walk as a street vendor to sell her clothing.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell and be able to purchase wholesale

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina has been operating her own rental housing business for 17 years already and she earns well from this. She is from General Trias, Cavite, is 54 years of age and is married to Edgardo. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for their youngest child who is still a college student. Justina and her husband have to work hard, with the determination of having more income than they currently have, so they could provide their family with a better future.

To improve her profit and to pay for the maintenance of the boarding house, Justina would like to ask for loan assistance. An amount of PHP 10,000 could help her in the renovation and beautification of their place so that her regular boarders will choose to stay there for a longer period of time. She will also use portion of the loan to add up to the capital needed for her transportation business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Justina hopes that they could attract more boarders. She also desires to start up other business for their additional income. Justina meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation and maintenance of their boarding house.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a married woman with three children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000, she wants to purchase stock of dry maize, beans and rice for resale.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of dry maize, beans and rice for resale.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob took a loan of $800. He was married and he had three children, one girl and the others boys.

He took out a loan to help him to buy a muddy (small boat) for fishing, and after obtaining the fish, he will sell them in the market.

loans.use: to buy a muddy (small boat).

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres Salida A Paculam Group

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 24 años de edad, es soltero con una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 2 hijos ellos estudian primaria en la escuela que se ubica en su comunidad.
Rosa (la segunda del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) para darle a su familia lo mejor desde hace tres años se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, esta labor lo realiza ella en los lugares circunvecinos de su comunidad, gracias a esta labor ha logrado satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.
Rosa gracias a su amabilidad, esmero y buen servicio a sus clientes, su negocio es muy productivo y se ha dado cuenta que es muy necesario realizar un préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio, pues con los productos que cuenta ya no es suficiente para satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes, con este crédito Rosa comprara cortes, fajas, güipiles, para darle a sus clientes un mejor servicio.
Su gran sueño es poder construir una casa para que sus hijos vivan mucho mejor y que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 24, is a single mother with a lovely family. She has two children who go to the community elementary school. Rosa (the second on the left in the photo), in order to give her family the best, has been selling typical clothes for three years. She conducts her business in the areas surrounding her community. Thanks to this work she has managed to meet the needs of her family.

Thanks to her friendliness, effort, and good service; her business is very productive. She has realized that she really needs to take a loan in order to invest in her business. She does not have enough products to meet the needs of her customers. Rosa will use this loan to buy traditional skirts, woven belts, and blouses in order to provide her customers with better service.

Her big dream is to be able to build a house so that her children live much better and for her business to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy and sell typical clothing.

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en:
Nan’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Nan makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be honest.

He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a strategic place.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs.

This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Sokhim's Group

texts.en:
Sokhim’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokhim makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and woman to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en: Purity is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as honest. For six years, she has operated a dairy farm. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. Purity will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Ephraim

texts.en:
Ephraim is a married man, and he has three children.

Ephraim operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows. He has been involved in this business for eight years, and his business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

Ephraim will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy another cow. His business goal is to have a large scale business within five years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another cow.

loans.name: Soknov's Group

texts.en: Soknov’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal Province in Cambodia. Soknov makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel to boil water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman; she has two children, both of whom attend school. Halima owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food .

Halima has operated a firewood selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans which will boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Vy's Group

texts.en:
Vy is an old man living in Kandal province. He is 57 years old and a father of seven children.

To support his family’s living, he grows rice as his main source of income. Vy has been involved in farming for 35 years, and he can save his daily income of about $6 (USD) per day. The challenge that he faces this year is drought resulting in a lower yield than last year.

This is Vy's second cycle with VisionFund; he repaid his past loan completely. His family’s living is getting better than before with his previous loan.

In a group of two members, Vy is the group leader. He will manage his loan portion to purchase more organic fertilizer and pesticides in order to improve his rice farm to gain more yields than last year. He hopes that this loan can make his family's living conditions better.

loans.use: to purchase more organic fertilizer in order to improve his rice farm and to gain more yields than last year.

loans.name: Milton

texts.es: Milton cuenta con 46 años de edad que se dedica desde hace 15 años a prestar sus servicios de albañil independiente, actividad que le permite sostener a su familia y gracias a su experiencia cuenta con muchos clientes que solicitan sus servicios. Milton vive en casa de su propiedad desde hace varios años, junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos una niña de 13 años y dos varones de 10 y 16 años de edad. Milton desea construir una pared en su vivienda, la cual le permitirá brindar una mayor seguridad a su familia, para lo cual solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir una pared que le permita proteger a su familia.
texts.en:
Milton is 46 years old.  For the past fifteen years he has offered his services as an independent construction worker.  This job allows him to support his family.  Thanks to his experience he has a lot of customers asking for his services.  

Milton owns the house where he has lived for a number of years, together with his wife and their three children—a 13-year-old girl and two boys, ages 10 and 16.  Milton wants to build a wall on his home, which will allow him to give his family greater security.  Because of this, he is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and rebar to build a wall that will allow him to protect his family.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and rebar in order to build a wall that will allow him to protect his family.

loans.name: Mario Silas

texts.es: Mario de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hija, el posee una panaderia ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de compra de harina, azúcar, jaleas de sabores, moldes, etc. Para poder seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mario is forty-one years old, he lives in his own home with his life partner and daughter. He owns a bakery which he has run out of his home for ten years; he has many customers, especially his neighbors, and with the income his sales generate he is able to cover some of his household expenses. He is requesting a loan to purchase flour, sugar, flavored jellies, molds etc. to be able to continue with his work, increase his earnings and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, flavored jellies, molds, etc.

loans.name: Hania

texts.en:
Hania is 43 years old, a widow from Khan younis City and a mother to one son.

Hania was living with her son in a small humble house, but during the latest conflict on Gaza, she lost her husband, then she become the the sole breadwinner.

Recently, Hania's health has been deteriorating. She took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN). This loan enables her to cover the cost of a surgical procedure. The loan will allow Hania to pay the cost of a surgical procedure and return her family to their normal life. 

Hania appears in the photo.

loans.use: to cover the cost of a surgical procedure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: A loan of $1,000 helps this borrower to purchase paint, varnish, oils, and other supplies

loans.name: Manuel Fernando

texts.es: Manuel es un joven con una gran capacidad para asumir retos y responsabilidades, por eso antes de cumplir su mayoría de edad, su madre vio en él un potencial para los negocios y decidió involucrarlo en su negocio familiar.  En la actualidad Manuel ofrece su aporte de capital y respaldo en la atención de los clientes, que es de vital importancia para el óptimo funcionamiento de la venta de comidas, la cual funciona desde la comodidad de su hogar, situado en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla.  Todos los días su madre tiene una variada carta de comidas entre ellas carnes asadas, sancochos, pasteles y hayacas que ofrece a los habitantes del sector que reservan con premeditación o simplemente llegan hasta el local.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para realizar unas adecuaciones al local  y así poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Su meta a futuro es continuar mejorando la imagen del negocio y poder ingresar a la universidad.
texts.en:
Manuel is a young man with a great ability to take on challenges and responsibilities.  Because of this, even before he was an adult, his mother saw in him great potential for business and decided to involve him in the family business.  

Currently, Manuel contributes financially and by waiting on customers, which is vitally important for things to run smoothly while selling meals.  He does this from the comfort of his home, located in a neighborhood in Barranquilla.  Every day his mother has a menu of meals, including grilled meat, soups, cakes, and filled savory pies.  She sells these to the people who live in the area, who place orders ahead of time, or who simply stop by the shop.  

He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to make some upgrades on the shop and, in this way, offer better customer service.  His goal in the future is to continue to improve the business’s image and to be able to enroll in the university.

loans.use: to make some upgrades to his shop

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 50 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

Erma has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en:
Yan’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Yan works as a farmer, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and construction worker to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: Con 46 años de edad Moisés muestra cada día su tenacidad en su trabajo, ya que desde hace 16 años presta sus servicios de moto taxista, actividad que le ha permitido llevar el sustento a su hogar, por lo que se siente muy feliz de contar con este apoyo. Moisés vive junto a sus 3 hijos mayores de edad y su esposa desde hace varios años en casa propia, él y su esposa se sienten muy orgullosos, ya que han logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos. Moisés poco a poco ha ido mejorando su vivienda, pero por el momento no ha logrado construir un corredor que le permita proteger su vivienda, ya que cuando llueve el agua ingresa a su vivienda por las aberturas de la puerta, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para construir un corredor frente a su vivienda protegiéndose de la lluvia.
texts.en:
Moisés is 46 years old, and demonstrates daily his tenacity at his job. For 16 years he has worked as a motorcycle taxi driver, a business that has allowed him to sustain his home. He feels very content to have been able to count on this support.

For several years, Moisés has lived with his three older children and wife in a home he owns. He and his wife are very proud that they have been able to move their children forward in life. Moisés has been improving his house little by little, but has not yet been able to construct a covered walkway to protect it, since when it rains, water enters his house through the openings of the door.

For this reason he seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood and nails to construct a covered walkway in front of his house to protect it from the rain.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood and nails to contrust a covered walkway in front of his house to protect it from the rain.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es: Albertina, tiene 46 años de edad, vive en union libre con su conyugue y reside en una aldea del municipio de El Negrito, Yoro con sus dos hijas. Anteriormente trabajó como recolectora de fruta en una finca. Hace 8 años decidió tener su negocio propio y desde entonces vende ropa en general para damas, caballeros y niños. Esta mercadería la vende en forma ambulante y por pedidos. Doña Albertina es una persona muy trabajadora. Ella solicitó un préstamo por 17,000 Lempiras para invertirlo en la compra de fardos de ropa usada surtido con blusas, vestidos, faldas, sabanas, camisas, pantalones etc. para mejorar sus ventas con el fin de fortalecer su economía ya que con esa fuente de ingreso se ayuda a cubrir gastos. Su meta es seguir trabajando con su negocio para seguir prosperando económicamente.
texts.en:
Albertina is 46 years old and is in a common law marriage. She lives in a village in the town of El Negrito, Yoro with her two daughters. She previously worked as a fruit picker on a farm. Eight years ago she decided to start her own business, and since then she sells clothes in general, for women, men and children. She sells her merchandise as a street vendor and through orders.

Albertina is a very hardworking person. She seeks a loan of 17,000 Lempiras to invest in the purchase of bales of used clothes containing blouses, dresses, skirts, sheets, shirts, pants, etc. to improve her sales in order to strengthen her financial situation. This source of income will help to cover her costs. Her goal is to continue working at her business in order to continue prospering economically.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes containing blouses, dresses, skirts, sheets, shirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Lissette Xiomara

texts.es: Lissette de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella posee una tienda y venta de ropa desde hace 10 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ropa y mercaderia para la tienda (sopas, granos basicos, refrescos, etc.) todo por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economico.
texts.en: Lissette is 32 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and her three children. She has operated a store and a clothing sales business for 10 years. Her business is located in her place of residence. With the proceeds from her sales, she is able to cover some of her household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothing and merchandise for the store (soups, basic staple products, beverages, etc.), all of it on a wholesale basis. In this way, she will be able to continue with her sales and thus have a better income.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and merchandise for her store (soups, basic staple products, beverages, etc.), all on a wholesale basis.

loans.name: Rodrigo Carlos

texts.es:
Rodrigo continúa estudiando comunicación audiovisual y trabajando en su negocio de venta de salteñas. Él crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de una cámara filmadora de video para continuar con sus estudios. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque trabajo constantemente. Actualmente reparte salteñas en la moto de su hermano y estudia en sexto semestre de 10 que dura su carrera, “continúo estudiando y mi negocio mejoró gracias a la moto que mi hermano me presta…” Comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que los horarios no se cruzan con los estudios, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una computadora portátil para continuar estudiando. Su sueño es terminar de estudiar y trabajar en su rubro, Él desea realizar la compra de una computadora portátil para finalizar su carrera. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza ambas actividades.
Es por esos motivos que Rodrigo solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora portátil para finalizar su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Rodrigo carries on his studies in audiovisual communication and his business as an empanadas salesman.
He used the last loan to buy a camcorder for his studies.
He was punctual in his repayments because he kept working throughout.
He sells empanadas, which he delivers with his brother's motorcycle.
He is also a student, currently finishing his sixth semester out of the ten that his chosen diploma needs.
He says that he continues his studies and that his business improved thanks to his brother lending him his motorcycle.
His business's main advantage is that the hours do not clash with his university schedule.
Its downside is that it does not generate enough revenue to enable Rodrigo to buy a laptop computer, which he needs for his studies.
Rodrigo's dream is to graduate and work in his chosen field.
He wants to buy a laptop, which he needs to complete his studies.
Rodrigo has been a student with his own business for two years and this is his second loan with the field partner.
He will use the loan to buy a laptop computer, which he needs to complete his studies.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop computer.

loans.name: Nehmat

texts.en: Neemat, 38 years old married mother of 3 children. She has owned a mini-market for seventeen years, that helps her generate some income to support her husband. Neemat loves her job and her mini-market, and is always looking for new approaches in developing her work. That is why she plans to diversify her merchandise in her shop by buying more products.  She is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua. She hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to diversify her merchandise in her shop by buying more products

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa earns a living by making and selling of "atsuete"(is an orange-red condiment and food coloring derived from the seeds of the achiote tree,is typically prepared by grinding the seeds to a powder or paste.)
She is 30 years old married woman with 7 -year old son.
She has been engaged in that kind of business for 5 years now.

She  is asking for a loan to purchase annatto  seeds, empty bottles and other ingredients.  With these, she could provide more orders and able to cater the orders of her respective customers. It will make her earnings improve and able to handle her finances. She could now continue feed her child with healthy diets and continue send him to school.

Marissa is determined that someday, her source of living will become productive and successful.

loans.use: to purchase annatto seeds, empty bottles and other ingredients

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda is 27 years old and married, and she has a young child. She manages a store for income. Her spouse is a tricycle driver.

Emelinda pays daily rent, which is why she wants to sell more merchandise. She wants to earn more profits too. She would like to ask for additional capital to invest in her business. She is now asking for 10,000 PHP to buy sugar, canned goods, bread, eggs and vegetables to sell. This will help improve the sales capacity of her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and vegetables to sell in her store

loans.name: Archielita

texts.en:
Archielita is grateful that she was able to access loans in the past and has paid them back on time. She was able to help her husband make a living and is able to meet her children's schooling requirements through her earnings from her food stall. 

She is requesting another loan of PHP 15,000 to buy ingredients to make "goto" (Filipino version of congee made with beef tripe and glutinous rice cooked in a ginger-flavored broth) to sell at her food stall. Although her sales suffered during the summer months, she is glad that her business is picking up during these rainy months when Filipinos crave a hot dish. She is thanking God and you for your continued support of her livelihood. 

Archielita dreams of expanding to nearby communities. She prays for her family's good health and love for one another. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies

. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: to buy additional sugar and other ingredients to make and sell snacks.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she grows cabbages and french beans and also keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

Margaret will use the 60,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to have a large-scale business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 47 years old and married with seven children, three of them are currently in school. Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, noodles, milk, drinks, soap, bread, eggs and other personal care products.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 5 years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, noodles, milk, drinks, soap, bread, eggs and other personal care products

loans.name: Cherryl

texts.en:
Cherryl is 59 years old and widowed with four children. Cherryl works very hard to provide for them.

Cherryl runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, noodles, milk, drinks, soap, bread, eggs and other personal care products.

Cherryl has been in this business for 6 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, noodles, milk, drinks, soap, bread, eggs and other personal care products

loans.name: Embang

texts.en:
Embang works hard to support her family. Embang is married and has a business selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Embang has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Embang would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Channul's Group

texts.en: Channul’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Channul makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Qahor

texts.ru:
Кахор мужчина 55 лет. Он женат и имеет 4 детей. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку. Сам Кахор живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Жена Кахора также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей. Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Кахор занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. От данного бизнеса он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Кахору в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота. 
Сейчас Кахор хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Кахор очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Qahor is a 55-year-old man. He is married and has four children. He approached Arvand when he found out about the possibility of receiving financial support. He and his family live in a rural area. He doesn't have a higher education since he was not able to do so due to financial difficulties in his family. His wife doesn't have an education either and is a homemaker who takes care of household chores and raising the children. Qahor runs his own business to earn a living. He fattens and sells cattle and receives a good income from this business. His wife also helps him with it by selling the milk they get from the cows.

Qahor wants to increase the number of livestock he has in order to expand his business. Therefore he has approached Arvand and wants to take out a loan to purchase cattle. He hopes very much for a successful result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Mary Gerald

texts.en:
Mary is a repeat client in Ugafode Microfinance Ltd, applying for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX. She is a married woman with children.

Mary is a businesswoman owning a bar selling soft drinks. In a bid to increase her working capital and expand the business, she has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX. She is faced with a challange of competition and lack of enough capital.

She is very grateful for the support Ugafode Microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her, since she is now able to fund her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soft drinks.

loans.name: Donabel

texts.en:
Donabel works hard to support her family. Donabel is married and has a buy-and-sell mud crabs business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional mud crabs to sell.

Donabel has been in this business for 15 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional mud crabs to sell

loans.name: Rawan Group

texts.en:
Rabab is the featured borrower for Rawan Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time. Rabab is a 38-year-old married mother of five. Fourteen years ago she started working as a hairdresser to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who has professional skills in this domain. She is well known among her region and has loyal customers.

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary beauty tools and cosmetics such as keratin, hair dye, etc. to satisfy her customers' requests. Rabab is the first lady on the left. With respect to the other group members, Madlen is the lady sitting in the middle, and Najiba is the first lady in the right of the photo.

loans.use: to buy necessary beauty tools and cosmetics such as keratin, hair dye, etc.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is a Kiva borrower who has one child. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, flour, sugar, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy sugar, bread, milk, flour and other items. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more sugar, bread, soap and other items for resale

loans.name: Emena

texts.en:
Emena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her fishing business. Emena has been in this business for 10 years. Emena earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Emena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net

loans.name: Kerana

texts.en:
Kerana is 56 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Kerana has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. Kerana requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dried fish to sell.

In the future, Kerana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Zainabo

texts.en:
Zainabo used the previous loan to buy cocoa to sell. With the proceeds, she was able to expand her cocoa business and pay school fees for her two children. She lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is grateful for the previous loan that was extended to her. Zainabo still wants to continue trading cocoa but wants to expand her business with a cocoa farm so that she can earn more profits instead of continuing to buy from other farmers. Price changes and long distances to access markets are still her major challenges. Her dream is to own one of the largest cocoa stores in town and become a major supplier to the factory. 
Zainabo is requesting a loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Sunusi

texts.en: Sunusi is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gabas Village. Sunusi joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Sunusi  suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay his children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Sunusi  has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and to earn an income of up to (USD) $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicide, and improved seed that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 16 bags of maize this year, Sunusi  can now ensure that his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married mother of three kids who attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 
Nyamvula has operated a poultry-selling business for over three years. She mentioned disease outbreaks causing losses as a challenge in the business. Nyamvula dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future
With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a married mother of seven children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, Zainabu has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the 15,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat for her business.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es: petronila de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de atoles desde hace 20 años y con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias es como ha podido salir adelante, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda repellando y pintando las paredes de su casa pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de arena, cemento, pinturas y pago de mano de obra y asi poder tener una vivienda mas digna.
texts.en: Petronila is 51 years old and lives in her own house with her family. She has worked selling atole (corn flour beverage) for 20 years and with what she obtains from her profits she has managed to get ahead. She wants to improve her house plastering and painting the walls. As she doesn't have enough capital she is requesting a loan to buy sand, cement, paint and pay for labor and doing this have a more worthy house.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, paint and pay for labor.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca hails from the town of Bilar, Bohol. She is a 55 year old married woman with four grown children.

Rebecca runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various commodities ranging from fruit, like bananas and mangoes, to edible oil, beverages, toiletries and soft drinks. Aside from running a store, she also engages in a food vending business. She prepares and sells snack foods.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to buy various stock items like fruit, beverages, soft drinks and assorted groceries. These will boost the content of her store and attract buyers to come in. Thus, it will generate more income and enable her to handle her finances.

In the future, Rebecca is hoping that she could maintain and manage both her sources of income very well to become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy various stock items like fruit, beverages, soft drinks and assorted groceries.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She has 3 children and describes herself as ambitious. Esther operates a retail business where she sells potatoes, tomatoes, kale and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high cost of products. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 54 years old, married and has eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs and canned goods.

Jessie has borrowed andre paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs and canned goods.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy works hard to support her family. Daisy is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, spices, fish, vegetables, etc. Daisy has been in this business for 14 years now. In the future, Daisy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, spices, fish, vegetables, etc

loans.name: Grupo Las Palmas Sector Cementerio Group

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 23 años de edad es soltera, con una linda familia de un hijo que aún está bajo su cuidado, esta linda familia vive en una comunidad del Caserío las palmas.
Juana (es la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía) es una de las mujeres que se sacrifica mucho por su familia y desde hace cuatro años se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica de su región, escogió esta actividad porque lo realiza desde la comodidad de su hogar y le permite cuidar mejor de su hijo.
Juana gracias a su creatividad y amabilidad  mucha gente la busca para obtener sus servicios y sus tejidos, con esta demanda ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de diferentes tipos de hilos para seguir elaborando ropa típica y poder así satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes.
Su gran sueño es conseguir el crédito para poder hacer que su negocio crezca y así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Juana is a 23-year-old single woman with a son who is still under her care.  This lovely family lives in a community called Caserío Las Palmas.  Juana (the first on the right-hand side of the photograph) is a woman who makes difficult sacrifices for her family, and for four years, she has made a living producing clothing typical of her region.  She chose this job because she performs it from the comfort of her home and it allows her to better care for her son.  Juana, thanks to her creativity and kindness, is sought after by many people who wish to obtain her services and her textiles.  With this demand, she is seeking a loan for the purchase of different types of thread to continue producing traditional clothing and thus better satisfy the needs of her customers.  Her ultimate dream is to secure the loan to be able to make her business grow and thus improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase different types of thread

loans.name: Grupo Yoxaja 2D Group

texts.es: Antonia (la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) es una madre de familia que se sacrifica mucho para que a sus hijos no les haga falta nada, ella tiene 44 años de edad, y es una mujer que le encanta el trabajo en el campo, pues es de donde provienen sus ingresos. Antonia cuenta que con el préstamo le fue muy bien, pues gracias a ello pudo darle el mantenimiento a su cultivo de banano y a Dios gracias logro venderlos en su mercado regional más sin embargo ella no está conforme con este avance por lo que ha considerado que es necesario realizar un nuevo préstamo pero en esta ocasión invertirlo en su cultivo de café, ella con crédito pagara la mano de obra y compra de fertilizantes. Antonia espera obtener este año la mejor cosecha de café para que sus ingresos incrementen y con ello brindarles educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Antonia, first on the left in the photo, has sacrificed a lot to give her children everything they need.  She tells us that she is 44-years old and likes her work because it provides the income she needs to get by.  She is grateful for a past loan because it supported her banana farming business.  She sold her banana crop at a local market and is applying for a new loan now that she will use to grow coffee.  Specifically, she will use the new funds to pay for the labor and fertilizer she needs for her coffee crop.  Antonia hopes that she will harvest her best-ever coffee crop this year so that she will have the income she needs to send her children to school.

loans.use: to pay for the labor and supplies she needs for her farming business.

loans.name: Vortha's Group

texts.en: Vortha is 33 years old and a resident of the Kandal province, Vortha is married and blessed with one child. She struggles to make a living farming rice and working as a laborer in a factory. Vortha has been involved in her current business for 13 years and saves about $3 USD per day from her daily income. Because of drought, her rice crop has not grown well this year. This is her first micro loan and she leads a group of two to get this loan from VisionFund. Vortha will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her rice farm to get more yield. She hopes that her rice farm can produce a high yield generating more income to upgrade the living conditions of her family members.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice farm to get more yields

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
Heng’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Heng makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a factory laborer to support his family.

In his village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Magona Group

texts.en:
Mariam is in her late 20s and is married with two children. One of them is still in school and the other one is still small. She has been selling charcoal for two years now. She works from 6 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. This will be Mariam's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to meet her customers' requirement. She dreams of expanding her charcoal business and to start selling at wholesale prices as well.

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group Magona which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to meet her customers' requirement.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a single woman. She describes herself to be patient.

jane operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a populated place. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fruits and vegetables.

She hopes that in the future, she will open another business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 39 year old salon proprietor at Mikindani, Mombasa, Kenya. She is a married mother of one child. She has been in this business for the last five years and is doing great.

This marks her first borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase washing detergents, beauty creams, soaps and nail polish.

She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children and expand her current business. She hopes to own a boutique besides her salon in future.

loans.use: to purchase washing detergents, beauty creams, soaps and nail polish.

loans.name: Tomas Humberto

texts.es: Tomas de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol desde hace 25 años, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como puede salir adelante con su trabajo, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, veneno, fertilizantes y mejorar el terreno para poder tener una buena cosecha.
texts.en: Tomas, who is 41 years old, lives in a house he owns with his wife. His occupation has been farming corn and beans for 25 years. He sells his products in the surroundings of the area where he lives. What he gets from his sales is the way he is able to get ahead with his work. He is asking for this loan to buy seeds, poison, fertilizer, and to improve the land to be able to have a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy seed, poison, fertilizers, and improve his land.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn and her husband is engages in retailing, livestock, and furniture making business. Jonalyn focuses on retailing business which is selling of meat, fish, vegetables, and snacks. To sell her goods throughout the day, Jonalyn needs to round her goods using her motorcycle with side cart. Jonalyn wish to succeed with the business they have for their two children who are now currently attending to school. Jonalyn wishes also for a loan of P25,000 to buy meat, fish, and vegetables to vend. With the business they have now, it is a big help for them to make her wish come true.

loans.use: to buy meat, fish, and vegetables to vend.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 40 years old and has nine children. Angelita is married and has seven children who are in school.

Angelita is in the agricultural business farming seaweed in the Philippines. Angelita requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more seaweed to plants and other supplies to use in her business.

Angelita has been in this business for 7 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Angelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more seaweeds to plant and other supplies to use in her business.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is 55 years old, married and has seven children. 

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Marlene requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers for her farm.

Marlene has been farming rice for 2 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marlene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Soken's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province, Soken is 35 years old and a mother of two schoolchildren. She grows cassava to support her living conditions and grows rice as an additional income. Nowadays, she can save from her daily income about 6 USD per day from her current businesses. The cassava’s price is getting lower while she get cassava yield and this is her main challenge in her business.

For Soken, this is her second cycle with VisionFund and she wisely repaid her past loan successfully. Her family’s living is getting better than before because of previous loan. In a group of three, she is the group leader. She will use her loan to buy fertilizer to input her farmland and to buy more seed to grow her cassava to get more yields. She hopes that this loan can help her family’s business and family’s income better than before, so she can support her children’s education as well.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer to input her farmland to increase productivity of her crop yield so to increase her income for supporting her children's studying.

loans.name: Harold Rafael

texts.es: Harold es un microempresario de 43 años que ha ofrecido bienestar y una mejor calidad de vida a su familia con los ingresos que adicionalmente su negocio de venta, mantenimiento y recarga de extintores le proporcional.
