Esta actividad la inició luego de haber tomado una capacitación con una entidad del estado que lo certificó en el manejo de estas herramientas básicas para proceder ante un incendio y con sus ahorros compro herramientas y materia prima necesaria para la prestación de sus servicios, los cuales promovió en empresas que visitaba en su principal actividad como guardia de seguridad. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en materia prima según el tipo de fuego y equipamiento necesario. Esta inversión permitirá incrementar la cobertura de clientes y estar más cerca de su meta de adquirir más herramientas para adecuar un local y continuar ofreciendo una buena educación a sus tres hijos menores de edad.
texts.en:
Harold, 43, owns a business selling and servicing fire extinguishers. He started the business after completing a government-sponsored course and becoming certified to maintain fire extinguishers. He used savings to buy the tools and supplies that he needed to set up the business and first sold his services to companies for which he had formerly worked as a security guard.

Harold is applying to Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo for a Kiva loan that he will use to buy the additional tools and supplies he needs to carry on his business. The investment will allow him to sell a broader range of products and services and, in turn, attract more customers. For the future, he wants to open a shop of his own and continue providing his three children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his fire extinguisher services business.

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
Ziad is a 35-year-old Palestinian refugee, living and working in a Palestinian camp. He is married with three children. Sixteen years ago, he established his own painting business, and started developing it properly to respond to his family's needs.

Although his business is limited to the camp's needs, Ziad has a very good reputation in his business specialized in painting houses and shops. He is a hard worker who is always trying desperately to develop his business. Today, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy special tools for a new workshop which will facilitate his work and allow him to provide his customers with better service.
Ziad is working hard to develop his business with new decorating themes and tools.

loans.use: to buy special tools for a new workshop which will facilitate his painting business.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melissa is 36 years old and has three children are presently in school.

Melissa has a buy and sell personal collection business in the Philippines. Melissa requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items of personal collection like perfume, body lotion, beauty soap and other personal care products.

Melissa has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items of personal collection like perfume, body lotion, beauty soap and other personal care products

loans.name: Adelaida Esther

texts.es: Adelaida es habitante de Soledad, un municipio del Atlántico muy cercano a Barranquilla que hace parte de su área metropolitana. Su gente es carismática y alegre, y como toda población tiene manifestaciones culturales que la distinguen de las demás. Debido a su desarrollo es reconocida como la segunda ciudad del departamento y en su gastronomía es recordada por las deliciosas Butifarras que aunque son originarias de Cataluña en España, en Soledad tiene su toque único e inigualable que por tradición la familia de Adelaida ha mantenido a través del tiempo y ha trasmitido de generación en generación. Esta fantástica cocinera ha entregado treinta años de su vida a este negocio, en el que día tras día elabora estos pasabocas con un sabor agradable que se acompaña con bollo y jugo de limón.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en carnes y aderezos al por mayor para realizar su producción y poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.  Su meta a futuro es fortalecer su capital de trabajo y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Adelaida lives in Soledad, a municipality on the Atlantic which is close to Barranquilla, and is part of that metropolitan area. Its people are charismatic and sociable, and like every population has cultural manifestations that distinguish it from the others. Due to its development it is recognized as the second greatest city for its food, and is noted for delicious Butifarras that, although originally from Catalonia in Spain, are made in Soledad with their own unique and incomparable touch. Adelaida's family has traditionally made Butifarras; a tradition they pass down from generation to generation. This fantastic cook has dedicated thirty years to this business, in which she makes these snacks every day. They have a great taste that goes well with bread and lemon juice.

Adelaida is currently applying for her first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to invest in wholesale meats and dressings to produce her snacks and meet the demand of her customers. Her future goal is to increase her working capital and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: invest in wholesale meats and dressings.

loans.name: Grupo San Miguelito 2 Group

texts.es: Manuel (es el primero del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) es una padre de familia que se sacrifica mucho para que a sus hijos no les haga falta nada, él tiene 46 años de edad, y es un hombre que le encanta el trabajo en el campo, pues es de donde provienen sus ingresos. Manuel  cuenta que con el préstamo le fue muy bien, pues gracias a ello pudo darle el mantenimiento a su cultivo de banano y a Dios gracias logro venderlos en su mercado regional, ahora ya no solo se dedica al cultivo de banano si también de café. Más sin embargo él no está conforme con este avance por lo que ha considerado que es necesario realizar un nuevo préstamo pero en esta ocasión invertirlo en su cultivo de café, él con crédito pagara la mano de obra y compra de fertilizantes. Manuel espera obtener este año la mejor cosecha de café para que sus ingresos incrementen y con ello brindarles educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Manuel (is the first on the left in the photograph)) is the father of a family who has sacrificed a lot so that his children don't lack anything. He is 46 years old and is a man who loves work in the fields as that is where his income comes from. Manuel says that the loan went very well and thanks to it he could provide maintenance for his banana crops which, Thank God, he managed to sell on the local market. Now he not only cultivates bananas but also coffee. However he is not content with this progress so he thinks it is necessary to take another loan but on this occasion invest it on his coffee crops. With the loan he will pay for labor and buy fertilizer. Manuel hopes to obtain a larger coffee harvest this year so that his revenues increase and with that provide education for his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de hortalizas,  desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para poder comprar insumos necesarios como: abonos, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus siembras y así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Manuel is 59 years old, and he lives with his wife in a house that he owns. For a few years, his occupation has been agriculture, especially green vegetables. He sells his products in the different markets that are located close to his house. He is asking for a loan again to be able to buy necessary inputs, such as: manure, fertilizer, pest control, etc., and improve his land, which is shown in the photograph. This way he can continue with his sowing and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, pest control, etc., and improve his land.

loans.name: Unidos Venceremos (Jipijapa) Group

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Unidos Venceremos está formado por 8 mujeres y 2 hombres que tiempo atrás decidieron juntarse y formar este grupo de crédito el cual les ha servido para salir adelante en sus negocios. Ellos se reúnen cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable. 
Una de las socias de este grupo es  la señora Pascuala, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos  de 14 , 13, 4 y 2 años  de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y otro en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Pascuala junto a su marido tienen un pequeño depósito de venta de colas, jugos, energizantes, aguas en bidón y en varias presentaciones,  mientras ella se ocupa de vender en su casa el sale en una moto que la tiene adaptada para cargar los productos los mismos que lleva a distribuir a domicilios o a tiendas, ellos se surten de una distribuidora al por mayor la cual les deja a buen precio para que ellos al revender sus productos obtengan buenas ganancias. De esta forma trabajan todos los días y pueden sacar adelante a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar colas, jugos, energizantes y agua. Lleva más de 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener un carro para salir a vender junto a su marido y lo mejor para su familia.
La foto pequeña es de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The credit group Unidos Venceremos consists of 8 women and 2 men who some time ago decided to unite and form this credit group which has served to help them be successful in their businesses. They meet every 15 days in Jipijapa, a region known for its coffee which has an incomparable flavor.

One of the members of this group is Pascuala. She is 35 years old, married, and has 4 children ages 14, 13, 4 and 2. The two oldest study in secondary school and another in primary school. Her husband is a businessman.

Pascuala and her husband have a small business selling soda pop, juices, energy drinks, and water dispenser bottles of water in various sizes. While she attends to the business selling from their home, her husband has a motorcycle that they have adapted to make deliveries to homes and stores. They get their stock from a wholesaler who gives them good prices so that they in turn have good profit. They work every day and can support their family.

The loan will be used to buy soda pop, juices, energy drinks, and water. She has been in the credit group for over 3 years and she likes the help it provides in order to be successful. Her dreams are to have a car so she can go out with her husband, and to provide the best for her family.

The small photo is of two members who couldn't be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy soda pop, juices, energy drinks, and water.

loans.name: Mery Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por tres mujeres (Lizayda Lesbia, Estela Dionicia,  y Carmelita) de la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que trabajan día a día con el empeño de lograr el crecimiento de sus pequeños negocios de venta de ropa usada; se organizaron como grupo solidario desde hace un año, para acceder préstamo en Pana Pana. El nombre de Mery, es porque así se llama la hija de la coordinadora del grupo solidario.  

LIZAYDA LESBIA: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una joven de 23 años sonriente, con cualidades de líder. Casada con 2 hijos menores de edad. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal como albañil. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar estableció una pequeña pulpería en un tramo que tiene en uno de los mercados de la Ciudad Bilwi. Solicita financiamiento para diversificar sus productos y vender ropa usada. Ella sueña con establecer una tienda de ropa nueva.
texts.en: The group consists of three Miskito women (Lizayda Lesbia, Estela Dionicia, y Carmelita) from the town of Bilwi, in the Puerto Cabezas municipal area. Theyare enterprising women who work in a determined fashion everyday to build up their small second-hand clothing businesses; they set up their solidarity group a year ago so they could apply to Pana Pana for a loan. The name Mery comes from the name of the daughter of the group's coordinator. LIZAYDA LESBIA is the group's coordinator. She is a friendly young woman of 23, who has leadership qualities. She is married with 2 young children and her husband works on an informal basis as a builder. As she wanted to have her own source of income and contribute to the household expenses, she set up a small grocery shop in a pitch she has in one of Bilwi's markets. She is applying for a loan to stock a wider range of goods and sell second-hand clothing. Her dream is to set up a shop selling new clothing.

loans.use: to stock a wider range of goods and sell second-hand clothing

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es: Genaro de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus cuatro hijos el se dedica a la siembra de frijol y maiz desde hace 40 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de veneno y abono para tener una buen cultivo.
texts.en: Genaro is 51 years old and lives in his own house with his life companion and his four children. He has grown corn and beans for 40 years. He sells his product in the different markets close to his house. From what he obtains from his sales he manages to pay some of the household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy poison and manure so he will have good crops.

loans.use: to buy poison and manure.

loans.name: Mujeres Responsables Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “MUJERES RESPONSABLES” conformada por 05 socias con deseos de progresar. Ella es angélica una de las socias de 30 años de edad conviviente con 2 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de pollos en un puesto de mercado desde hace más de 1 año y medio que tiene dicho negocio. Su mayor deseo es de poder ampliar su negocio. Solicito el crédito para la compra de pollos. El grupo “mujeres responsables” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite seguir mejorando. Angélica se encuentra de pie es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo color negro.
texts.en:
This is the new group, "Mujeres Responsables", which is composed of five members who want to progress. Angélica is one of the members. She lives with her partner and her two children. She sells chickens in a stall in the market. She has had this business for more than a year and a half, and her biggest desire is to expand it.

She requested the loan for the purchase of chickens. The "Mujeres Responsables" Group is grateful to the people of Kiva who made this loan possible, as it enables them to continue improving.

Angélica is standing, the first on the left, wearing a black polo.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Villa Manantiales Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VILLA MANANTIALES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Francisca ella es viuda y tiene 53 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de gallinas y cuyes, la socia las gallinas y cuyes los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia y asi podar agrandar su negocio de venta de animales, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las gallinas y cuyes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar gallinas y cuyes y alimentos para los animales.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are members of the community bank "VILLA MANANTIALES" (Fountain Town). This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco, in the Cusco Region.

One of the members is Mrs. Francisca. She is a widow, 53 years old, and has 5 children. She works in her business of raising chickens and guinea pigs; she raises and fattens the chickens and guinea pigs and then sells them in different markets. She already has several years of experience in this business and is doing very well. She is a very hardworking woman, who through this business, wants to support her family and to be able to enlarge her business selling animals. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell the chickens and guinea pigs. She is requesting a loan to buy chickens, guinea pigs, and feed for her animals.

The members whose photos are superimposed on the group photo had their photos taken after the group meeting because they requested leave for work reasons.

The other members make their living in the businesses of selling animals, selling clothes, and in the restaurant and grocery store businesses.

Mrs. Francisca is grateful to those who, through Asociación Arariwa and Kiva, are supporting her dream, and she agrees to comply with paying the amounts due by their deadline.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs, and food for her animals.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE URQUILLOS, el banco esta ubicado en el distrito de Huallabamba, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Virginia tiene 34 años de edad y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la venta de verduras, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende lo que son zanahorias, cebollas entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para  de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Virgen del Carmen de Urquillos communal bank.  The bank is located in the Huallabamba district, in the Urubamba province and the Cusco department.

Virginia is 34 years old and is single.  She makes a living selling vegetables and has had her business for a while, which is going well thanks to the commitment that she makes to it every day.  She sells carrots, onions and other vegetables.  She wants to be able to continue working to continue supporting her family this way.  She is requesting the loan to purchase vegetables.  She is grateful for the credit granted and is committed to paying the established installments.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
For the last 20 years, Francisca has operated a sari-sari (variety) store. She selss basic household commodities including beverages, pouch vinegar, edible oil, sugar, eggs, tooth paste, shampoo, bread, eggs, soft drinks, and even gasoline.

She is married with two grown children and is a resident in the town of Pilar, Bohol.

With the availability of the resources needed, she could improve her income, and also it would enable her to balance her finances. She has requested a loan to buy assorted groceries for the store and gasoline. This would cause more customers to shop and in that way, she could start to expand her current business.

She hopes that she could maintain and able to manage her sari-sari (variety) store to become successful in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries for the store and gasoline

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 29 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Valentina works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Valentina is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy materials needed like nail polish, etc. for her manicure and pedicure business.

Valentina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 28 years old and has four children. Gina is married and has four children who are in school.

Gina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Gina has been raising pigs for 12 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 22 years old and has one child in school. Irene is married woman.

Irene is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Irene requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Irene has been raising pigs for 6 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Irene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 43 years old and married with one child.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, beverages, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Josephine has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Josephine aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, beverages, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Con más de quince años de experiencia como soldador músico, reparación de bicicletas y servicio de música cristiana, ha vivido Roger, un emprendedor de 47 años de edad que a diario lucha con el día a día para sacar adelante a sus hijos y a su esposa. Este trabajador inició su jornada laboral en los 80´s donde tenía que trabajar en una satrería para poder sacar su primaria, para que luego aprendiera soladura y así poder ofrecer ese servicio también. Pero eso no es todo, lo último que decidió aprender fue la música, pues ahora es parte de un pequeño grupo musical que sale a tocar semanalmente a las diferentes iglesias de su vecindario.
Roger tiene fracturada las piernas, por lo que tiene que vivir acompañado con muletas, lo que lo hace más de admirar, puesto que eso no ha sido ningún obstáculo para poder lograr todas sus metas. Afortunadamente cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo mayor y de tres personas más que trabajan con él, por lo que se siente motivado en invertir en sus negocios. De manera que solicita un préstamo para  comprar plátanos para salir a vender con su hijo a otros pueblos en la camioneta. Esto lo permitirá tener una nueva inversión que le permitirá mejorar los ingresos del hogar.
texts.en:
Roger, 47, has worked at a wide range of jobs over the last fifteen years: He's repaired bicycles, performed in bands, anything to support his wife and children.  He started working in the 1980s, for a tailor first, then setting up his own tailoring business.  He learned welding next and had his own welding business for a while before going on to study music.  He is a member of a small Christian music group now and performs with his band at local churches.

Roger can only walk on crutches, but that hasn't stopped him from pursuing his goals.  He can rely on help from his oldest son and others who work with them.  Roger is applying for a loan that he will use to buy bananas that he and his son will sell in surrounding towns.  The investment will provide a new source of income for supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy bananas for resale.

loans.name: Olga Arely

texts.es:
Olga, es una mujer luchadora, estudio hasta segundo grado, pero eso no ha sido un obstáculo para poder salir adelante con su familia; actualmente vive junto a su esposo, que se dedica a la agricultura y a cuidar a sus hijos quienes se encuentran estudiando. 

Olga, tiene una tienda desde hace diez años, en la cual vende tamales, panes, frescos, etc. y en su tiempo libre le ayuda a su esposo en la agricultura.

Olga, solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar granos básicos y así poder tener más ingresos en su hogar.

Los sueños de Olga son, seguir con su negocio, ayudarle a sus hijos para que estudien y también desea poder obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Olga is a determined woman who only studied up to second grade. However, this has not been an obstacle to having a successful family life. She currently she lives with her husband, who earns a living in farming, and cares for their children who are studying.

Olga has had a shop for the last ten years and sells tamales, breads and soft drinks, among other things. Also, in her free time she helps her husband in his farming job.

Olga is applying for a loan in order to buy agricultural supplies to plant basic grains which will enable the household to have more income.

Olga's dreams are to maintain her business, help her children to be able to study and she also hopes for a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies in order to plant basic grains.

loans.name: Ivan De Jesus

texts.en:
Iván is a 48-year-old man who lives in the municipality of Barbosa, north of Medellín. He’s been working on his own with a raising pigs (pork livestock) business for more than five years. He was taught this work by his mother, who used to work in the same thing, and she that passed on to him because he loved helping her with the animals.

He wants to increase his clients and sales so the profits can increase too. He’s aware that if he wants to accomplish that, he has to invest in his business, and work really hard, and he’s determined to do so. He’s asking for a loan so he can fix the pigsty and to buy more pigs.

Iván has many dreams and needs, but right now he wants to repair his house because it has some damages. He believes that with this, he can give to his family a safe and comfortable place to live.

You can help this man with a loan and let him be closer to his goals.

loans.use: to fix the pigsty and to buy more pigs

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Doña Gloria, es una madre soltera, tiene 65 años de edad, tiene dos hijos mayores de edad y reside con ellos en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de San Pedro Sula, Cortes. Ella dedico muchos años de su vida a vender mercadería en general. Pero hace 5 años y medio su negocio cambio a ser una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como arroz, frijoles, sal, pan, churros, refrescos, pastas, jabón, condimentos, manteca, azúcar etc. Ha solicitado un segundo prestamo en la institución Por 22,000 Lempiras para invertirlo en compra de mas productos como granos básicos, verduras, refrescos, golosinas, azúcar, manteca, frijoles, maíz, café etc. para surtir el negocio y mantenerlo surtido e incrementar las ventas y ganancias. Su plan es seguir trabajando para mejorar el nivel de vida de ella y de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria is a single mother, she is 65 years old. She has two children who are adults, and she lives with them in a village that belongs to the municipality of San Pedro Sula, Cortes. 
She dedicated many years of her life to selling merchandise in general. But 5 years ago, her business changed to become a small grocery store where she sells staple goods for families, such as rice, beans, salt, bread, churros, sodas, pastas, soap, condiments, lard, sugar, etc. She has asked for a second loan from the institution for 22,000 lempiras to invest in the purchase of more products, such as basic grains, vegetables, sodas, candy, sugar, lard, beans, corn, coffee, etc. This way she can stock her business and keep it stocked and increase her sales and profits. Her plan is to keep working to improve her level of life and that of her children.

loans.use: to buy more products, such as basic grains, vegetables, sodas, candy, sugar, lard, beans, corn, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Sokern's Group

texts.en: Sokern’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokern makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
A 55-year-old farmer, Heng is married and resides in Kampong Cham province. She, together with her husband, has been growing rice for 37 years. To overcome the hardship in family and add more income, her children are working for a textile factory. Together, they earn about 51,700 KHR per day and are able to save about 35,000 KHR each day.

Leading a group of two members to get a loan from VisionFund, Heng will use her loan to buy a sustainable rice farming business by purchasing rice seeds and organic fertilizer to boost the growth. Additionally, the rest of loan portion left will be used to pay for the plowing fee. She hopes to get more outputs to upgrade the standard of living and to secure the family’s financial future.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and organic fertilizer to boost the growth of her crop, which will allow her to earn more income to secure the family’s financial future.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Ret's Group

texts.en: Ret’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Ret makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Guadalupe Group

texts.en:
San Juan la Laguna is a beautiful community on the shores of beautiful Lake Atitlan in the highlands of Guatemala. It draws tourists from throughout the world who come to admire and buy the unique art of the town and to view the colorful murals painted on the sides of buildings by talented local artists. The area is also known for the use of natural dyes for pretty textiles.

Seven women in search of a better and more prosperous future have joined together to form the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Guadalupe.” They have textile businesses making napkins, scarves, shawls and hammocks, a food business and a bakery.

Elena is a young, married member of the Trust Bank who is 28 years of age with two children who are in elementary school. Along with her husband, she has a bakery business and bakes bread daily that she sells from her home. Elena is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for the business including lard, sugar, flour and firewood. Her biggest dream is to open a bakery shop in the center of her town, attract more customers and increase her earnings. She is determined to reach this goal!

Elena and her friends in the Guadalupe Trust Bank look forward to their monthly meetings when they transact business on their loans. After this is completed, a Friendship Bridge Facilitator offers them educational trainings on a variety of relevant topics. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of education and small loans “Microcredit Plus."

Thank you KIVA investors for your generosity and kindness in funding loans for the ladies in the Guadalupe Trust Bank. Looking forward to providing a follow-up report on them in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for the business including lard, sugar, flour and firewood for her bakery.

loans.name: Gloria Alicia

texts.es:
Gloria mujer ecuatoriana nacida en la parroquia Pastocalle perteneciente a la provincia de Cotopaxi, tiene 33 años de edad, quien pudo culminar sus estudios primario gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres sin embargo por la difícil situación económica tuvo que trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar en los ingresos de su hogar. Gloria ha sido un apoyo incondicional en su familia en especial para su madre ya que desde muy corta edad ayudo en la crianza y cuidado de sus hermanos pequeños a más de ayudar económicamente.
Actualmente Gloria está casada y tiene 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja en una empresa en la ciudad por muchos años, y ella ha sido un gran apoyo para él en todo y es por eso que hoy Gloria desea  solicitar un crédito para la compra de semilla y mas cuyes ya que ella se dedica desde hace muchos años a la crianza de animales menores y a la agricultura.
Gloria agradece a KIVA por hacer posible mejorar su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria Ia an Ecuadorean woman who was born in Pastocalle Parish which belongs to the province of Cotopaxi. She is 33 years old, and she managed to complete her primary studies thanks to the efforts of her parents. However due to their difficult financial situation she had to work since she was quite young to help with the household income. Gloria was an unquestioning support for her family especially for her mother. Since she was young she helped raising and caring for her younger siblings besides helping economically.

Gloria is now married and has three children. Her husband has worked in a company in the city for many years. She has been a great support for him in everything. And that is why today she wants to request a loan to buy seeds and more guineas pigs as she has raised small animals and farmed for years.

Gloria is grateful to Kiva for making it possible to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy seeds and small animals, in this way supporting her husband and siblings to have a better lifestyle.

loans.name: Myrian Ximena

texts.es:
Myrian es una mujer ecuatoriana de 30 años de edad nació en la ciudad de Latacunga, en la parroquia Tanicuchí perteneciente a la republica del ecuador, está actualmente soltera no tiene  hijos , gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres logró terminar la escuela primaria y luego  la falta de recursos económicos la a llevó a trabajar desde muy chica para poder sustentar sus necesidades. A pesar de tener un trabajo fijo en una papelería que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo, ella no se negó a educarse. Ahora Myrian vive  en casa de sus padres  ubicado en la Provincia de Cotopaxi en la República del Ecuador es una zona rural donde su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales menores.
Myrian en vista de la falta de recursos económicos en su hogar decidió dedicarse a trabajar pero hoy en día solicita un crédito para emprender con su propio negocio que se trata de la crianza y venta de pollos , es muy trabajadora y emprendedora pero sobre todo es muy dedicada a su trabajo en el campo, esto ha servido  para ayudar en su hogar.
Myrian y su familia  agradecen a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Myrian is a 30 year old Ecuadorian woman. She was born in the city of Latacunga in the Tanicuchí parish, belonging to the Republic of Ecuador. Currently she is single and without children. Thanks to her parents' effort, she was able to finish primary school and later. The lack of economic resources led her to work from a very young age to support their needs, but in spite of having a permanent job in a stationery shop that demanded much of her time and effort, she didn't deny herself her education. Now Myrian lives in her parents' house located in the Cotopaxi province in the Republic of Ecuador. It is a rural area where people work raising small animals.

Myrian, seeing the lack of economic resources in her home, decided to dedicate herself to working. Today she is seeking a loan to start her own business of raising and selling chickens. She is very hardworking and enterprising, but above all she is very dedicated to her work in the countryside. This has served to help her in her home.

Myrian and her family express their thanks to the Alternative Foundation in Ecuador and Kiva for making possible the growth in her working and personal life.

loans.use: to start her chicken raising business, in this way enabling growth in her working and personal life.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be ambitious.

She operates a retail business where she sells potatoes, tomatoes, kale, and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high cost of products.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 19 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 2 años, vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias su esposo le ayuda en las ventas y con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, al joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor y asi continuar con sus vents que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
This young lady's face has been blurred because she is nineteen years old and lives in a high-risk area. She has been working selling fruits and vegetables for the past two years. She works as a street vendor covering different neighborhoods. Her husband helps her with sales and the profit she makes allows her to cover some of her household expenses.

She lives in her own home with her husband and child. She is requesting this loan to buy more wholesale fruits and vegetables so that she can keep up sales and continue earning good profits.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina es una mujer de 35 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia la cual vive en una comunidad de San Antonio Suchitepéquez.
Marina con el afán de obtener sus ingresos ha sacado su creatividad para  obtener de cualquier tipo de trabajo algunas ganancias para utilizarlo al sustento de su familia. Marina cuenta que gracias a su crédito pudo comprar sus pollos de crianza y a  Dios gracias logro venderlos a un buen precio en su mercado regional, ahora ya cuenta con un negocio de venta de maíz. Con este avance ella no está conforme es la razón que lo motiva para solicitar un nuevo préstamo que en esta ocasión  lo invertirá en la compra de láminas para la remodelación del techo de su casa que ya se encuentra en muy mal estado y que le da a su casa muy mal aspecto.
Marian espera contar nuevamente con este préstamo pues considera  que es de mucha ayuda para ella. Su más gran anhelo  es tener una granja de pollos para incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Marina is a 35 year old woman. She is married with a beautiful family and lives in a community of San Antonio Suchitepéquez.

With the desire to make her income Marina has used her creativity to obtain any type of work to generate income to use for the sustenance of her family. Marina states that thanks to the loan she was able to buy chickens to raise and Thank God managed to sell them at a good price in the regional market. Now she says she has a business selling corn.

She is not content with this progress and this is the reason that motivates her to request a new loan. This time she will invest it buying laminate sheeting to remodel the roof of her house as it is in very poor condition and makes the house look bad. Marian hopes to count once again on this loan as she thinks it will help her a lot. Her great longing is to have a chicken farm to increase her revenues.

loans.use: to buy laminated sheeting to remodel the roof of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her fruit stand

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a 54-year-old woman who makes a living by running her grocery store.

She has been compromised with her business for a long time, and now she would like to make some improvements and fill her stock in order to meet with her clients' demands, so she is asking for a $6,000 (6,000 pesos) loan to reach her goals. If she is able to get this loan, she will make improvements in her business on long terms; she knows that is not a great amount of money, but with it she may fill her stock, buying consumer goods which she may resell fast enough to be reinvesting soon and get a bigger profit. She dreams that in a close future (if she is able to make work her loans good enough) she may get a bigger loan and then change her fixed assets, like her refrigerator or her showcase. So at this very moment people may see the actual situation like a step to climb for a brighter future.

loans.use: To improve her grocery store

loans.name: Khanha's Group

texts.en:
Khanha’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Khanha makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer and seller to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure, among other necessary products.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José a sus 59 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y su hija de 17 años de edad que hace poco tiempo vive en la casa pero que ellos siempre apoyan. José se gana la vida en una empresa cercana a su vivienda desde hace mucho tiempo, además recibe el apoyo de su esposa, que posee una tienda de productos básicos en su vivienda, lo que le permite apoyar con los gastos del hogar. José desea brindar una mayor protección a su esposa e hija, por lo que ha decidido construir una cerca de tela metálica, además de comprar un portón que brinde protección, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: tela metálica, un portón, postes y alambre para construir una cerca de tela metálica e instalar un portón, y de esta manera proteger a su familia. Con el crédito que solicito anteriormente José cambio el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
José, 59, is applying for a loan to improve his house.  He and his wife have a 17-year old daughter who has only lived with them a short while, even though they have always provided for her.  José has worked for a local company for many years and his wife operates a small grocery from a space in their house.  Their incomes are enough to support the family.   

José wants to make his house safer for his wife and daughter and is applying for a FUSAI loan that he will use to buy the materials he needs--chain-link fencing, posts, wire, etc.--to build a fence.  He used a past loan to repair his roof.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for a fence and gate.

loans.name: Maira Estefani

texts.es:
Maira Estefani tiene 22 años de edad , Soltera, sin hijos a su  cargo, vive en casa familiar, en el distrito de Oyotún, la cual es una zona rural, que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo, region lambayeque, Costa Norte de Perú.
Maira tiene su bazar, en el cual vende productos como son peluches, regalos , papel de regalo y adornos para fiestas infantiles , etc, desde hace 1 año el negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio; solicita préstamo para invertir en capital de trabajo; compra de peluches,regalos,piñatas,accesorios, etc, esto le servira para tener mayor variedad en su negocio, esto con la finalidad de poder satifacer los gustos de sus clientes y asi poder incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maira Estefani, aged 22, is single, and has no children. She lives in the family home in a rural area of Oyotún district, located in Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast.

Maira has a shop selling soft toys, gifts, gift wrap, decorations for children's parties, etc. For the past year, the business has been located in her home. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business, by buying soft toys, gifts, piñatas, accessories, etc. This will allow her to expand the range of goods she offers her customers, and thus increase her earnings.

loans.use: to invest in her business by buying soft toys, gifts, piñatas, accessories, etc., in order to expand her range of stock.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada desde hace mas de 6 años y con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando el techo a su casa pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando a INTEGRAL un credito para la compra de laminas, polines y pago de mano de obra para poder vivir mas seguros y comodos.
texts.en: Fernando, 47, and his wife live in a house of their own.  He has worked for a private company for 6 years.  His income covers the family's household expenses but doesn't stretch far enough to pay for the labor and supplies he needs to repair his roof.  He is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan that he will use to carry out the work.  The investment will make the house safer and more comfortable for him and his wife.

loans.use: to pay for the labor and supplies he needs to repair his roof.

loans.name: Maryluz

texts.es: Maryluz de 30 años es una comerciante que heredó esta actividad de su madre, quien logró solventar económicamente a su familia, gracias al comercio de artículos y aunque toda su vida estuvo ligada a las ventas, tan solo cuenta con dos años de experiencia.  Ella reside en el municipio de Sabanagrande en compañía de su cónyuge y su hijo de cinco años, lo que más le gusta de su labor es que no desatiende su hogar y mucho menos a su pequeño hijo quien la acompaña hasta las viviendas de sus clientes a mostrarles prendas de vestir y accesorios.   Maryluz está disponible para promover ventas todos los días de la semana a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m., en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en nuevo surtido de prendas de vestir, accesorios y demás encargos de sus clientes.  Con esta inversión podrá continuar ofreciendo bienestar a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maryluz, age 30, works in sales.  She inherited this line of work from her mother, who managed to keep her family afloat financially by selling things.  Although her life was tied to sales, she only has two years of experience.  She lives with her partner and her five-year-old child in the town on Sabanagrande.  What she likes best about her job is that she doesn’t have to leave her home uncared for, much less her small child, who comes with her to her customers’ homes when she shows them outfits and accessories.  

Maryluz is available to promote her sales every day of the week from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m.  At this point in time she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to invest in new inventory of outfits, accessories, and other items customers request.  With this investment, she will be able to keep providing for her family’s wellbeing and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to stock up on outfits, accessories, and other orders from her customers

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 33 years old and married with one child in school, Lilibeth works very hard to provide for them.

Lilibeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, candies, home product care, and other groceries.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as  rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, candies, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Merenciana

texts.en:
Merenciana is 62 years old, with three children. Merenciana works very hard to provide for them.

Merenciana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care and other groceries.

Merenciana has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Merenciana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Sothea's Group

texts.en: Sothea’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sothea makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer and tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: El Sol Sale Para Todos 4 Group

texts.en:
Marianela is a member of the group, El Sol Sale Para Todos 4 (The Sun Rises for Everyone 4). She lives together with her long term partner and she has 4 children. She started her business with the first loan she got from Esperanza. Marianela and her group are from the city of Hato Mayor, in one of the most rural parts of the country. The area's economy depends mostly on agriculture. The group members are micro-businesswomen, in clothing sales, sales of natural products, shoes, food sales, etc.

Marianela is receiving her 15th loan. Each previous loan has been repaid satisfactorily, and she has made good investments. She is currently selling clothes and all kind of cosmetics, accessories, shoes for women, kids and men, in her 'Fantasia' (name given to little stores in Dominican Republic). She is planning to use the new loan to increase her inventory.

She will save her profits, because she wants to finish building her house. Her favorite pastime is to do business, and her main challenge is to live in a safe home.

She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seedlings, pesticide and fertilizer

loans.name: Sayedat Al Basaten Group

texts.en:
Huda is the featured borrower for the Sayedat al Basaten Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Huda is a 49-year-old married mother of two. Five years ago, she got employed in a company and helps her husband in his grocery shop to increase her family's income. She is a sacrificing mother who is working hard to satisfy her children's needs. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees. Huda is depriving herself for the sake of her children's education. She is the second lady on the left.
With respect to the other group members, Iman is the first lady on the left, Ola is the second lady on the right, and Joumana is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Gloria Amparo

texts.en:
Gloria is 61 years old and lives in the municipality of Copacabana. She is a mother of two daughters, and she’s the head of the family. Although it hasn’t been easy for her, she never stops fighting for her family and dreaming.

She wants to study so she can start her own business; with her sister she wants to create their own feast and events making business. They have been working in that for other companies, but now the objective is to become independent.

She asked for a loan so she can pay for her studies in biscuits and covers for cakes.

She’s sure that with these complementary studies her business is going to be really successful. Help Gloria to pay for her studies and to start building this big dream that she has.

loans.use: to pay for her studies in biscuits and coverts for cakes.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco, de 37 años de edad, no estudio, actualmente está acompañado y tiene 3 hijos con su pareja, pero actualmente solo uno de sus hijos está estudiando.

Francisco, tiene experiencia en la siembra de granos básicos, su padre fue quien le enseño todo lo que sabe, ahora trabaja en una granja de pollos desde hace 12 años.

Francisco, necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y 2 galones de herbicidas para preparar la tierra.

Francisco, espera tener buen rendimiento en la cosecha para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco is 37 years old and has no formal education. He lives with his domestic partner and they have 3 children together, only one of which is currently studying. 

Francisco has experience cultivating basic grains. His father taught him everything that he knows. He's been working in a chicken farm for the last 12 years.

Francisco needs the loan to buy fertilizers and 2 gallons of herbicide to get the land ready for planting.

Francisco hopes to get a good return in the harvest to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and 2 gallons of herbicide to get the land ready for planting

loans.name: Jaime Luis

texts.en:
Jaime is 27 years old and lives in the municipality of Las Cordobas. This year he decided to start his own business, raising pigs (pork livestock,) a job that he inherited from his family and where he works really hard. He does it eight hours, all seven days of the week.

Although he’s just starting, he knows what he wants to accomplish with his business. He’s determined that it’s going to be successful. He wants it to last over time and he wants to improve his sales.

He’s asking for a loan so he can buy inputs and more pigs.

Jaime’s house isn’t in the best condition. He dreams of fixing all the problems that his home has so he can live better and more comfortably.

You can help Jaime accomplish all his dreams and let him get closer to achieve his goals; a loan will do that for him.

loans.use: buy inputs and more pigs

loans.name: Noun's Group

texts.en: Noun’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Noun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sol De America Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sol de América está en su ciclo número 1° del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo, donde cada una se puso como meta el crecimiento de todas, por medio de las capacitaciones que irán recibiendo. Están además dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por poder mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Myrian, quien se dedica a la costura, comenta que hace todo tipo de confecciones, para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo. Ella es una persona luchadora que pone todo su esfuerzo para poder seguir dando a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener, y así evitar que pasen por necesidades.
La Sra. Myrian  solicita de este préstamo para la compra de materiales para poder realizar su trabajo de costurera, como ser telas, hilos, gomas y otros, de manera a poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The "Sol de América" group is in its first Women's Committee lending cycle. It is a new group in which each member has set a goal of growth for everyone through the training that they will be receiving. They are also in the Poverty Elimination program, striving to be able to improve their lives.

One of the members is Señora Myrian, who works as a seamstress. She says that she does all kinds of sewing in order to help her family through her work. She is a determined person who puts all her efforts into being able to continue giving her family everything that she was unable to have so that they will never be in need.

Señora Myrian is requesting this loan for the purchase of materials so that she will be able to carry out her sewing work, including fabrics, thread, elastic, and more. In this way, she will be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, elastic, and other items to use in sewing

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: El jubilarse no representó una angustia para Humberto, porque vio en el paso de los años y la madurez, una fortaleza para emprender nuevos retos.  Como una  tarea que le permite mantenerse en actividad constante y  en ningún caso el paso a una vida pasiva y sin proyección,  hace 6 años se dedica al alquiler de lavadoras, idea de negocio que se le ocurrió al ver que existía una demanda insatisfecha en el sector, pues la oferta de este servicio era insuficiente. Inició con dos lavadoras que y poco a poco su demanda se hizo mayor,  de tal manera que un mes después compro 5 más. Sus clientela está conformada por los vecinos del barrio a quienes les presta su servicio diariamente  de 7:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m.  Ahora Humberto  planea ampliar su radio de acción a otros barrios organizando otro punto de servicio, para lo cual necesita adquirir otras lavadoras cuya compra financiara con los recursos de su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. El afirma que el camino es difícil, como para cualquier emprendedor, pero las ganas y la experiencia de vida son más cuando un adulto mayor toma la decisión de emprender. Su meta es que su negocio siga creciendo, generar empleo y seguir aportando para que sus hijos se superen pues considera que como  padre su felicidad es seguir apoyando a sus hijos.
texts.en: Retiring wasn't a distress for Humberto because he saw in the passing of the years and maturity a strength to undertake new challenges. As work that allows him to keep in constant activity and in no case moving to a passive life without protection, for 6 years he has worked renting washing machines. The idea for the business occurred to him upon seeing that there was an unmet demand in the sector, since the availability of this service was insufficient. He began with two washing machines and little by little his demand increased, in such a way that a month later he bought 5 more. His customer base is made up of the people in the neighborhood to whom he offers his service daily from 7:00 am to 4.00 pm. Now Humberto plans to expand his range of operation to other neighborhoods, organizing another service point, for which he needs to get more washing machines whose purchase he will finance with the resources from his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He says that the road is difficult, like for any entrepreneur, but the earnings and the life experiences are more when an older adult makes the decision to be an entrepreneur. His goal is that his business continues to grow, to generate jobs and continue contributing so that his children improve themselves since he believes that as a father his happiness is to continue supporting his children.

loans.use: to get more washing machines.

loans.name: Sulma Karina

texts.es:
Sulma, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está soltera, tiene 5 hijos y todos viven en casa y los mayores asisten a la escuela, ella vive con su mamá y sus dos hermanas, pero solo sus hijos dependen económicamente de ella.

Sulma, se ha dedicado desde hace 6 años a la venta de tortillas, aprendió este negocio porque antes su mamá se dedicaba también a esta actividad, ella vende las tortillas en su casa y su mamá le ayuda a hacer las tortillas y su horario es de 8:00 a.m. hasta las 3:00 p.m.

Ella, necesita el préstamo para comprar una plancha, porque la que tiene ya no le sirve mucho, también comprará maíz para la venta de tortillas.

Su sueño es poder tener su casa propia y pagar los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sulma is 28 years old and has a sixth-grade education. She is single with 5 children and they all live at home and the eldest are in school. She lives with her mom and her two sisters, but only her children are financially dependent on her.

Sulma has been selling tortillas for six years. She learned this business because her mom used to do this work too. She sells tortillas in her home and her mom helps her make the tortillas and her schedule is from 8:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.

She needs this loan to buy a press because the one she has does not work well anymore; she will also buy corn to sell tortillas.

Her dream is to be able to have her own home and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a press to make tortillas

loans.name: Ada De Jesus

texts.es:
Ada, de 42 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudió hasta sexto grado, proviene de una familia de muy bajos recursos económicos, y por esa razón no siguió estudiando, es madre de 3 hijos, todos son menores de edad.

Ada, trabaja en la agricultura desde hace 20 años aproximadamente, sus padres le enseñaron este trabajo con la finalidad que tuviera una fuente de ingresos, el terreno donde siembra sus cultivos está a una distancia de medio kilómetro desde su casa; a Ada, también le gusta tener vacas y terneros.

Ada, necesita el préstamo para comprar 2 novillos de repasto para engordarlos y cuando se llegue la fecha de vencimiento del préstamo venderlos y con la ganancia comprar todo lo de la canasta básica, para el bienestar de sus hijos.

Ada, sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales para que tengan mejores oportunidades de empleo y que tengan una casa propia.
texts.en:
Ada is 42 years old and a housewife. She went to school until the sixth grade. She comes from a family of very limited economic resources, which is why she couldn't continue her studies. She is the mother of 3 children, all of whom are minors.

For approximately 20 years, Ada has worked in agriculture. Her parents taught her this work so that she would have a source of income. The land where she sows her crops is a half kilometer from her house.

Ada also likes to have cows and steers. Ada needs a loan to buy 2 grazing steers to fatten. When her loan comes due, she will sell them and with the profit will buy all her basic household items, for the well-being of her children.

Ada dreams that her children will be professionals, so that they will have better employment opportunities and a home of their own.

loans.use: to buy 2 grazing steer to fatten.

loans.name: Jlg-003-Melathaliyampatti Group

texts.en:
21-year-old Ranjani leads a group of three in Kulithalai, Tamil Nadu. She works hard to sustain her family. She and her family have no access to toilets, and therefore have to resort to open defecation using the false privacy of nearby fields and surrounding shrubbery. This puts them at risk of infection, molestation or attack, and even insect or animal bites.

All the women in the group face the same problem. Therefore, they have come together to build toilets for themselves in their own homes. They seek a loan of 42,000 INR to cover the cost of raw materials and labor for constructing these toilets. Your loan will provide these three families the privacy of using their own toilet, which will be a big step towards a better standard of living for them. Higher standards of hygiene will also lead to reduced medical expenses, and hence, more savings in the long run.

loans.use: To fund the installation of a toilet in their home

loans.name: Jlg-012-Thiruchapur Group

texts.en:
Rajeswari belongs to Kulithalai in rural Tamil Nadu. She works as a daily wage labourer in the agriculture sector. She has three members in her family including a teen aged child. Her monthly saving is Rs. 1,000 only. She has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. Rajeswari’s family is one of the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. Hence subsequently putting themselves at a risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites. 

Joining hands with Pappathi, Padma, and Dhanalakshmi whose families all face similar problems due to a lack of sanitation facilities, she has formed a group of four members and is hoping to address this issue. Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for Rajeswari and family. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. So, together, they seek a loan of Rs. 56,000 to build a toilet at home. As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses. Your loan will provide all four families access to improved hygiene and a better way of life.

loans.use: To construct a toilet in her home

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en: Savy’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Savy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Jlg-002-Karupathur Group

texts.en:
Umadevi is a mother of three children. She lives in Kulithalai, Tamil Nadu with her family. She is concerned about the health of her family. They have no access to toilets, and they therefore have to resort to open defecation using the false privacy of nearby fields and surrounding shrubbery. This puts them at risk of infection, molestation or attack, and even insect or animal bites.

Seeking to improve her situation, she formed a group with women who face the same problem and applied for a loan of 42,000 INR to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help these three hardworking, rural Indian families to have access to basic sanitation, and consequently, safety, improved health, medical savings, and improved productivity.

loans.use: To improve sanitation facilities in her home by installing a toilet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabric and supplies to be able to improve her work and minimize her costs, in this way to increase her income for her family.

loans.name: Mealii

texts.en:
Mealii is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither  has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 10,000 she wants to purchase new clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes for resale

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 52 years old, married and has five children.

She is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Nora requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables seeds for her farm.

Nora has been farming vegetables for 29 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetable seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Othman

texts.en: Othman is a 36-year-old married father of two. Almost a year ago, he got a job with a company earning a good salary to cover the needs and expenses of his children. He is a hard worker who is trying hard to improve his family's living conditions. He is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his children's school tuition fees. He believes that education is the only way to guarantee his children's future and he hopes to stay capable of providing them with a better life.

loans.use: to pay his children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is a married father of four children. He describes himself as dedicated. He operates a retail business where he sells plowing tools. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are farmers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be transportation and changes in prices. Benard will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more plowing tools. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of plowing tools

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business selling bananas in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bananas to sell for her business.

Edna has been in this business for six years. Edna earns additional income from farming rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Vjollca

texts.en:
Vjollca is 44, married and a mother of two children. They live in a little town just north of Albania where she's been operating a clothing store for the past year. For a very long time she was living with a transplanted organ and relying on disability income. She could not find a suitable job until she started operating her own store.

She said. "Running the store doesn't put any labor demands on my body, so i can do it easily. Also the income i generate from the store almost doubles the $100/month i was receiving from the disability," said Vjollca to the loan officer during the interview. 

Her husband works as a police officer in the town of their residence and their children are in universities. 

She wants to buy an inventory of clothes for her store.

loans.use: to stock her clothing store with inventory items

loans.name: Rim's Group

texts.en: Rim’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Rim makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Riad

texts.en:
Riad is a 47-year-old married father of four children and a Palestinian refugee. Thirty three years ago, he started car painting to cover the needs and expenses of his children. He is a hard worker who has a good reputation among his customers. He is trying hard to develop his business. He is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary tools for his auto painting business to provide his customers with better service.
Riad hopes to expand his business in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy tools for his auto painting business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables such as; tomatoes, chilies, carrots, kangkung, and water spinach.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ropes and seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is grateful that she was repeatedly granted loans in the past, which have all been repaid on time. Those funds have certainly helped sustain and increase her sewing business, as is shown in her photo. Although at times she has difficulty collecting payments from some of her customers, she is glad that it can be offset by the good sales of her other business, which is a small general store.

To help Delia maintain and grow her business, she is humbly asking for a PHP 20,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as canned goods, instant noodles, powdered milk and chocolate drinks, coffee, sugar, eggs, beverages and toiletries to sell at her store. She needs to fill her store with these essential food items to attract more customers.

Delia is thanking God and you for your continued support of her livelihood. It means a lot to her, for this is her source of income to help provide for her family's needs, and more so, to send her four children to school.

Delia's simple dream is to expand her store into a big grocery store and see her children finish school. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married mother of four children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, Mwanaisha has operated an open-air food business, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Rasuljon

texts.en: Rasuljon is a bright boy who was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1997. He is single and living in a big, busy city with his family. He graduated high school with excellence. He likes to study and learn more to gain knowledge. He is interested in international relations and passed exams at university to study this specialty. Rasuljon successfully passed an entrance examination and hopes to achieve his goals. He appealed to IMON asking for financial support to pay his higher education costs. Rasuljon awaits Kive lenders' kindness and support.

loans.use: to help pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Linah

texts.en: Linah is a Kiva borrower who has two children. She describes herself as ambitious. Linah operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. Linah will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more sugar, bread, soap and other items. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, bread, soap and other items

loans.name: Los Progresistas De Cupiche Group

texts.es: Nélida tiene 42 años de edad es soltera con un hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de menús en horas de la mañana y por las tardes vende comida rápida. Años atrás se dedicaba al lavado de carros. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas mercadería al por mayor  para su negocio de comida aceite arroz azúcar y demás insumos. El grupo “LOS PROGRESISTAS DE CUPICHE” agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Nélida es la segunda persona parada del lado derecho.
texts.en:
Nélida is 42 years old, single, and has a small son. She makes a living by selling menus in the morning and in the afternoon she sells fast food.

Years ago she worked by washing cars. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise in bulk for her business, such as food, oil, rice, sugar, and other supplies.

The group Los Progresistas de Cupiche is very grateful to Kiva's investors for providing the loan. Nélida is the second person sitting on the right side.

loans.use: to buy more rice and sugar.

loans.name: Muhibakhon

texts.en: Muhibakhon is a cheerful girl. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1991. She is single and lives with her parents. They have a big family and only her mother is working. She is a responsible, honest, communicable and generous person. She graduated from secondary school with excellence and passed the entrance examination for the university.
