Recently she is studying at the medical university in her seventh year. She appealed to IMON to get a loan to pay her tuition fees. She awaits Kiva lenders’ kindness and support. She hopes the loan will help her to pay her higher education costs and she can successfully finish studying and be professional.

loans.use: To pay her higher education costs

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a married woman, and she has six children. She describes herself to be ambitious.

Rosemary operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals.

Rosemary will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Sarma

texts.en:
Sarma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines.

Sarma is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy dried fish to sell in her dried fish business.

Sarma has been in this business for two years. Sarma earns more income from a general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Sarma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell in her dried fish business.

loans.name: Srin's Group

texts.en:
A farmer from Kampong Cham district, Srin is 49 years old and has three dependent children to take care of. As she is a widow, she is the breadwinner in the family, and she is working hard on her rice growing business to earn the main income. Meanwhile, she is vending grocery items to supplement her income. She is able to earn about 55,300 KHR per day to sustain her living.

The farming business’ obstacles are that the crops can be sold at lower prices, and she lacks working capital to support the business. She is now leading a group of five members to take out a loan from VisionFund. She will use her loan portion to purchase seeds and organic fertilizer to boost the growth. Some of loan portion left will be used to buy organic pesticide.

Her hope is to generate more income and improve her living condition.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and organic fertilizer to boost the growth of her crop yield in order to increase her income.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia is glad and encouraged that she has twice received assistance to help her finance her junk shop business. Aside from her junk recycling shop she also has a tricycle service which her husband drives. The couple, like the majority of Filipinos, struggles to make a living but Ignacia and her husband support each other to make their life better.

She is again hopeful that she can avail herself of a PHP 50,000 loan to pay for more recyclable metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials which she will sell to foundries and the like. She values and focuses on her junk shop for this is a good source of income and is a great help in sustaining their everyday needs. She is grateful for your untiring support of their livelihood.

Ignacia plans to acquire a property for a bigger junk shop. She dreams of a better life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy scrap materials to sell.

loans.name: Hazem

texts.en: Hazem is a 37-year-old married father of three children. Four years ago, he started his grocery shop in an attempt to increase his income and satisfy his children's needs. He is a hard worker who has a good reputation among his region. Hazem is trying desperately to improve his family's living conditions; thus today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his son's school tuition fees. He hopes to expand his business more in the future and stay capable of providing his children with a better life.

loans.use: to pay his son's school tuition fees

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman, and she has six children. She describes herself to be ambitious.

Christine operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals.

Christine will use the KES 45,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use.

Christine hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Neliko

texts.en:
Neliko is a married man who describes himself as hardworking and resilient. The income from the business has helped him to get money to take care of his family's financial obligations.

He operates a farm where he keeps cows and also grows crops. He has been involved in the cattle business for 15 years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are locals.

He will use the loan to buy more cows. His business goal is to expand his farm over the next five years. He appreciates the financial support.

Pictured is the client and the UGAFODE Credit officer (right to left).

loans.use: To boost his cattle trade business

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is glad that she was previously granted a loan to finance her direct selling of organic drinks and processed foods. It really helped maintain her business and thus fund their daily needs. Although there are times she encounters delayed payment from some of her customers, she is thankful that God provided her with new and good customers.

To sustain her business she is seeking your assistance again for PHP 20,000, which she will use to buy more quantities of cold cuts like hot dogs, ham and burger patties to sell. These are some of the favorite "baon" (packed lunch or packed snack) of high school and elementary children going to school. Bernadette sells them to the middle class families in her community. She now has regular customers who patronize her products. She trusts and is thanking you in advance for your positive response to support her business.

Bernadette dreams of growing her retailing business to increase her income and be able to save for her daughter's education. She is aware that a good education is a path to a better life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for  processed cold cuts  to sell.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is young hardworking man with a wife and child. He drives a motorcycle that helps him to earn income to meet his financial obligations like paying rent, buying food and paying school fees for his siblings.

The motorcycle is his major source of income. He has applied for a loan to repair it because lately it has been breaking down, causing him considerable losses as at times he has to spend the day in the garage instead of working. He is grateful that the kiva lenders are willing and committed to supporting him in growing his business.

Pictured is the client and the UGAFODE Credit officer (left to right).

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en: Sary’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sary makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Isaiah, 65, is the chairperson of a group that sells chicken. The business has grown over the last year and the team is planning to open a small meat shop to sell the chicken. "We will sell raw chicken and also sell chicken stew and other chicken meals for those who want to eat," says Isaiah.

He is requesting a Kiva loan to buy a deep freezer and a secondhand scooter to be used for deliveries.

"This business will help our youth to stay busy and give them a better life," says Isaiah on what motivates him to do the business.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer and secondhand scooter.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 39-year-old married father of five children and a Palestinian refugee. A year ago, he opened a cafe to cover the needs and expenses of his children. He is a hard worker and ambitious man who has succeeded in gaining loyal customers. Today, Khaled is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy different types of coffee and drinks to satisfy his customers' special requests.

Khaled hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy different types of coffee and drinks

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Meet 22-year-old Mohammad from Tulkarem. He is single with no child for now.

In 2010, Mohammad started his sewing business in his house. He began his sewing business because he needed a permanent source of income. He says that his only source of income comes from his business. He has two full-time employees and one part-time employee. He says that the main challenge to his business is the competitors in his marketplace.

Mohammad requires a loan in order to buy three new sewing machines. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his standard of living.

In the future, Mohammad plans to see his business grow. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy three sewing machines.

loans.name: Rida

texts.en:
Rida is a 51-year-old, widowed mother of six children. She has owned her own bakery for 19 years. Her long experience has provided her with special talents in her domain. She faced some difficulties during establishing her business, since she had to raise her children and develop her business alone after her husband passed away.

Rida is trying hard to satisfy her children's needs; thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a necessary medical earphone for her son, and she wants to maintain her car.

As for the future, she hopes to open a larger bakery to increase her income and develop her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy a necessary medical earphone for her son and maintain her car.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: Bilal is a 32-year-old married man from Jabalia City, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house. Bilal is working in the field of interior decoration of homes. He is talented in the formation of gypsum molds. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but Gaza Strip is a difficult place to live in due to the Israeli economic blockade, in place since 2007. Bilal took a loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new tools like gypsum molds and paints for his workshop. He hopes that these new tools will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually enable him to save enough income to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy new tools like gypsum molds and paints for his workshop.

loans.name: Ekomefeemo 6 Group

texts.en:
Zelita is a very hardworking woman who is devoted to her business, which is selling corn dough, cassava dough, and charcoal. She has done this job from her home for more than eight years. Her business is located at her residence, which is a family house. It is close to the main street in her community that has a high stream of people every day. She supplies products to her entire community, mostly to people who cook kenkey (cooked corn paste) and banku (cooked corn and cassava paste) for sale.

Zelita is requesting a loan to buy more corn dough, cassava dough and charcoal, which she will sell to her customers. She hopes that with this investment, she can satisfy her customers' demands. This will allow her to generate more income in order to get her and her family ahead. Zelita dreams of having a well-stocked business with everything that her customers need.

This is a group loan, and the other members are:
Aminatu, who has been selling enamel bowls for more than 3 years.
Juliana, who has been selling soft drinks in her home for more than 5 years.
Naomie, who has been selling ice chests and plastic plates for more than 10 years.
Elizabeth, who has been selling bowls, cooking utensils, and cutlery sets for 21 years.
Omar, who has been selling medicinal and medicated cream for 10 years.

loans.use: to buy more corn dough, cassava dough and charcoal, which she will sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sheet metal, sand, poles and screws so she can carry out repairs and improvements to her home.

loans.name: Zaynab

texts.en:
Zaynab is a generous girl. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1998. She is single and lives with parents.

This year she graduated from high school with excellent and good marks. She likes to study and be involved in youth activities. She is interested in accountant studies at State University. She appealed to IMON and Kiva, asking to get a loan to pay her higher education costs.

She awaits Kiva lender’s kindness and support. The loan will help her to be educated and have good work in the future.

loans.use: to pay her higher education costs.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice feels encouraged that she received financial help to purchase supplies and products for her direct selling business. She appears in the photo. Her earnings enabled her to start selling chocolates, biscuits, and cooking oil in front of her house, as well. She also delivers to some of her customers.

Alice hopes she can take a loan of a PHP 20,000 to purchase chocolate, biscuits, and cooking oil from wholesalers to sell at retail prices. These are fast moving items, so for now she is focusing on them. Alice is glad that she has mostly good customers, except for a number who delay their payments. She trusts that you will continue to support her business.

Alice dreams of having a store of her own and prays for good health and a long life. She faithfully meets each week with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for chocolates, biscuits, and oil to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, sugar, eggs, soap, shampoo, chips, etc.

Nancy industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like raising livestock. She dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, sugar, eggs, soap, shampoo, chips, etc.

loans.name: Nak's Group

texts.en: Nak’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Nak makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Norsiana

texts.en:
Norsiana is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Norsiana supplements her income with earnings from fishing. She dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Unidas es de la ciudad de San Ignacio,  demuestran unidad y solidaridad entre ellas, trabajan juntas en actividades, además están conformes y sienten el apoyo del programa de comité de mujeres, a través del cual ellas pueden mejorar sus ingresos y ser cada vez más independientes.
La Sra. Fátima es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella es una persona muy sacrificada que poco a poco se ha abierto camino y hoy día ya tiene una buena peluquería equipada con todo lo que necesita para ofrecer a sus clientes un buen servicio. Ella comenta que inicio con muy poco, pero fue abriéndose camino y ya es bastante conocida en su barrio.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su peluquería, como ser tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues, tijeras y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. En la foto del grupo aparecen 19 personas ya que el grupo tiene 19 miembros, pero esta vez solo piden 18 de las integrantes este préstamo.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Unidas" communal bank is in the city of San Ignacio. They demonstrate unity and solidarity among themselves. They work together on tasks and they are comfortable and feel the support of the women's committee program through which they can improve their earnings and become increasingly more independent.

Fatima is one of the members of this group. She is a person who makes sacrifices and who, little by little, has been making progress. She already has a successful hair salon equipped with everything needed to offer good service to her customers. She mentions that she started out with very little, but she has been making progress and she is already fairly well-known in her neighborhood.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy supplies for her hair salon such as dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses, scissors and other items. This is so she can continue working as she has been doing.

She is thankful for the opportunity she is receiving to grow and improve her and her family's living conditions. In the group photo there are 19 people, as the group has 19 members, but this time only 18 of the members are requesting this loan.

loans.use: to buy dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses, scissors and other items.

loans.name: Jose Jaime

texts.es: Jose de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado bovino y al cultivo de maiz desde hace 20 años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde le reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos de sus gastos, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de un toro semental y asi continuar con la crianza para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Jose is 40 years old and lives in his own house with his three children. He has been working in cattle breading and maize cultivation for 20 year. He commercializes his products in the surroundings of his area of residence. He settles some of his costs from what he earns from his sales. 

He is requesting for a loan to buy a stud bull. This way he can continue with cattle breeding in order to have better economic income.

loans.use: buy a stud bull

loans.name: Maa Tara Tarini Shg-E Group

texts.en:
Sita, 21, is the lady standing in a red saree to the right hand side in the photograph. She is blessed with two beautiful daughters and is a resident of a small village of Koraput district,Odisha, India. Most of the women in her group are working in dairy farming or own other small businesses in their village in Odisha, a state on the eastern coast of India.

Sita, along with her group member, is requesting for a loan amount of 30,000 INR.With her portion of the loan, Sita will buy more cows to increase her dairy farming business. Her husband works as a florist in the village, and they both support their two children together. After this loan, Sita will be able to be more independent and help give her family a better standard of living. Sita is an entrepreneur at heart and has big dreams of one day owning a large dairy farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows to increase her dairy farming business

loans.name: Sanja

texts.en:
Sanja is a 35-year-old mother of three children, living with her family in a minority community. In order to earn a living, she works with her husband in agriculture. They are able to provide for their family through their business of planting corn and wheat on their land and then selling it. They are very hard-working parents who do much in order to give their children whatever they need.

Sanja is requesting a loan for the first time, so that she can purchase a new machine to use on her land to harvest her crops. She will be able to generate more income with a new machine. Her goal is to be able to save money for her children to give them a better education and then a better future. She is really happy for this opportunity and promises to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase a new machine to use on her land to harvest her crops.

loans.name: Miodrag

texts.en:
Miodrag lives with his wife in a small village in a minority community. His children are grown and married with families of their own. Miodrag has been involved in agriculture for a long time now and enjoys working on his land. His business of planting corn and wheat to sell has always been the main source of income for his family. He works very hard and for long hours because he loves his work and his wife often helps him.

Now, for the first time Miodrag is asking for a loan to purchase a new machine to work on his land. This loan will help him be able to harvest more crops and sell more products to earn more income. He is very grateful for such an opportunity and thanks the lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: to purchase a new machine to work on his land

loans.name: Chernor Amadu

texts.en:
This is 26 year-old Chernor, who is single. In 2008, Chernor established his spare parts for motor vehicles, lubricant and provision business. He began his business because of better standards of living. His business is located in the city centre and his main customers are the public. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL1000000 every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL5000000. Chernor requires a loan in order to buy more soft, hard drinks and provisions for resale. He hopes that this loan will help to maximize profit and to carter for more customers. In the future, Chernor still plans to engage in the selling more provisions, as the lubricant business is doing well. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for bread, milk, mayonnaise and eggs

loans.name: Sultan

texts.en:
Sultan is married and a mother of three. She is making ornamental stitching and preparing wedding trousseau in her store, selling them and making a contribution to the family budget. With the help of her second loan from MAYA she bought fabric in bulk.



Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Sultan Hanım evli ve 3 çocuk annesi. Sultan hanım dükkanın dan siparişle piko ve çeyiz ürünleri yaparak evinin geçimine destek oluyor. Maya dan 2. kredisini kullanan Sultan Hanım aldığı krediler ile toptan kumaş aldı.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Paul Armah

texts.en:
Paul is a working student, pursuing a degree program in Accountancy at the University of Cape Coast. He is soliciting for the loan to enable him pay his tuition fees. He draws inspiration from his brother, an architect who has done so much for himself at very young age and he intends to go higher in that area.
He believes the completion of his studies would push him up from an accounts officer to financial accountant, increase his salary, and thus help offer support to needy in society and his family. He sees himself acquiring a master’s degree in the nearest future. This would afford him the opportunity of becoming the head of finance and administration or chief finance officer.
His education would have delayed for a year if he was denied this loan.

He thinks loans from investors who support educational needs, which will go a long way to increase the standard of living of the citizens of Ghana.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition fees for a degree in Accountancy.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 44-year-old married lady who decided two years ago to start her own business selling clothes, perfume, and accessories to support her husband and use her free time for something productive.

Fatima is working hard to increase her business capital and for this reason she is taking a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. She plans to buy merchandise for her business, including special autumn and winter collections especially for school needs.

Fatima's next step forward is to start selling Brazilian Gold, which is in great demand among her customers, and she is looking forward to taking this step.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special autumn and winter collectio especially for school needs

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 25 years old single man, who is working hard to develop his business as much as he can, to make sure that he can benefit from a better future.

Five years ago, Rabih opened his car spare parts and hardware selling shop. He also deals with providing car insurance services as an additional business.

Rabih is planning to expand and increase his business capital. Through an acquired YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, Rabih is going to increase his business merchandise with special highly requested cars hardware, and spare parts.
He is working hard to keep on developing his business and tools.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with special highly requested cars hardware and spare parts.

loans.name: Ghiwa

texts.en:
Ghiwa is a 19-year-old single ambitious single lady, who is working hard as a cashier in a reputable restaurant since January 2015, to pay for her university's tuition fees.

Ghinwa is studying Media, she is in her third year and is looking forward to graduate and work within her domain. To accomplish her dream, she has to work hard in order to pay for the requested university fees. Since her monthly income is limited and barely enough to cover her needs, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her third year Media university courses tuition fees.
She hopes to develop her working sector and fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: To pay for her third year Media university courses tuition fees

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie works hard to support her family. Lorelie is married and has a noodle-making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, salt, cooking oil, etc for her noodles production business .

Lorelie has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Lorelie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, salt, and cooking oil for her noodles production

loans.name: Donaciano

texts.en:
Donaciano is a smallholder Mexican farmer who owns cows, sheep, and cultivates corn in a field close to his farm. He has decided to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester in order to reduce his operating expenses. Indeed, he used to spend an important amount of his income in the purchase of fossil fuel-based LP gas and chemical fertilizers. In addition, he and his family were spending hours collecting wood to cook. By investing in the biodigester, Donaciano will become his own renewable energy and biofertilizer supplier, simply by transforming his animals' manure into biogas and biol. He will save money and protect the environment by treating the waste that used to emit dangerous greenhouse gases, displacing fossil fuels and wood. With his savings, he plans to buy additional cows and invest in the expansion of his farm.
This loan represents 20% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy and a downpayment from the client.

loans.use: to invest in an 8 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Nahed

texts.en:
A hardworking mother of four children. This is Nahed, the supportive wife, who started from her house working with her husband in his upholstery business, so that she can manage at the same time taking care of her beloved family and helping him responding to customers' needs.

Nahed is 33 years old, and she can handle taking care and managing more than one business at a time. Nahed doesn't work only in the upholstery business, she also works as a hairdresser from her house and managed to open a small snack shop.

To improve her family's living and increase their income, Nahed opened her own small Manakish Bakery and she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to develop her bakery through making necessary maintenance and buying new and helpful machines to increase her production.
She is very excited about this loan and is planning to open a larger cafe in the future.

loans.use: to develop her bakery through making necessary maintenance and buying new and helpful machines to increase her production.

loans.name: Estrellas De Occidente Group

texts.en:
The bustling city of Quetzaltenango, commonly called “Xela”, is the second largest in Guatemala. Here, nine hardworking women have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Estrellas de Occidente” or “Stars of the West”. They vary in age with some being quite young and others older with their own families. They share the common vision of being successful businesswomen, increasing their earnings, improving the living standard of their families and prospering.

The majority of the women are involved in catalogue sales and 41-year-old Astrid is one of them. She is the hardworking mother of three children and has been able to send each of them to school including the university level. Astrid is a street vender and sells clothing by catalogue. She has become aware of the need to secure credit to buy clothing from the catalogue in various sizes and styles so that she can show her customers something more than a picture. She is requesting a loan to do this and hopes it will be funded by Kiva lenders.

Astrid and her friends in the Trust Bank enjoy their monthly meetings when they come together, listen and talk to each other, make payments on their loans and then participate in educational training sessions with a Friendship Bridge Facilitator. Each month, a different topic is covered using pictures, diagrams, games and role playing.

The ladies in the Trust Bank are certain that without the support of Kiva lenders, it would not be possible for them to move ahead, expand their businesses and increase earnings. With the support of lenders from throughout the world, the women are slowly moving ahead, creating a happier and more prosperous future for themselves, their families and their community! Thank you, Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy clothing from the catalogue in various sizes and styles so that she can show her customers something more than a picture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in metal sheets, beams, nails, screws, etc., to improve her housing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy sand, cement, metal sheets, beams, and cost of manual labor

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 53 years old and widowed with four children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for her children.

Violeta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as seasonings, spices, canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc. She has been in this business for 19 years. Violeta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as seasonings, spices, canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business making smoked fish in the Philippines. Rowena has been in this business for nine years now.

Rowena requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to make smoked fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to make smoked fish to sell.

loans.name: Tornasol Group

texts.en:
Totonicapan or “Toto” is a very busy and traditional municipality in the highlands of Guatemala where the climate is sometimes very cold. The people who live here, mainly Maya K’iche, are friendly and are proud of their town that serves as an important commercial and manufacturing center with a bustling weekly market. Agriculture plays an important role here as well and there are many farmers who grow corn, beans, wheat and potatoes. Others raise sheep. “Toto” is also known for the production of woven skirts called “cortes” that come in a variety of beautiful and colorful patterns. Other cottage industries include the production of leather goods, pottery and furniture.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Tornasol” was formed by 11 extroverted and motivated women. They each have an average of three children and range in age from 20 to 65 years. The ladies have a variety of small businesses including animal husbandry and clothing sales for children and adults. One is a seamstress while another is a carpenter.

María, who has been married for 11 years, was only able to go to school until the third grade. She does not have any children. Her husband works in a factory, making sandals. Maria has a dream of having her own locale where she can display and sell her merchandise that includes elaborate aprons, traditional skirts or “cortes”, and adornments. She works out of her home, takes orders and sells in the busy local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more raw materials including buttons, zippers, ribbon, fabrics (including lining fabric) and decor.

The “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge, that combines small loans and education, is a real win-win for the women. A Facilitator from the organization shares practical and useful knowledge with the ladies on a variety of subjects. A different topic is covered each month and some in the past months have included goals and dreams, self-esteem and empowerment. Effective business practices including planning, budgeting, pricing, marketing and customer service are important topics as well.

Kiva lenders play a major role in the lives of these women in providing funding for their much-needed loans. Thank you for your generosity and kindness!

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials including buttons, zippers, ribbon, fabrics (including lining fabric) and decor.

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es: María de 43 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia en compañía de su esposo y sus dos hijos19 y 8 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de tamales y además posee una pupuseria con la que genera sus ingresos económicos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos y llevado todos los insumos necesarios a su hogar. María desea realizar reparaciones en el techo y en la pila de su vivienda, es por eso que solicita crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, láminas, etc., para realizar reparaciones en su vivienda.
texts.en: Maria is 43 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and her two children, 19 and 8 years old. She is a hardworking woman who sells tamales, and also owns a "pupusa" (tortillas) store with which she generates her financial income. With it she has supported her children and obtained all the necessary inputs for her home. Maria wants to make repairs in the roof and the sink of her house. This is why she is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, sheets, etc., to make repairs in her house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, sheets, etc. in order to make repairs in her house.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years. Vicenta earns additional income from farming coconut.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Vicenta is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more boxes of different kinds of dried fish to sell for her business.

Vicenta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of different kinds of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 37 years old and married with four children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Adela runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Adela would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 44 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Emelda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Emelda would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal, a 31 year old married mother of two children, has run her mother and child clothes selling shop since 2012. She is a hardworking woman, who puts much effort into supporting her husband in covering their family's needs.

Amal is very aware of her customers' needs and requests, and works hard to be ready for their needs and requests before they ask for things. Since her family's needs are increasing, saving money to increase her business capital is impossible. For this reason, a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, was the best choice. Through this loan, Amal will increase her merchandise with the special Autumn collection, and will be ready for her customers' requests.

She hopes to expand and develop her business with diversified items for different ages.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with the special Autumn collection.

loans.name: Artesanas Santiago Group

texts.en:
The charming and bustling town of Santiago Atitlán is located by a lagoon on the south side of Lake Atitlán, which is about 5,226 feet above sea level. Although in northern climates, the altitude would make it chilly, Santiago Atitlán usually has a spring-like temperature.

Many tourists love to visit the town because of the strikingly bright colors that are the inspiration and hallmark of the “huipiles” (traditional blouses) proudly made and worn by the local Tz’utujil speaking Maya women. Along with the bright flowers on the “huipiles” seen in the above photo, they are also known for their many embroidered bird designs.

Ten women, who did not have the opportunity for a formal education, formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Artesanas Santiago” (Santiago Artisans). The women have spent many years in the artisan and craft business of weaving and embroidering fabrics for “huipiles” that have been commissioned by clients. Some of the women also raise chickens.

“Artesanas Santiago’s” president is Micaela, who is married with two children. Right now, the demand for her textiles is very high and she is getting many orders for her “huipiles.” She is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of typical fabrics and many different colored threads for embroidering. Micaela hopes that in buying these textile supplies, she will be able to improve her “huipiles,” increase her customer base, and generate more income.

Micaela and her Trust Bank companions enjoy being clients of Friendship Bridge through many loan cycles. They have had the opportunity to learn about gender equity, good business investments, and holistic health. These topics and many more are a part of Friendship Bridge’s “Microcredit Plus” program of micro loans and non-formal education that has proven to be a win-win combination for the women, helping them to move from poverty to a brighter and more successful future.

Thank you to all Kiva investors who have contributed to their support and had faith in their ability to move ahead and create a more prosperous tomorrow, benefitting themselves, their families, and their community in Santiago Atitlán!

loans.use: to purchase a variety of typical fabrics and many different colored threads for embroidering.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre y su compañero de vida ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos desde hace 5 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando las puertas y ventanas pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de puertas, balcones para ventanas y pago de mano de obra y asi poder vivir mas seguros y comodos.
texts.en: Mercedes is fifty-one years old, she lives in her own house with her mother and her life partner. For the past five years she has worked selling clothing and shoes, and is able to support herself with her earnings. She would like to make some home improvements, and get new doors and windows, but since she does not have sufficient capital she is requesting a loan to buy doors, window guards and to pay for the cost of labor, and with this live more comfortably and securely.

loans.use: to purchase doors, window guards and pay cost of labor

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a dedicated primary school teacher with a vision of serving his country. He works five days a week and is very proud of the services that he is rendering to his community. He is 23 years old, married, and cares for two dependents who are both in school. Julius is an ardent believer in education with a dream of educating his children to a high level.

After realizing that his meager salary cannot help him realize his dream, Julius decided to venture into other income generating activities such as transport and the produce trade. This will allow him to earn more income to look after his family. With his earnings, he hopes to give his children a quality education. Julius is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business..

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Deusdedit

texts.en:
Deusdedit is 56 years old. He is married and has four children to support. Deusdedit has been in the tailoring business for the last 39 years. He also earns extra income from a hardware shop to meet his family's needs.

Deusdedit has applied for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 from Hofokam Limited to purchase more sewing machines and to add merchandise in his hardware shop. He plans to use the loan to add stock to expand his businesses. Deusdedit's hopes and dreams are to be financially stable and to expand his business, although he is limited by inadequate capital.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing machines and to add merchandise in his hardware shop.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 37 years old, married and has five children. She is engaged in a retail business selling a variety of grocery items in her village. Aside from her retail business, Lilia is also engaged in raising hogs. Out of her income from the business, she is able to send all her children to school. She is proud that her older child has already finished college. Lilia’s husband is a utility worker. Together, both of their incomes serve for their family needs.

Lilia wants to raise her hogs faster so that she can sell them at the right time. Hence, she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

She hopes to further grow the business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Las Magaly Group

texts.en:
Santa Bárbara is a town located in the southwestern part of Guatemala, where both Spanish and Maya K’iche are spoken. It is in an area that is rich with a variety of exotic fruits.

Seven incredibly enthusiastic and optimistic women have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Magaly.” Their businesses range from animal husbandry with chickens and pigs to selling sodas, food, baked goods and lotions, as well as selling cosmetics through a catalogue.

Berta, 43 years old, is the catalogue saleswoman. She sells lotions and cosmetics as well as gold and silver jewelry. Berta is asking for a loan so that she can add to her inventory of cosmetics and lotions because right now is a very good time to have an increased inventory for her sales. She, along with the other members of “Las Magaly,” is asking for loans in order to continue to expand their businesses and increase their profits.

It is important to note that in Guatemala, providing a good education for one’s children is one of the most important things a mother can do! Berta and her friends in the “Las Magaly” Trust Bank are asking for loans not only to eliminate poverty but also to provide an education for their children.

They are also very happy that, in addition to the loans they receive, they also have monthly educational lessons in various topics that can help them with their businesses, as well as help them to empower themselves. These monthly lessons are a part of the Friendship Bridge “Microcredit Plus” Program that combines small loans and education.

When women are able to empower themselves through education, they help to grow their communities and raise children who are educated and healthy. Everyone has the opportunity to step into a brighter future and leave poverty behind! Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: To add to her inventory of cosmetics and lotions for sale.

loans.name: Glenda Edith

texts.es: Glenda de 40 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella posee una tienda desde hace varios años ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, gracias a las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Glenda, 40, is a single mother who lives in her own home with her son.  For several years, she has owned a shop, which is located in her home.  She has many customers because of her good prices and, thanks to her sales, she manages to get ahead.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more wholesale merchandise such as candy, soft drinks, basic grains, coffee soup, eggs, gelatin, sugar, and other items as this is her only source of income.  In this way, she will be able to earn more income, which will enable her to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more wholesale merchandise such as candy, soft drinks, basic grains, coffee soup, eggs, gelatin, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
A 43-year-old married father of one child, this is Samir a hard working father who has been working in transportation business for six years and it is his only source of income.
Samir is working hard to provide his child with the best education so that in the future he can find a better income business, and experience a better living.

Samir's income is barely enough to cover his beloved family's living needs, thus an acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua will help him pay for his child's school tuition fees.
He hopes that one day he can expand and develop his business in a well managed way through increasing the number of cars he can manage to provide more transportation services in his region, and nearby villages.

loans.use: to pay for his child's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Thủy

texts.en:
Mrs Thủy is 36 years old and she is married. She has had a manufacturing business making mesh nets for seven years. Thủy lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in the village and the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

This is Thủy's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan can make her little dream come true.

With her business profit, Thủy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Điệu

texts.en:
Mr. Điệu is 54 years old, and he is married. He has operated a food stall selling fish for more than 10 years.

Mr. Điệu lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. His family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, the market need is low in this region, and the income from this business is not high enough to do what he really needs to do to make his life more comfortable.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns him is that the latrine is not hygienic. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

This is Mr. Điệu's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. He hopes that this loan can make his dream come true.

With his business profit, Điệu hopes to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for his business.

loans.use: To purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is glad that the loan that was previously granted to her has helped her increase sales in her store. Her store earnings also made it possible for her open a small eatery. They may not be rich, but Luzviminda's family is happy and secure in their love for each other.

Luzviminda is again humbly asking for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy ingredients such as fresh chicken, pork, veggies, and seasonings to prepare and cook viands (dishes) at her small eatery. Her neighbors around the community buy food from her on their way home from work. When a household has only two or three members, it is cheaper to buy cooked meals than to cook at home. Luzviminda will be grateful for your financial assistance to support her eatery business.

Luzviminda dreams of having a small restaurant someday and for some of her children to be able to work abroad. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fresh chicken, pork, and seasonings that she needs for her eatery business.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly works hard to support her family. She has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Merly has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Merly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. Lolita is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Lolita requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional variety of fish to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for 10 years now.

Lolita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Grupo La Trinidad Group

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 27 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia de un hijo de la edad de 4 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad denominada San Antonio Suchitepéquez.
Rosa (la que se ubica en medio de las tres de blusa color azul) con el afán de darle a su familia lo mejor desde hace tres años se dedica a la compra y venta de cortes típicos, y con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja como albañil a su familia han sacado adelante. Rosa desde hace algún tiempo a considerado necesario una inversión en su negocio, pues la clientela la busca con mucha frecuencia y sus productos ya no se dan abasto, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para la compra de más productos de cortes típicos y ofrecerle  a sus clientes mejores servicios.
El gran anhelo de Rosa es contar con un local en el mercado regional y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a twenty-seven year-old woman, she is married with a beautiful family and a four-year-old son. This humble family lives in a community called San Antonio Suchitepequez.

Wanting to provide for her family as best as she can, three years ago Rosa (who is pictured in the middle wearing a blue blouse), started buying and selling traditional textiles, and with the help of her husband, who works as a bricklayer, they have supported their family. For a while Rosa has thought it necessary to invest in her business, since her customers call on her often, and she does not have enough product to satisfy the demand. For this reason she is applying for a loan to purchase traditional textiles and better serve her customers. Rosa's dream is to have a stall at the regional market and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase traditional textiles for resale.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Luz is 43 years old, and has three children who are in school.

Ma. Luz has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Luz requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell. Ma. Luz has been in this business for 21 years.

In the future, Ma. Luz would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is 49 years old and married. She works very hard to to help her husband. Merlie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, chips, soap, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Merlie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, chips, soap, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Kifaya

texts.en:
Kifaya is a 50-year-old married mother of three. Ten years ago, she started preparing and selling Mouneh (traditional pickles and preserves) from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker who is well known among her region for her delicious Mouneh.

Kifaya is trying desperately to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary food stuff (thyme, yogurt, groats (cereals), corchorus (a leafy green vegetable), olives, etc.) to increase her production and satisfy her customers' special requests.

Kifaya hopes to develop her business more in the future through opening her own Mouneh shop to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary food stuff (thyme, yogurt, groats, olives, corchorus etc.) to increase her production.

loans.name: Noemi Aida

texts.es: Noemi de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace varios años su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Noemí, 57, lives in her own home with her daughter.  She has been engaged in selling clothing for several years, and her business is located in her home.  She has many customers, and the income she earns from her sales helps her pay household expenses.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more wholesale clothing, which will enable her to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase more wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Mylene works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell fresh fish. Mylene is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets to use for her fishing business.

Mylene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets use for fishing.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina works hard to support her family. Marina is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Marina requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Marina has been in this business for 3 years now.

Marina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maricor

texts.en:
Maricor is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 50 years old and has one child in school.

She has a furniture-making business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed like bamboo sticks, etc.

Maricor has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her furniture-making business like bamboo sticks, etc.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 61 years old and has one child in school.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like pants, shirts, etc.

Letecia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like pants, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lucia is 57 years old, and has two children who are in school.

Lucia has a business buying and selling condiments in the Philippines. Lucia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to to buy garlic and other items to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Lucia has been in this business for 11 years.

In the future, Lucia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy garlic and other items to sell.

loans.name: Mohamed Billoh

texts.en:
This is 32 year-old Mohamed. He is married, and has 2 children aged 6 and 2 years old. In 2004, Mohamed established his lubricant and provisions business. He began his business because he wants to take care of his family. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 1,800,000 SLL every month from this business.

His business is located at the city centre and his main customers are adults. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL5000000. Mohamed requires a new loan in order to buy 2 cartons of milk, 2 cartons of Ovaltine, sugar and different types of engine oil for resale. He hopes that this loan will help to maximize profit and to carter for more customers.

In the future, Mohamed plans to engage in the selling more provisions as the lubricant business is doing well. . He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions for his general store and also different types of engine oils.

loans.name: Than's Group

texts.en:
At the age of 40, Than, who lives in Kampong Cham province, is single. To make a living, she is making Khmer noodles to sell and she has been involved in this business for 22 years. Her main business earns her about 38,700 KHR per day and enables her to save about 28,700 KHR.

Because there are fewer clients who purchase her Khmer noodles, she earns just a decent daily income and lacks working capital to rescue the business from the danger. This is the first time for Than applying for a loan from VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her loan to build a stove to make Khmer noodles. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase income and improve living conditions.

loans.use: to build a stove to produce more Khmer noodles to sell so that she can increase her income to save for future needs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Hà

texts.en:
Mrs Hà is 36 years old and she is married. She has had a manufacturing business making wood furniture for seven years. Hà lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village and the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is that her latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

This is Hà's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan can make her little dream come true

With her business profit, Hà hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee desde hace 10 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Haydee, 57, lives in her own home with her husband.  For ten years, she has owned a small shop, located in her home.  She has many customers because of the good prices, and her kindness when making sales.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet bread, and other items.  In this way, she will be able to have better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet bread, and other items.

loans.name: Ena Maribel

texts.es: Ena tiene 35 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee desde hace 5 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ena is 35 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and two children. For the last five years, she has had a small shop in her place of residence. She has many customers because of the good prices and her amiability in her sales.

She is requesting a new loan to be able to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet breads etc. so that she can have greater earnings for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet breads etc.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en: Ruby is 41  years old and married. She owns and operates a transportation business with the help of her husband who provides transportation services to the local community members. She has been in the business for seven years and earns 10,000 PHP per month. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used to repaint and buy a new brake pad and accessories for her motorcycle. She is now taking a new loan to buy accessories and tires for her motorcycle for safe travel with the customers. Ruby plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy accessories and tires for her motorcycle

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mila works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling spices. Mila is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy a variety of vegetables to sell in her vegetable business.

Mila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosalia is 38 years old, and her five children are in school.

Rosalia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rosalia requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell. Rosalia has been in this business for 18 years.

In the future, Rosalia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elsie is 45 years old, and has one child in school.

Elsie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Elsie requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell. Elsie has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Elsie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.
